review_body: From the day we checked in till we checked out, there was not a thing we could fault about this property! The check-in was swift and the receptionist was super friendly. I remember her smiling sweetly all the time as she talked. My boyfriend and I stayed 6 nights at Glad Mapo last year - although we paid an extra night of room charge to keep our luggages and to refresh before leaving for our late night flight, it was okay as we did not expect a city hotel to provide us a FOC shower room. Prior to our arrival, I sent a request to the hotel team to ask for a room on a quieter/higher floor with beautiful city view as we're there to celebrate our anniversary. I definitely did not expect anything more than what I'd requested but we were shocked that they upgraded us to a suite with a living room and huge bathroom as a surprise for us. It was a very, very lovely gesture! The room was spotlessly clean and huge with modern and comfortable interior. Water pressure from the shower was strong enough which was a + point for my criteria.The highlight has got to be this - I asked if they had an ironing board in the room and the next thing I knew, we received a room with an automatic Steam Styler machine. All our crumpled clothes came out straightened within 10 minutes. BRILLIANT.We constantly had the DND sign hung on our room door throughout our stay as we strictly do not like stranger in our room be it in our presence or not.. but the cleaner was very thoughtful. At every opportunity she saw us leaving the hotel room, she would ask if we needed to empty our dustbins in the room or if we needed more toilet rolls, drinking water and other amenities - all while doing sign languages as we had language barrier : ) Location of property was lovely - Once we stepped out of Exit 9 of Gongdeok Station, it is right there in front of the escalator. Direct train to and from the airport (be sure to check departure time through your phone so you won't have to wait too long!) and easy subway connection to many other tourist attractions!Some people may not like this but we absolutely love that this hotel is surrounded by office towers - It is so peaceful at night and there are lots of restaurants (both cheap & expensive - and the food is great!) within walking distance. If you need a convenient store, there is even a 7-11 inside the hotel where you can find cheap and good eats like korean bento boxes if you need a quick hunger fix. Being an ex-hotelier myself at a prestigious resort, I would say the level of service, room comfort, location etc. is great value for the price they charge. Highly recommended if you do not want to splurge too much on hotel. We will be returning to Seoul in October this year and we can't wait to stay at Glad Mapo again!

review_body: As mentioned on several reviews, this hotel is steps away from the Gongdeok metro (exit 9).The hotel itself is very nice, clean and quiet, and the staff is very friendly.There is not much touristy around the hotel, but the Seoul metro is easy and cheap.I would stay again.

review_body: We were pleasantly surprised when entering our room. It was reasonably priced but felt upscale because of the size and amenities. Their staff in every instance were attentive and gracious. The restaurant had a breakfast and dinner buffet that was good. The location at Gouong Doek station made it easy to access the subway system Our experience in the Glad Hotel compared very favorably to our accommodations in Fukuoka and in Shimane, Japan. The Glad was a 5 star experience for us.

review_body: So many things that pleased me about this hotel. First of all, the train ended directly at the hotel, making it so convenient. Our room was large and spacious, with wide windows overlooking the city. The bathroom had a large walk in shower. Service is top notch throughout the hotel. The M dining room staff is helpful, courteous and professional as well. It was the nicest experience for my first visit to Seoul.

Staff is very welcoming.Beautiful reception with a 7eleven.Location is top.Missing this hotel, will come back for sure.Thanks Glad mapo

review_body: I stayed in Glad Mapo for 5 nights! The Superior Double was very clean, tidy and most importantly comfortable!Staff was extremely friendly and helpful in assisting in check-in and out and also gave useful information how to go to the airport cause I had a flight at midnight. Thanks for everything!There is a convenience store (7-eleven) in their reception area! Note that it is too close from Gongdeok station which connected 4 line. review_body: Mr Eavun Paril is very kind and he did help me a lot with my problem of the room. The room is delicate and not that expensive. There is no doubt that I will live here again when I come to Seoul next time.

review_body: The location of the hotel is excellent, it is reachable by the metro from the airport and is close by all the historical sites. Within the vicinity there is plenty of bars, great cafes, and restaurants. Everything in the room was new, clean, and fresh.Initially I was allocated to the room that was on the 10th floor and rather dark, however when I addressed the issue, Eric Kim at the front desk was very accommodating and swiftly and effortlessly moved me to a different room with a stunning view that was above my expectations. It made my stay at Seoul special and I would definitely stay at the same hotel again.

review_body: I have stayed at Glad Mapo twice now as a solo traveller. It’s location is perfect for exploring Seoul, with Gongdeok station right by the hotel, which connects to many underground lines, including the airport Arex route.The rooms are spacious and very clean. Staff are helpful. The breakfast is quite pricey, but other than that, I would recommend it.

0    GLAD Mapo

review_body: It’s at Gongdeok Station which is on the metro airport line (51 min from Incheon airport). You have to take to Seoul station to take arex to Incheon airport (45min for 9000won including 500 won deposit which you can refund at the machines immediately. Hotel is near exit 9 or 10) and you have to switch at exit 9 to other lines. The hotel is right in front of exit 9 once you exit. It’s not near myeongdong but there is a Gongdeok food street and market near exit 8. Plenty of eateries which run into late nights. There is a lotte mart if you walk further. Overall clean and comfortable hotel.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even Proper Airlines will provide you with toothbrush and toothpaste for overnight flights, but not this hotel, not even if you call the housekeeping. So Glad Hotel Mapo has to be a budget hotel. Moreover this hotel provide tiny little cup with coffee powder, with no creamer, no sugar, no teaspoon. Shocking! Not even a 3 star standard.Housekeeping does not refill tissue paper, and does not wash the tiny little cup for you.Power outlet is limited, and some not working. This is just painfully time consuming if you have multiple devices to charge.Hotel staffs have no idea about the hotel surrounding and incapable to provide any directions.Hotel is inflexible and have sympathy to customers who desperately need to leave days earlier, they still charge you for nights you didn’t stay. This hotel is not customer oriented and not helpful.No much in surrounding. If someone needs to stay near All stops airport train station, may want consider hotels near Hongdae instead, which has more places to shop and dine in surrounding.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a solo traveler, I often have to stay at budget places like Airbnbs and hostels. But, I wanted to spend my last night in Seoul at a nicer hotel and stumbled upon Glad Mapo. What an amazing surprise it was! The rooms and facilities are very clean and chic. The rooms have a wide desk with outlets for people traveling for work and also a comfy sofa like chair with a side table to eat on or do some work while watching some tv. The beds are big and very soft. The bathrooms are extremely clean and well lit. The shower space is large and the toilets are equipped with bidets. The hotel also has a 7-11 and some restaurants inside. It is also located right in front of a subway stop for easy travel and there are lots of great coffee and food shops near by. The checkin staff was friendly and helpful. My only regret was that I had a very early flight the next morning and couldn't stay longer!

Wifi good.7-Eleven store in the hall in front of reception.

The location is convenient as it's next to the Airport Line Station Gongdeok (exit 9). We can find eating places near the hotel. However, the breakfast at the hotel fall short of our expectations. review_body: I used to stay in glad hotel yeouido which is a good hotel, but this time I chose Mapo because of the location. The Reception staff here is not satisfied me. As a tourist when I m asking for food recommendations and directions around hotel at mid-night, I wish hotel staff can give me more information, not just reply “ you can find it on the street outside the hotel” and not willing to have further conversation is also showing off on her face. The second thing I m not satisfied is the house keeping. I do not get bottle of water refill everyday, and the house keeping is too annoying to get us out from the room to do cleaning. She asked me 3 times within 2 hrs, and ask when will I go out so she could do the cleaning... (P.S it is 10 am in the morning, not late afternoon) that ridiculous and rude.. we booked 2 rooms. One of the room is filled with odour like toilet drainages smell. Overall this is not my preference hotel, but the location is good, just 1 mins to gongteok station. The check-in and check-out staffs are friendly.

review_body: Hotel is very well located in the Mapo area and is easily accessible by Airport express bus service from the Seoul Airport. The bus drops you about a 150 meters from the Hotel. Though the reception of the hotel is located on the 8th Floor but is easily accessible by elevator. Rooms are compact but comfortable. You have a number of cafes and restaurants around the hotel and also one of these is located on the ground floor. The breakfast was good. The staff is cordial and eager to help Though the forex exchange machine in the reception lounge was not working despite the hotel staff also trying their hand at it.. but no grudges as a number of banks are almost next door.. would love to stay again during my next visit in Seoul, South Korea.

review_body: Location, location, location. Easy metro access from both airports in Seoul. The hotel is basically in front of Gongdeok station (blue line) exit 9 from the airport.... brown line and purple line also cross here. Room was cozy and comfortable. AC is tricky to set and turn on/off. There is a 7-11 next to the lobby. Breakfast was more than sufficient with ample choices... and breakfast room was open, airy, and comfortable. Lots of restaurants (both local and Western) within walking distance. Great service and friendly staff. Great place to stay.

review_body: My family and I stayed in Glad Mapo for 6 nights! The rooms were very clean, tidy and most importantly comfortable! (took some photos of our room - Deluxe Family Twin, photos attached for reference!)Staff was extremely friendly and helpful in assisting in check-in and out and also gave useful tips for our trips! Thanks Elena for the great help They have convenience stores (7-eleven) in their reception area! Super convenient for those who might want to have a maggi supper. Not forgetting that I had went to the gym during my last day before I check-out. I was wowed by their facilities, everything was so well maintained and super clean! They also provides towels and bottled water Will definitely stay back this hotel when I come back to Korea next time! Highly recommended!!

review_body: We have stayed in this hotel twice in a span of less than a month (end of December and early January). Both stays were pleasant.Check-in and check-out were seamless and fast. Front office staff including the so-called concierge on ground floor were friendly and courteous.The main reasons why we chose this hotel because the location is right outside Gongdeok train station (exit 9) – there’s a direct train to/ from Incheon airport and tourists staying in this hotel tend to have good manners (they queue outside lift, they keep their voice in considerably low volume). The amenities inside the room are great. We love the shampoo/ body lotion range by Beaudiani, plus the body sponge. The room has UK/AU-compatible power outlet as well as USB outlet. Very good and fluffy bedding. Bed sheets and pillow covers were spotless.The hotel is safe. We came with four big luggage and sometimes we left the luggage open/ unlocked and went out for the whole day. Everything was intact.There are many eateries around the hotel. We speak hangul so it’s pretty easy for us explore the area and try some eateries, including those in small unknown alleys (there’s one super yummy and always busy kimchi jjigae place across the road/ the opposite of Mini Stop).PS: Those who are coffee addicts – there are some cafes around the hotel. But if you are too lazy to go out, there’s 7-Eleven on the lobby level. Its coffee latte is pretty comparable to those from 7-Eleven in Melbourne.

review_body: Take AREX (all-stop) from Incheon airport and alight at Gongdeok station. Train may be full with tourists with big baggages so be prepared to stand for almost an hour. Look out for Exit 9, and exit the station from there. Hotel is situated right outside Exit 9 when you come up from the escalator. Lots of food options right outside of the hotel. Hotel room is spacious and provides toiletries. Clean room. Pleasant stay.

Given it’s not right smack in Myeongdong but if you prefer the quieter side this is the place to be. The quality of the bed is really amazing. Probably one of the best hotel beds I’ve ever experienced. After a long day of sightseeing, a comfy bed is crucial. Service is good. And pricing is pretty reasonable. Highly recommended.

0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two things stand out for us when we stayed at Glad Mapo:1. The hotel is easily accessible from the airports using the Airport Railway. You'll be under shelter all the way from the airport to the hotel and back. It is also a convenient location to get to most places that we wanted to visit in Seoul. And it was nice to come back to an area that's relatively quiet after jostling with lots of people in the busy shopping areas in the city. If you want to spend most of your time in busy Myeongdong, don't stay here. Other than that, I think this is a wonderful base to enjoy the city.2. The beds were one of the most comfortable found in hotels, even better than those I experienced in some more expensive hotels. So you can be assured of a good night's sleep.Our experience at this hotel started positively with an early check-in by the friendly person at the front desk, Sunny. We liked what we saw in the room. The tea and coffee from CBTL was a nice touch as is the in-built bidet on the toilet seat.If you intend to stay here, be warned that they don't provide toothbrush & toothpaste, as many reviewers have mentioned. I don't think they provide a shaving kit too, though they may provide one if you ask. We didn't ask as I brought my own.3 things that lowered the overall rating for us:1. As mentioned in many reviews, the toilet floor gets wet after someone uses the shower. This is due to the poor design of the bath tub cum shower. This is something that can be easily rectified & I hope the hotel will do that soon.2. It seems strange to us that the hotel provides cups, tea bags & coffee but no spoon!3. The room could do with a brighter set of lights. This seems to be the norm in many hotels that we have stayed in recent times.For the price & benefits, we would stay here again.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Glad Mapo is the choice to be in SeoulLocation: The location is super good: It´s located between Seoul Station and Hongik University, direct at metro station. From the airport you can take the all stop train which will bring you directly to the hotel at Gongdeok station (exit 9). You can take the metro to every destination and even a taxi from the legendary "Octagon" club is only 10 Euro. Room: The rooms are big and very well equiped. The shower and the whole bathroom is very nice and comfortable. The beds are very nice and i can´t remember when i slept so well in a hotel bed. Staff: Staff is friendly and can speak english (mostly)Breakfast: Breakfast was okay, very korean but yeah you are in Korea and also the european guests will find something good. All over highly recommended for a nice and comfortable stay in Seoul!
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Out of my stays in Korea (3 hotels in total in a 9 day trip) this is probably the best of the 3 (one of which is the Conrad Seoul...right?!?!)This is the first of the 3 hotel stay, took the airport train to Gongdeok and exit 9 and it was right in front of the hotel ground floor. Super convenient!!! And yes there is an elevator from the train station to the street level to walk to the hotel for my heavy luggage travelers!Lobby is on the upper level so you do have to take an elevator up and there is a small 7-11 in the lobby as well (double plus!) check in was smooth and seamless and was even upgraded on the house for a 2 bed room (my mistake in thinking we booked a double bed) I got a room on the 18th floor? The room was spacious for 2 guests with a seating area for coats and shoes in the front by the door. Complimentary bottled water. Bathroom is spacious for most Asian hotels standard. Definitely can fit 2 people in there. Shower had a waterfall head as well as the handheld. Toilet had a bidet and sink had enough counter space for 2 girls and their skincare! They even provide facial pads in case you forgot yours.The beds are more on the firmer side which i preferred. The desk area had a removable mirror which i used by the window-side to get a natural lighting to do make up. The curtains didnt close all the way but minor issue, nothing a hair clip couldnt solve.The cleaning staff seem to remembered us as she asked if we wanted our rooms cleaned and remember the next day that we only spoke english and asked if we wanted towels even if we didnt want our rooms cleaned.Overall, my whole experience has been great. The only MINOR downfall was there was no train directly to myeongdong and we were there a lot! But the bus came often too so we did that instead. Getting to Hongdae is easy!
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this at a friend’s recommendation. Had an enjoyable stay. Room is very clean and comfortable. Lots of meal options available around the area. Airport express + subway lines are right at the doorstep. Could not ask for more.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Glad Mapo for six nights in October. I booked there because it was ranked #1 at Trip Advisor. The location was very convenient. We took the AREX train from Incheon Airport and got off at the Gondeok station. Walked out of the subway station walked a few meters and walked into the hotel! Everything was clean and room size was adequate. Unfortunately, the bathroom had a foul odor which I think was coming up from the sewer so I was moved from a room with a walk in shower to a room with a bathtub. The bathtub was constructed so when I showered, the water splashed on the bathtub surround and ran onto the floor so I had to stuff a face cloth near the half wall of glass to reduce the flow. Also, all the bathrooms could stand safety bars to prevent slipping. Because it was October, air conditioning was off in the whole building and sometimes it was a bit warm in the room even the ought window was opened by me. I understand many hotels in Korean turn off the air conditioning in October and don't turn it back on until April or May. Despite these inconveniences, if I return to Seoul, I would definitely try to stay there again.In the nearby area, there were many good restaurants-- the area is famous for its grilled galbi, and there were convenience stores, a super market, an economy department store, cosmetic stores, and pharmacy nearby. There was a good Italian restaurant very close by. And the front desk would exchange up to $200 per day which was convenient.

review_body: We spent 3 nights here. It’s an awesome place. Easy access to the Train Station makes it easy to get to everything. Shopping using this hotel as a base is great. The room was comfortable and clean. The staff are helpful and friendly. We will definitely be back again.

review_body: My husbund and I stayed here for 4 nights in the junior suite. Initially we book for the twin bedroom, but they offered us upgrad for free of charge. What a pleasent surprise. We found this place nice because of their Professional and kind staffs, clean and spacious room particular. Also we like it’s convenient location to go to the inchon Airport by limousine bus. There are serveral subway lines in front of this hotel, so it was easy to travel around. Also there is E-mart one block away, so we could go there to do some shopping before we fly out. Many restaurants and coffee shops and convenient stores in the neighborhood. Hotel’s reception(Lobby) was located at the 9th floor. I can’t say enough about how interior was tastefully done including comfortable beddings, spacious bathroom and extra toilet by the entrance, even there was a steam cleaning closet(?) installed in the living room. Overall this is very nice hotel for both business and sightseeing travelers. We would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to south korea for sure. 대중교통이용이 편리합니다. 특히 공항 리무진 버스를 타는 곳이 길 건너에 있고 시내버스 및 전철역 이용이 매우 용이합니다, 호텔안과 방 모두 깨끗하고, 특히 욕실, 침대와 시트등이 잘 구비되어 있으며 매우 편했습니다. 리셉션의 스태브들이 친절하고 체크아웃 이후에 짐을 맡길 수도 있어서 좋았습니다.호텔옆에 이마트가 바로 있으며, 뒷 골목으로는 먹자골목처럼 움식점들과 커피숍이 많이 있습니다. 전반적으로 외국인들에게 추천할 만한 좋은 호텔이였습니다. 감사합니다!

review_body: I am very happy to stay here, the hotel is new and very clean. The room is big. The lobby is not on the ground floor, but it doesn't matter. 7-11 is on the same floor as the receptionist. It opens till late at night, very comfortable.The breakfast menu is varied. The hotel also has a good location. Exit # 9 faces Gongdeok station (direct train to Incheon and Gimpo airport).
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I hesitated to give a 5 star review, as normally I would reserve that for a true luxury hotel. Mapo Glad is what I would describe as an upscale urban traveler/student hotel. It’s new, fresh, clean and modern, with a minimalist industrial vibe. Our room on the 23rd floor had a nice view, was very comfortable, ergonomic, and quiet. There were a few minor issues though, which I’ll get to later.Two main reasons for the 5 star review: Value and Location. You cannot beat the location, its perfect for visiting Seoul. The main entrance is literally at the Dongdeok subway entrance (exit 9, btw),covered so even in foul weather you will stay dry. This gives you the 5, 6 lines as well as the Airport train. That airport train is the one you can take to Seoul Station where you can get the express train to ICN airport. Highly recommend that, and if you get there several hours in advance of your flight you can drop your bags there and check them in for your flight, skipping the check-in line at the airport (at least if you fly KAL). So you get get anywhere from there.The price is pretty amazing given the quality of the hotel and including a good breakfast. On our last trip we stayed at the Ritz Carlton, now Le Meridian. Despite the amenities there, given the price, we will come back to Mapo Glad. Pros: Impeccable location. Convenient to everything, including several restaurants in the building, many nearby, the 7-11 in the lobby, and an E-mart up the street. They have everything.Price, as mentioned is pretty unbeatable. Breakfast is good, the dining room is large and comfortable. (The new age piano music leaves something to be desired, however). Our deluxe king was excellent, especially the bedsheets. Best ever!! We wanted to buy them all, but they didn’t have them in stock, or we would have. Sooo comfortable, trust me.Cons: The bath-shower was designed by a fool. If you stand up to shower, all the water is designed to go directly onto the bathroom floor. I mean it will flood in seconds. Call and ask for an extra half dozen towels and line the edge of the tub before you shower, that will soak up the water. They are nice about this but it’s a design flaw so that’s the only solution.The lighting is too dim in the entry open-closet area. Too dark to pack or organize your suitcase there. Likewise the bathroom is too dark - no good lighting at the mirror. Should have bar lights around the mirror or the equivalent. In short, this is our new go-to hotel in Seoul.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and it's convenient to all spots. Two metros, one railway, and one airport express are all just around the corner. There are also good restaurants and cafes nearby. The room is big and the bed is comfortable.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located good, very clean, got a free upgrade to deluxe room, good fiew, rich breakfast buffet, room size sufficient, room equipment modern and more than adequate. Rooms look new. Our contact person Mr. Eric Kim very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No complaints yet! Location is near the main road, nearby lots of restaurants & coffee shops and most important a walk away to the nearest subway station. Was greeted very nicely by Eric Kim at the counter. Thanks Glad Mapo!
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights at Glad Mapo, but wish we could have stayed longer! Easy access to the subway - which is right across the driveway. We took the airport express right to the Geondok station and the hotel is at the top of exit #9. There is a Starbucks a 2 minute walk from the doors, and several other restaurants or coffee shops nearby. The room was clean and comfy. Will definitely stay here on our next visit.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a total 100% satisfied guest of Glad Mapo. This is one of the best decision that i've made for my recent Seoul Trip (7-15 Sep 2018). The location is very convenient, adjacent to the Gongdeok station entrance 9. The metro is literally just right at the doorstep. You need to take the lift up to lobby floor for check-in. Check in was efficient, done within 5 min. The Room is huge and clean, my boyfriend and i had the best sleeping quality at this hotel thanks to the comfortable bed. Oh and not to forget about the bathroom, i especially love the toilet bowl that come with warm seater and many other functions (not many hotel provide this kind of facilities). The bath amenities smell great too. Another great advantage of this hotel is its 24h operated 7-11 located at the lobby floor, that you can grab snacks/ drinks anytime without stepping out of the hotel. Totally recommended to stay at this hotel for 5 Stars experience with affordable price. Will definitely come back again.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Glad, Mapo for 5 nights during our recent visit to Seoul.Location was perfect. Hotel entrance was virtually connected to subway station which could be reached via airport train and its prime location helped us try other places of Seoul very easily. Furthermore, room was very clean and neat with every perfect piece of furnishing. We could not believe the room price for its high quality level.We really enjoyed staying here and will try it again. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is brand new in an amazing location. It's right next to one of Seoul's main subway lines. As you exit the subway, the hotel is right in front of you. Literally right in front. You don't even need to cross the street to get to it. The room is well designed and very modern. The staff are also very friendly. If you want a late night snack, there is even a self-contained 7-eleven inside the hotel lobby. I've been to lots of different hotels for work and holiday and this is probably the best one I've stayed at for this price point. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just had a really great stay at this GLAD hotel. After a long journey the check-in process was effortless. In addition, the staff knew it was my wife's birthday and they had prepared a birthday cake some cups as presents. It was a really nice touch and we'd like to make a special mention of Esther and Alex for their caring contribution to our stay. Aside from this unexpected surprise, we were also upgraded to a larger room! So you can imagine we were quite thrilled with the place before stepping foot in the room. During our stay the service and facilities mirrored the outstanding attention we had already received. The staff was sure to point us in the right direction when venturing out into the city and the gym had some nice facilities that were conveniently located near the lobby. We will not hesitate to stay here again for our next visit to Seoul and we highly recommend this hotel for anybody looking for staff and service that go above and beyond the standards of most hotels. Special thanks to Julie at the front desk for helping us on the first day!
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 어메니티 침구류 청소상태 배쓰롭까지 만족스러웠습니다. 줄리씨가 몹시 친절했습니다. I really had great time here in glad mapo and quality of ammenities, bedding and bath robe were amazing. clean and gladly serviced by Julie at the reception.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mr. Dylan -FOM absolutely professional. Went extra mile to make us feel welcome. From early checking after mid night flight, arranging amenities and departure gift. The hotel location is really good, easy access to AREX line and plenty of good bbq restaurant around. Will surely go back.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 首先感謝前臺讓我入住，並提前進入房間。這是一個安靜的地區，附近有很多咖啡店和商店，還有很多餐館，而且從機場來的位置非常好，很容易找到並推薦給任何來首爾的人。First thanks for the front-desk to let me check in and enter the room earlier. It's a quiet area, many cafe shop and store nearby, many kind of restaurant and the location is great from airport, it's easily to find and recommend for anyone who visit Seoul.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love the facilities, warm staffs, and the location. I will stay at any of Glad Hotel after this. It is easy to find this hotel and even if you lost, Korean knew about this place. In fact, they also provided a place to keep your luggage safe. Do not hesitate and please choose this hotel. I had a great experience there!
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there two different times over a 2 week period. Had great service both times. The rooms were clean and relatively large. They are happy to keep your luggage after checking out, if you have some extra time in town. As others state, Subway exit 9 takes you right to hotel. I would suggest using exit 8 if not toting luggage. It is a shorter walk and brings you out very near the hotel as well.
hotelName:
0    GLAD Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed staying here. Location is perfect if you only have a couple of nights in Seoul. Easy to get to from airport vis KAL Limousine. Staff were great Room was comfortable although not large. Price was reasonable. Great gym.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed in this hotel 4 or 5 times and each time the quality deteriorates just a little. This time my room seemed smaller than before. I had barely enough space to open my suitcase. The bed was a queen-size rather than a king-size, which was unusual. The desk was small and difficult to sit at without banging my knees. The bathroom was ok and the shower itself was powerful although the shower gel and shampoo were both tiny. The corridor had a bad smell, a bit like dirty vacuum bags.All that said, the hotel's location is fantastic. You don't even need to leave the building to reach the department store, food court, and the underground railway network. Right across the road, you've got the funky shopping area full of great food options. The Limousine bus from the airport drops you right outside.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 6 nights. Experienced good service, great accessibility to all must go places, brilliantly clean rooms with breathtaking views. Felt so serene and safe in this hotel. Couldnt ask for anything more. Is simply impressive and I am blown away. Well done, staff and mgt in Lotte Hotel Seoul!
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I first booked two rooms at this hotel through agoda, I didn’t realize that these two rooms would be at two different towers. We first arrived and checked in at the older main tower when we found out about this and were told to check in for our second room at the Executive tower. The lobby for the executive tower was at a higher level and it apparently looked newer and more stylish than the main tower. There were some couches to sit on even though the lobby was not as big as the main tower (big lobby but lacking seats) and I was even offered something to drink. I guess that’s where your extra money goes to, as the executive tower is a bit more pricey than the main. For swimming pools, we needed to go to the main tower, but I didn’t complain as we spent the bulk of our time exploring the Myeongdong areas for food and shopping. I also found out later that the hotel was also connected to the Lotte Department Store through an escalator at the Main Tower Lobby (a plus point during those rainy days). The room we got was a grand deluxe double rooms which were connected to each other. Each of the room was a good size, esp. if you have younger kids traveling with you. They also provided a Nespresso coffee machine. Hotel staff were also very polite and attentive. On one of our nights there, we ordered room service and my recommendation for room service is to order the Korean food (even though you have cheaper options out there in Myeongdong, but they close around 10-11, so if your stomach’s grumbling past 11, room service is your best bet). We ordered Beef Bulgogi and it was really good. For a luxury 5 star hotel in the Myeongdong area, there were close to none, except for the Lotte hotel. There was one other one that we were also considering, but it looked a bit old and further from the crowded shopping areas of Myeongdong.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there last month for five days. The hotel is located next to subway station and shopping district, Myeongdong. It’s connected to subway station as well as department store. Very convenient location for tourists too. Also, it’s walkable distance to business district. My office is located in jonggak, and it took only 10 mins by walk :) I had breakfast at club lobby lounge, the food was nice and even the view was great.The hotel room was a bit small though. The gym was spacious and they have various workout machines. Also the lobby bar was stunning. Atmosphere, wine selection, live band and service, everything was satisfactory.Lastly, I really appreciated the service. All staffs were so kind and nice. Thanks again.I would love to visit again.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first time in South Korea and what a welcome!We arrived by Limousine Coach (16,000SKW/person) from Incheon Airport, which dropped us at the hotel.The staff at the Lotte Hotel Seoul are wonderful! Welcoming, warm and so helpful.We asked for an early check-in as we arrived in Seoul early, which they were more than happy to do. We also got a free upgrade, which was a nice surprise!Our room was exceptional: stylish, clean and with a great view of the city. Attention to detail is everything; down to receiving a hand-written note from the hotel manger wishing us a pleasant stay. It is located near a metro station, but we walked everywhere. Either way, you are within easy reach of all that Seoul has to offer.On our last night we had a cocktail in Pierre’s Bar at the top of the Executive Tower, which has great views of Seoul. It is a wonderfully intimate bar, which reminded us of the Beaufort Bar at The Savoy, in London.It was a magical introduction to our first (and definitely not last) time in South Korea!
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was great. It was spacious and its beds were really comfortable. The staffs at lounge were very friendly and professional. Also, its location was great for the tour. Many tourist attractions such as Myeong-dong and Deoksugung palace were easily accessible. I will definitely come back here again when I visit Seoul next time.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved everything about this beautiful hotel. We stayed in the executive lounge rooms, which were very well appointed and very comfortable. The executive lounge experience was delightful, and the staff very amicable and attentive. Staff are very well trained, and we enjoyed the interaction with them. Hotel is ideally located with a huge department store underneath, and the street shopping very close by. Starbucks and convenience stores all located around the hotel. 10 out of 10.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this wonderful hotel. Very luxurious. Great location. Superb gourmet restaurant, “Pierre Gaignaire.”But, wanted to give special thanks to concierge Carolyn, who went above and beyond the call of duty for us during our stay. Very knowledgeable, professional & efficient. Yet friendly and approachable. She and her team are to be commended for providing superior service to guests of the hotel!!
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This email is to compliment Vivian Kim (Front Desk) and other 2 staffs that provide excellent services during my stay. We are family of 4 and we spent 4 nights in May 2019 at Lotte Hotel main tower, to celebrate my mother’s Birthday. We had request for early check-in and complimentary Birthday cake. Vivian had went above and beyond to arrange surprise event for my mother. The other 2 staffs brought the Birthday cake and flowers. We were very happy and definitely will stay here again. We’ve been staying in many 5 stars hotels all over the world, but Lotte Hotel was an exceptional experiences. Your staffs have been trained well. We can felt that their services are out from their hearts. One minor points is the bath-tub which has high boundary which might not be suitable with elders.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrive earlier than check in time and was told there was no room available and to check back at 1pm. I asked the staff behind the counter if I can leave my number and have her call me once the room is ready. I got a "sorry, no."So I thought maybe she didn't understand my simple request in English and asked her again. She was like "no". I mean, wow!
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel with great location, easy access to underground and amenities. Staff extremely friendly and helpful as we arrived a couple of hours before check-in and our room was not ready, we were given an upgrade. Cannot recommend enough.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable beds, great amenities, good bar and restaurants in the hotel , clean and well appointed rooms. a bit of a slow check in and out but overall efficient staff. They also have a VAT refund for the room price
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel for a business trip. I stayed for 2 nights. Rooms I would say has the essentials for a business trip. Fast internet access, comfortable bed, a desk with some office supplies. Small closet, but if you’re there for a short stay, it’s enough. Clean room, bathroom With essentials.Excellent breakfast.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was spacious and had a great view. The location is perfect for travellers. It’s right next to lotte department store, which has a supermarket where you can find some good quality food for late night snacks. Staff were also very nice and were willing to help us. I’d like to visit this hotel again
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is superb, close to good restaurants, close to City Hall and a short taxi ride to many tourist attractions. It’s also in the central business district. The hotel is large and quite impersonal, even on the Club Floors and at the Club Lounge. I think that’s because it caters largely to hordes of Chinese visitors who come to buy from the duty free shop – Lotte Duty Free – right next to the hotel. The rooms are small and quite dark, made even darker by the dark brown “wood” used for the dresser, desk and backboard behind the bed, and the black granite tops as well as the large black panels on the walls. The bathroom is especially strange. A largely transparent curtain can be lowered to cover the glass separating the bedroom area from the bathroom, so there’s not much privacy, and the bathtub – there is no separate shower – is perilously high. Getting in and out is truly dangerous for anyone but the most agile. And running the shower in the tub, even with the shower curtain carefully tucked in, still results in a flooded floor. I can’t imagine that it doesn’t damage the ceilings below. In short, the hotel is in desperate need of a makeover. That said, breakfast in the Club Lounge is generous, though some items are never replaced, e.g. the meat and cheese, and the evening Happy Hour is also quite generous. They also were generous providing a 2:30 check-out without additional charge.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose to stay in the Executive Tower. From the reception desk on the 15th floor, to beautifully appointed room with its seating alcove by the window, Nespresso coffee machine, Evian mineral water and Diptyque amenities, it was luxe and comfort all the way. The gym with a large selection of machines and weights made for great workouts.Service was polite and discreet.And it's location right next to the subway and on top of the Lotte department store made traveling and shopping really convenient.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1st trip to Seoul for both my partner & I after a few days in Busan. Did my research online and Lotte hotel had great reviews and seemed to be located exactly where we want to be especially being our first trip to Seoul we want to be in Central Seoul. We tend to stay on club floor for more privileges but I am a little disappointed this time. We were only allowed to have daily buffet breakfast in club lounge and have to pay if we choose to dine in main buffet restaurant which is a first in all the hotels' club rooms we have stayed in. I choose to pay more for a room on club floor for additional privileges and do not see why i should pay (again) because i want to dine in the main restaurant. That said, the food variety is pretty good in the club lounge but i would prefer to have options. Overall, the hotel is pretty on par for a five star hotel but i advise smokers to consider other hotels if you do not want to walk 150m each way to the nearest smoking 'box'... they have smoking floors/rooms but i do not like to sleep in an 'ashtray'. The hotel do not have a smoking area so the nearest point to smoke is outside the Lotte Mall which is adjacent to the hotel. Their front office, especially the staff at club check-in, are extremely helpful and friendly. Front office at the lobby are always quick to greet with a smile which is nice. All in, it has not been exceptional but it is reasonable and rooms are great sized with fabulous amenities. I am not sure I will choose to stay here again next time I visit but i recommend it if you want to be close to Myeongdong and most of the sites in central Seoul - we walked to jongmyo shrine and all the palaces!
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed on the Club floor so am not sure if all the rooms are of similar size and decor which I assume it should be. It's very comfortable with a sofa facing the TV for the couch potato we all can be at the end of the day. It's attached to the Lotte department store than has a pretty good supermarket in the basement. And it's literally a short 7 minutes walk to the Myeongdong area which is filled with shops selling Korean cosmetics and at some point also lined with food carts selling street snack food
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shortly review. First I love the gym, pool, sauna, best of the best I've ever met. Second I like breakfast buffet line up so much.(don't forget to try a normal stream rice with seaweed) Third the location close to Shopping center is very comfortable.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poor service if you're a western. Yes it's true I noticed how the Koreans are served compared to the westerners. That includes Americans unless they think you may be a big tipper, which you will not be because the service is that bad.No body understands English. Unless they see a wad of cash and then they all speak English. Complain and surprise surprise nobody speaks English. The only staff who genuinely are hard workers and attempt to be friendly are the chamber maids. I presume they must be Chinese?Don't bother to far out of the city and they definitely do not want western visitors.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lotte Hotel Seoul was home to me and my family for good 9 days in March this year. We were greeted by superb friendly staff the moment we stepped out of our airport limousine. Attractive lobby, makes you feel warmth and welcome. It was my husband birthday on the day of our arrival. Im expecting just a birthday cake being placed in our room, added with a simple birthday card. To my surprise, they sent a group of staff, led by the Director Mr Simon Kyung-Soo Kim from the Rooms Team, in presenting the cake personally to my husband. What more can we say! Special thanks to Mr Simon Kim. Really really grateful for your assistance rendered to my twins, making this whole stay so memorable. Was really happy to be able to meet and chatted with you on our last day in Seoul. I have been telling my friends stories on my wonderful stay with the hotel and will choose to return in the future. All the best Mr Kim!Thankful to Mr Steven Park, Rooms Clerk. When I tried to carry my own bag during the room shifting, he insisted on carrying for me and explained that is his duty and pleasure to assist. When I offered him a little tip as a token of appreciation, he rejected. And yes it has been very nice chatting with you young man. I wish you all the best in your future endeavours.Mr Chua & Family (#2620/3517)
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel with every little detail very well thought through. The interior design work in the rooms is excellent and the staffs at the EXECUTIVE TOWER are wonderfully helpful. (EXECUTIVE TOWER is the best hotel and that is primarily because the staff are extremely service-oriented and highly responsive and professional.)The breakfast at Le Salon is outstanding both quality and taste. It's pricy but well worth it for a true luxury experience. Will definitely return.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The spa is very beautiful. The treatment and the friendly staffs make me feel good and relax. Thank you LOC HOA DINH with her magic hands and GIANG TRANG LINH with warm welcome. The herbal tea is delicious too.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a week and a half at the Lotte Hotel Seoul Plaza, along with three other colleagues, while on a business trip there in March. I rarely write hotel reviews anymore, but this place warranted a shout-out.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel. Close to a range of restaurants, shops and street food.first of all !You can save a lot of money here: cheaphotelss.tkThe breakfast buffet had a huge range. great view of a waterfall,Rooms were nice and comfortable.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was travelling together with 2 other colleagues so we had booked 3 rooms. The rooms booked were designated as "Club Superior Double" and were described as being 26m2.Upon check-in we were assigned 3 rooms that were obviously much smaller than the rooms booked. One of my colleagues protested and was immediately moved to a bigger room. I had to run to a meeting and had no time for that, so when I returned I called the manager and showed him the room and my reservation which obviously described something different than what I was given. My room was about 10m2, with another 5-6 m2 of bathroom and corridor (see photos of supposed "Club Superior Double"). I told him that this room was not what I had paid for and it was a disgrace for this hotel to defraud systematically clients in this way (all 3 of us were assigned to rooms much smaller than booked). He offered no explanation, just said "I am sorry" and proposed to move me to the right class of room booked. I refused as I was leaving in 36 hours and had already unpacked.I think it is shameful practice for a hotel laying claim to a 5-star rating that they treat their clients this way. A lower class of room than what the client paid is obviously provided and only if the client protests then they rectify the room assignment. In the meantime many clients get fooled to think that this is what they paid for.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easily accessible location near Myeong Dong & city hall. Airport limousine bus stops right at the hotel. Spacious room with quality amenities and professional hair dryer. The international buffet breakfast offers great variety and the excellent quality. Highly recommended hotel for both business or leisure. Will definitely go back on next visit.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A luxury hotel at the heart of Seoul. Pick up from airport was efficient nice new BMW series 7 . Check in at the 31st club floor was smooth. Room average size has almost all what except coffee machine , drawers & cupboard rather old . Light a bit dim . Breakfast at the business floor below average although heard from my colleagues that main breakfast buffet is great. Receptionist gave wrong directions to one of my meetings which resulted in a 30 minute delay and some difficulty to explain taxi driver the situation & of course a large taxi bill. Snacks at the business lounge again below average & all sweet. Check out ok & drive back to airport. Staff very polite and helpful. Hotel clean. The hotel connected to a shopping mall and have a few shops at the ground floor. Dinner at their Korean restaurant was great.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service, good location, remarkably friendly staff, and great on-site dining. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I’ve ever experienced. The rooms are small but clean, comfortable, and dark, which helps with the jet-lag. It’s pretty easy to get from the Incheon airport, too. A shuttle will drop you off right in front of the building; it’s much cheaper than aggressive taxi drivers.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Hotel. Room was big, clean and the bed was very comfortable with the ideal location. The gymnasium, swimming pool, sauna and the spa are fantastic. The food of Room Service taste good.Excellent service and friendly staff, especially those in Club Floor. Every year we stay in Lotte Hotel Seoul for our family trip for at least 8 days each time for 5 years. I will for sure staying here again and my son already look forward to our next stay.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent accomodations. Clean, friendly staff. Rooms are very comfortable. Ideal location for shopping and exploring surrounding area. Hotel is extremely modern and each room is equipped with heated seats. Front desk staff very accommodating. Coming from an English speaking country, there was no language barrier. The meals were exceptional both in presentation as well as taste.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room service is pushing papers under the door (starting at 7.45am) if you have a „do-not disturb“ sign on the door - that is annoying.More annoying is following experience: you book a breakfast for 36.300 won, and the restaurant people tell you that there is no reservation. Get your IT straight! Therefore I can‘t recommend this „5 star“ hotel.The rooms are ok - a bit small. The location is good.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel with great location to surrounding attractions to tempt all.Hotel is very modern & rooms are extremely comfortable.Hotel has fantastic inside swimming pool, suna, spas as well as golf driving range for guests to use.Enjoy drinks in the bar area that has amazing glass frontage view of into a nature setting.You won’t be disappointed with breakfast or dinner in the restaurant that offers food types from all around the world.I will be staying here again
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thought the location was perfect for my first visit to Korea. The airport limo drops you off right in front of the hotel, and there is a subway entrance to lotte Dept store which is connected to the hotel as well. A stone’s throw away are great restaurants, lotte duty free and the “infamous” Myeong-dong shopping street. I took 1 point off because it doesn’t feel all that luxurious as advertised. The wing where we stayed is a very well maintained old building. Staff is excellent. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights in this hotel during the month of November.The deluxe room provided in main building is clean but dated. The black old wooden working desk inside the room is very unpresentable. And the big old sofas blocking the way to the bath room. The worst part is the water shower temperature is inconsistent while taking shower, it keeps changing from hot to cold and cold to hot itself. This affected the bathing experience. If Lotte wants to keep the status as a 5 stars hotel, they should upgrade all the deluxe rooms in the main building as soon as possible.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay for 3 nights. Room is big and comfortable. The bed is a bit hard (for me at least). But other then that, it’s great.Try the fitness club with Sauna. You have to try it.Location wise, it’s close to shopping mall and Myeongdong market. A lot of good restaurant too.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: staff were good. professional, breakfast was enjoyable.the room was as expected same design standard as you would find all over the world. but felt small because of all the clutter . small sofa which we never used.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 2 nights and 3 days in this lovely hotel as our 1st stop in Seoul. The rooms were very comfortable, even though this was probably the older wing, and stone tiled bathrooms were well maintained and in warm tones. Location was great and we were literally 5 mins away from Myeongdong shopping streets by walking. The food Avenue at the basement was very convenient and you can walk directly to the malls next door. Last, my daughter was so happy to see the ‘hall of fame’ right at the hotel with BTS k pop group’s imprint of their hands ! Will definitely stay there again next time!
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location and right smack in Myeongdong region. Bed was comfy and hard enough, staff attitude were absolutely delightful. But first night was rather noisy, as we were near the main road and the glasses were thin, could even hear the pedestrian sound system while crossing road. Requested for a change and staff were really helpful and kind. Much quieter just that it was 3/4 of the previous size :(. Still good anyways.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed here several times now. Rooms are good and well maintained though a bit old. Great location means we can get around mostly on foot. Good place to stay in Seoul though the smoking area is a good 300 metres walk away and there are no smoking zones in the hotel si if you are a heavy smoker this is not the hotel for you.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was overwhelmed and impressed from the moment I stepped into the hotel.Impeccable is how I would describe and expect from a 5 star establishment. From hotel staff representatives to service to amenities. We'll worth the price tag. I dropped off at the main tower lobby and someone guided me to the executive tower to hand me over to the colleague to take me to level 15 at executive tower for check in rather than left me to find my own way. All hotel staff were immaculately groomed and dressed and polite at all times. Check in reception on level 15 was like a posh living room of someone's house. They were so efficient that I barely had time to drink the tea and cookies served before I was ushered to room.I love the Dipytique toiletries, bath salt and O'sulloc bath tea provided!They paid attention to details such as providing 3 sets of dental kits and 3 pairs of bedroom slippers as there were 3 of us staying in the family room. There was a jewellery tray provided in the room safe. This level of detail very often missed out by most.The room was of a decent size since it was a family room. Bathroom was good size too.But what I found strange was the blinds to provide privacy to bathroom（glass panels) was located outside of the bathroom rather than inside.From hotel main tower, one can access Lotte Departmental store and subway underground without stepping outdoors which was handy on days when it was freezing cold. Lotte Duty Free is next door, so is the Star Avenue. Myeongdong is located right opposite, about 2min walk to Lotte Young Plaza and 5min walk to Shinsegae Departmental store.Unfortunately I did not use the gym or pool facilities nor ate at the hotel restaurants so I cannot comment. My only disappointment was on my niece's birthday during the stay, I asked if we could get a cake but was told to buy it at the hotel bakery which most hotels will give as complimentary.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at hotel for honeymoon, buffet breakfast was nice and the proximity of the hotel to Myeongdong was convenient. Access to lotte department store and food court underground was also good to avoid the cold.Would recommend staying!!
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at a Family Twin Room of the Executive Tower with my family and it was the best valuable staying ever. I was be able to be felt enough that this hotel makes greater efforts for attention to details. The most reason that it was a valuable staying at this hotel is due to their service mind. Front desk agent, operator and even house keeper, they were so enthusiastic for welcoming and providing the best sevices. The room was very luxury style and super clean.Location was good. I was so satisfied everything during the stay. I don’t hesitate to rate this hotel as 7star because their service mind and I would definately choose this hotel again if I come to Seoul next time.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Smiling hotel staff were really helpful whenever we needed assistance. Our room was comfortable and very clean.The location was unbeatable - we just crossed the road and there were tons of street vendors, shops and restaurants. We joined a local day tour arranged by the concierge for a day and a hop on hop off tiger bus on another day. The pick up station for the hop on/hop off was just a 15 minute walk away. Ask concierge for free bus shuttle to Isadong and Namdaemun market. We also enjoyed the food court at the basement offering mouth watering chewy cold noodles and delectable dumplings when it rained hard one day. Lotte department store right next to the hotel was also worth a visit.The only drawback would be the somewhat dated decor of the hotel but I would definitely stay here again when I revisit Seoul.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Central location on top of the train station makes this hotel great for exploring Seouls attractions. The staff here are friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean, and the sleep quality is high because the bed was so comfortable. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you decide to stay at this hotel, you won’t be disappointed. Location is perfect, really close to the imperial palace as well as the recently renovated river bank and two blocks away from a subway station.The buffet at the main restaurant is a must and should be tried at least for breakfast. And, if you are I the mood for something else, you’ll find an ample selection of restaurants in the next-door Lotte mall (at their top floors).Rooms are ample, modern and tastefully furnished. Beds are comfortable. And, if I were to find something wrong with it, would be the fact that, trying to set the right water temperature, while taking a shower, at any time before sunrise, is extremely difficult; in most instances your choice will be either really hot or scalding hot.All in all, it’s a great luxury pick to consider if visiting Seoul.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent few times my nights in Seoul in this hotel where I found an outstanding attention from staff to clients.Excellence is in the sleep (when not too affected by jet lag) as bed are really comfortable and sleep or rest is an experience.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was near the usual touristy places which makes travelling easier. their service and amenities were also great. stayed there for about 2 nights and would definitely come back here if i were to visit korea again.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed total 17 days in Lotte Hotel Seoul in October 2018.Their services were top notch from door man, luggage carriers, concierges and up to front desk personnels.I really was impressed in every hotel employee's top quality performance.When I need something in the room serviced and just mention it to anybody, it was done when I returned with small note saying it was solved.In a nutshell this is the top notch world class hotel where you can stay without any doubt.Highly recommended to whoever visits Korea and wants to stay in excellent hotel.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel oozes with class, have been traveling to korea for the past 4 years and i wont regret staying here. The rooms are awesome, service is good, had dinner at the three-Michelin star restaurant Pierre Gagnaire have to say it was awesome..one of the best meals i've had here. This hotel will be my number one choice in seoul. The department store below the hotel and the lotte shopping mall next to the hotel was fantastic. Can't ask for more.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful grand decor but service just not up to standard.The executive tower is brand new and they try their very best to make it seem exclusive. But the feeling is all rather hollow when service is three star at most. Check in and check out took twenty minutes. Staff just not well trained.Worst of all. We had an incident where the housekeeping threw away all my wifes skin care products which she had put into a cup. You can imagine the shock we had when we came back from a formal event at 10:30pm and my wife had none of her make up remover. Obviously we could not go buy any either since all the shops were closed. After an hour of trying to explain the situation and someone who could understand English, we were given a 'I'm sorry for the inconvenience but we will follow up on the incident tomorrow morning when the manager comes in.' No mention of any solution for my wife's make up removal problem.Needless to say. No follow up the next day. No mention of it at check out. We gave up trying to find the manager as we concluded we would be met with the same 'I'm sorry for the inconvenience caused' answer but with no satisfactory solution.I understand the hotel is new but there are still basic service standards that should be met.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel located at the heart of Seoul. Within comfortable walking distance of tourist and local attraction such as Myeong Dong where you could find various beauty shops (one very reason to come to Seoul) or if you are fond of hawker stall offering varieties of mouthwatering snacks.This area also for you should you after Halal diet.This hotel is adjacent to shopping mall (Lotte) and walking distance to business district.Friendly staff, excellent service, check in and check out time were great.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got the Deluxe Room, and it was very spacious and cozy. Everything is well prepared. Furthermore, breakfast is very good, albeit very strict in terms of timing. Hotel overall service level is very high above expectation. And what is even greater about this hotel is the location, which is easily reachable by any means of transportation.
hotelName:
1    Lotte Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy to get to from airport using bus #6015 from Incheon Airport. Bus stops just about 50m away from hotel. Walk past the North Face store and you get to the hotel front steps. If you have luggage on wheels, you have to drag them up the slightly uneven slope along the road around the side to the small glass door that leads to the small lobby, instead of carrying the bags up the front entrance steps. Friendly staff at front desk. Small room but clean. The aircon was one difficult thing to figure out and adjust. When the temperature is set, it turns on and off completely to maintain that level. Many aircon units just keep the fan on and the thermostat maintains the required temperature. This unit in my room goes on and off, making quite a noticeable bit of noise in the process.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location! Across the street is the airport shuttle and Myeongdong shopping street with lots of fun shopping and food. Walking distance to the palace. Hotel itself was comfortable with all the necessary amenities. Staff was polite, kind, and helpful. Would definitely stay there next time.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a good stay here. The beds are very comfy. It is nice and quiet in the hotel even though it is in the centre of Myeongdeong. Breakfast was nice, although I would prefer a buffet instead of a breakfast menu. The staff can make some changes, though, if you ask for it.The staff was all very friendly and the staff at the reception speaks English quite well. The English of the staff in the breakfast room was not great but good enough to understand one another.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is just beside myeongdong subway exit 2. Convenient to travel via the subway and a bus stop within 1 minute walk. Opposite the hotel is the start of myeongdong street. The rooms are nicely clean. No toothbrush, only body shower, body lotion, shampoo & comb. There is breakfast at level 1, i rather eat out as there's lots of yummy restaurants. There is a trainee staff with a senior staff at the counter, communication wise, english, chinese and Japanese is of no issue. They lack of knowledge on the area and some have a arrogant attitude. I requested to book a taxi at 3am to Gimpo domestic airport to fly to Jeju on the 3rd day, the staff booked on the 2nd day and i got an early 3am morning call instead! On the 3rd day, the taxi dropped us at Gimpo International airport, its not open yet and we have to wait in the cold till its open, ask around and walk for 30mins before reaching domestic airport. Terrible experience. You can keep your luggage with them as well.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a tough time getting the ideal hotel in Seoul.- some quote low but give you a single room, or room without window. ( standard run of the hotel room means room without window)- lowest rate often is for small double bed, we need two separate beds for comfort.After booking and then canceling ten times, I finally got Prince.It just in the other side of the road from the Myeondong (md) Street might Market, but a short walk across the zebra crossing gets you there. It is also quiet.Roomd are medium sized but larger than most rooms in Japan. Clean and comfortable.Service : thankful that staff speak English, and can give instructions. e. g. Airport bus, where to but Tmoney card.Food : did not eat any meals there, but I noticed that there's is a small cafe on the ground floor that serves food.Overall a very suitable hotel for us. Subway and bus stations right in front, and airport bus 6015 a few metres away. Needless to say, the md night market and shops just across the road.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: if you are a shopping lover, this hotel is totally for you, also their buffet breakfast is also not bad, I love this place if I wanna stay in Myeondong for shopping, the hotel is 5 minutes walk to the subway and shopping center
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was perfectly situated at myeong dong..so convenient..Plus it was only about 5 -8 mins walk to a Malaysian Restaurant "Kampungku" which was a really nice surprise for us..Rooms were a little small, which was expected because of the location..but service was good, rooms were clean & modern.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for over a week on a winter. Location is superb. Subway is just across. Myeongdong shopping area is only 5 mins walk. Everything is accessible. Rooms are spacious and clean. They clean up the room everyday. Toilet has a bidet.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First location is good, hotel is clean. Is very convenience in term of transport from airport and to airport (airport buses), Subway is just in front of hotel (Myeong-dong station). Food and convenience store is all nearby and directly across the main road is Myeongdong Street, walking distance to some of the main shopping store (Like Lotte Duty Free)
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in an ondol room and slept comfortably on the floor. It did require some getting used to re bean pillow. Had heated floor, which was impressive but I guess that is common in Korean homes. Location is great, simply a few steps from Myeongdong exit 2, which coincidentally was one of our day tour’s meeting point (Ktourstory). Lots and lots of shops and restaurants nearby. They close very late so we enjoyed walking around and enjoying street food in the evening. Toiletries could be improved (no toothbrush or shaver). 2nd toilet was convenient for a family of 4. Wouldn’t mind staying here again.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable for shopping because opposite Myeongdong shopping center, clean, can walk to Namsan Tower. Near Myeongdong subway station, Namdaemun market, Lotte mall. But room is too small. Staffs are very nice.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is just by Myeongdong station line 4 exit 2. If you are arriving from Incheon airport, you can take the airport bus - either 6001 or 6015, and hotel is just on the opposite side of the road. Room size is decent and clean. Wifi is good. Staff are friendly.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to Seoul and I have no other hotels to compare this to but its clear that the hotel is in a good location. this is for two reasons, the hotel is right next to the subway and the neighborhood what could be considered a key center in Seoul. google maps doesnt work well in Seoul, so its good to be close to a metro station if you want to get places and not get lost. the bus to Incheon airport departs litterally in front of the hotel, very convient.the rooms were small with small bathrooms. i travelled alone and dont care too much about big rooms, the internet was fast, the shower had great water pressure and they have Tv with plenty channels. if you travel with a partner or kids it may be a different story. i did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there are many options nearby. checkin was easy.this hotel is great if you want an affordable and clean hotel in a good location and will spend most your time exploring the city.downsides: I smelled people smoking in their rooms
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location for shopping, Highly recommend if you come with family. The hotel staff is keen and can speak english. You can do late check out and early check in. Free wifi and goo services. Recommend for everyone are seeking the good hotel.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the Prince hotel was great. It is at a great location where you can hit the Myeondong streets up everyday if you wanted to. There is a metro station right outside and an airport bus stop. The hotel is clean and quiet and the staff were friendly and nice. I knocked off a point due to their shower. The room was newly renovated but the bathroom was poorly designed. It didn't have a drain on the floor but the shower door didn't close all the day so the shower water could flood the bathroom floor. We definitely did the first time we took the shower and had to mop it up with whatever towels we had in the room.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Good:- Airport Limousine 6015 stops directly opposite the hotel (Myeongdong Station Stop)- Hotel is 20 meters away from Exit 2 of Myeongdong Station- Moderately priced for the location as compared to other hotels in the vicnity The Not-so-good:- Room was facing main road of Myeongdong street, hard to sleep with the noise- Room was dated and did not look very clean; walls were stained - Lighting of the room was terrible; you could only control 3 switches, making the room either too dark or too brightOnly stay at this hotel if convenience is what you seek; there are no other incentives of staying in this hotel except for the convenience.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about the hotel is goood given that is a 3 star hotel. Clean and big room. Polite staff. Great location. Just cross the road is the shopping area. Subway entrance just in front of hotel. Easy to drop of n pick up for taxi just on the main road.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got in to Phuket at midnight and had booked this hotel. We had arranged a ride to the hotel but it never showed. We hired a taxi from the airport. It cost us 400 Baht for the ride. This was disappointing that we had to find our own ride after traveling for 20 hours The hotel is not but a few blocks from the airport so it was a quick ride. Once we arrived the hotel is very nice and the office attendant apologized. Our room was very nice. Breakfast in the morning was better than expected. Hot meal with real food and all you can eat. Sitting pool side looking out over the town. We arranged a taxi to our next residence through the hotel and it arrived on time.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great Service, very close shopping street. I stay here 3 night 2 nights for 2 people and last night for 3 but hotel upgrade room for us to bigger without charge that’s great service. Room always cleane the towers had changed for daily
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location,just 2’ walking to Myeongdong,many resto,shopping centre,money changer nearby,shuttle bus from n to Incheon aport, easy to get taxi,helpful staff..we’ll be back again next trip...very recomended
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked staying in this hotel as the room was very spacious and comfortable. It was clean and well maintained.The location is excellent as Myeondong shopping street is right across the road. Both the subway and the airport transfer bus stop is in front.Lots of eateries and shops around too.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy access to subway, street food, and shopping districts. The airport limousine is right across the street, very convenient. You can shop then go back to the room to rest and then shop again. Clean room and friendly staff except they don't have free face masks.
hotelName:
2    Prince Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
