What happened was that he didn’t want to turn the AC on. Just like he didn’t mention about the shuttlebus and gave us probably the worst room in the hotel. Neither did he offer us any help to get our luggage up to the room or transfer it to the other room. Instead he asked us to get down our luggage before changing room then go up with it again. Congratulations for winning the price, worst hotelreception I encountered among hundreds of hotels I checked into in over 25 countries!The cleaning is not done well and the hotels has no password on their Wi-Fi. That means anyone with little skills could steal your passwords while you use their Wi-Fi. Very stupid not adding a simple password to their Wi-Fi. It does not cost the hotel any money.The area around the hotel is not so safe or nice in any way. That is another reason why there is shuttlebusservice offered from the hotel itself for free. To compensate that extremely bad location.There is hardly any soundisolation between the rooms. We complained several nights about noises from the other room because we couldn’t sleep. Not much happened after complaining. If you are a hard sleeper then maybe this won’t bother you. But paying over 100 dollars you except to be able to at least sleep in your room nighttime.I don’t know if I got an overpriced room due to late booking, but this hotel rooms are not worth more than 30 dollars a night. Sure the front of the hotel looks modern, but the insides seem stuck in the 60s. Just look at the pictures I uploaded. Noone should pay more than 30 dollars for what they get here. My advice is not to stay at this hotel at all; there are so many other options with better locations and better value for your money in Seoul. Don’t be fooled by the certificate of excellence that this hotel is not worth at all!We were offered free drinks vouchers through our booking company, turned out these were only useable for coffee, nothing else, not even tea!Just don’t make my mistake, don’t waste your money on this hotel when there is many better options. And always check the reviews carefully, who gives high ratings now that it is so easy to create profiles, give a high rating and do it over and over again. Not every certificate of excellence hotel is worth its ratings. This is the second time I encountered such a hotel, but this was is so far the worst hotel I stayed at compared to its price, value and what you get.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made a reservation here and need to cancel the reservation. I made 2 attempts and have received NO contact. When I made contact to inquire about something unrelated before my cancellation they responded very quickly. Now I am nervous they will charge my credit card. They don't offer a 1-800 number either. Sneaky and just a way to make money on people. I would not trust these people.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel, situated on the Main Street, which makes travelling to Myeongdong easy as the transport is easily accessible. Definitely recommend, the staff are helpful.Only thing that could possibly be changed is the option for early check in - it was a short wait, but a lot of other hotels did give up the option.All in all, wonderful hotel, definitely would come back !
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here last week for a total of 5 nights with my mom and 2 sisters. The rooms were big, beds were comfy, interior design looked like a typical 4-star hotel. The staff can speak English and were very helpful. We arrived around 8:30am but there was no rooms available so we were only able to check-in around 2pm.The hotel is located in an industrial part of town, surrounded by stores selling customized/corporate notebooks and stationery. The surroundings were bad and it was really weird to find a 4-star hotel in the middle of that area. Nothing to see in the immediate area, it wasn't clean. If you're from Metro Manila, the best description is that it looks like Tomas Mapua or Aranque or Soler in Binondo! Haha!Anyway, the good thing is that it was quite easy to hail cabs from the hotel and if you take a cab from somewhere, the cab can easily drop you off at the hotel's doorstep. The hotel is also 5 minutes walk from the Chungmuro Station from the front of the hotel, or 5 minutes walk from Euljiro 1 (I think) station from the back (we only used the Chungmuro Station). The airport bus stop is also in front of the Chungmuro Station exit. There is a bakery at the hotel (but not very good) and a CU convenience store at the ground floor.I think it is still walkable to Myeongdong, which is where all the shopping is - probably 10-15 minutes walk. They have a free shuttle that goes to Myeongdong every hour, as well as other key places like Dongdaemun and Kwangjang Market. It is very helpful as it saves you money for public transport. My sister loved this but I didn't because I didn't want to be tied to the shuttle's schedule. We missed it a lot of times so we had to wait another hour for the bus. By our last day, we just took cabs everywhere we went.The first day we checked in, the water bottle in my mom's room was opened already. We complained and they changed it and apologized profusely for it. The next day, the mugs were left uncleaned in the bathroom but the rest of the room was cleaned. Again, housekeeping was contacted and they apologized profusely and replaced the mugs. It was weird. What I can commend is that they responded quickly and fixed problems quickly.This was my sister's 2nd time staying at PJ and she really recommends it but I won't recommend it. I would prefer a hotel inside Myeongdong. However, it is a good value for money hotel because it is 4-star, clean, huge rooms, very good service. I just didn't like the inconvenience of its location. So it's a "so-so" hotel for me overall.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like the room because there is air purifier inside. That's make me felt fresh with good air. The hotel is far away from Myeongdong 1 km. If you don't like the crowded people, then it would be nice to stay here.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are many hotels within walking distance to the subways, not many are this good.Spacious room, comfortable bed, ample amenities and well kept fittings. Breakfast could be better but no complain either.Nearby shopping and restaurants. Will definitely come again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in a great location. What really stands out about the hotel how secure it is. Takes a key to operate the elevator and to access the hallway to your room. Rooms are very quiet with a central control panel on nightstand that controls Lights, temperature, and communications. Also the toilet has heated toilet seats. Also as a male I never used a bidet before, interesting experience and it saved time too. It about 300m roger to the subway. Great location.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is very fancy. Parking was hard to do and this hotel is very busy with weddings and banquets. The room was very comfortable. The staff was awesome and helpful. There are a lot of places close by to explore.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel PJ in Myeongdong is a great place to stay in South Korea! It’s clean, it has friendly staff, the rooms have comfortable beds - you are going to enjoy your stay. Also, if you love K-Beauty, there is a shopping area not far away FULL of some of the biggest Korean facecare names.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy to get to from the airport and very convenient location if you don’t mind walking a little bit. About 15 minutes walk from a pretty cool shopping area, and 25-30 min walk to the palaces. Staff is helpful and friendly, especially the front desk. Rooms and other parts of the hotel are clean.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pj hotel has been a great experience and they have great service! Some staffs know multiple languages and is pretty much fluent in English. They are placed in a great location where a variety of food and convenience stores are in!They have shuttle busses that can take many different places and landmarks of Seoul!
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend planned a surprise trip for us to Seoul for two weeks. We hotel hopped a few times and this was our third hotel that he had booked. Based on the pictures online it looked beautiful! When we walked into the hotel lobby we were satisfied with what we saw. Unfortunately, when we arrived to our room it was a different story and we were extremely disppointed. The room did not represent the photos shown online, seemed outdated and the entire room had a foul odor to it that made me nauseas. It was so awful we didn’t even end up staying one night and found another hotel for the remainder of our trip. We are not picky people so trust me when I say, if you are looking to stay in Seoul, you can find something MUCH better for your money.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located right in the middle of two metro stations - Euljiro 3-ga and Euljiro 4-ga - both just 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. The area surrounding the hotel may not give the best view as it's situated in the middle of a commercial district with lots of small workshops (definitely not in the tourist belt).We stayed in the twin room with a balcony in November, which turned out to be a godsend what with the Korean preference for a little over-heating their interiors. Just leave the balcony door open for that cool autumn air to keep the temperatures a little more pleasant (no, the thermostat wasn't working in our room).Overall, a nice stay. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The self-service laundry room was very welcome (just have a couple of 5000 won notes handy for the machines, and detergent packs from the vending machine cost 2000 won). Having two convenience stores less than 50m away from the hotel and ATMs on the ground floor was also great!
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel PJ is fairly known and easy to pronounce to cab drivers. It is a stop on the airport bus (last). Be prepared to walk about 60 mt from the bus drop point. Hotel is within walking distance of several visit worthy points in the Myeongdong area. The Hotel lobby and rooms are spacious. Breakfast is a good spread. There is a good simple local cuisine restaurant opposite the hotel just in case. There are cafe's all around.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this the ladies only option room for 6 nights as opposed to standard room as it showed as room with foot massage, Nespresso machine and hair straighteners provided. While the room was nice enough, only the foot massage was available. I was told the Nespresso machine didn't come with pods, if you wanted to use the machine we had to buy the pods from reception. We looked all over the room for the straigteners but again, not available. There was daily room service but no one noticed there was no straighteners. The other strange thing was, even though it was advertised as floor was Ladies only, there was def males coming out from that floor.The hotel itself was nice enough, very convenient with the free bus shuttle and near 2 different subway lines. Its advertised as Myeongdong but it's still a good 10/15 mins walk from the Myeongdong shopping area but this wasn't the only hotel in the area that advertised it as Myeongdong so maybe an extension of the Myedongdong but def not the main shopping area.The nearest airport limousine stop is exit 8 Chungmuro station line 3. Buses no 6001 and 6015 stop there. 15,000 won each way. As soon as you get off you see Kia Cars then an alley way and then Paris Baguette cafe. You walk down that alley way all the way to the end, roughly 3-5 walk and hotel is across the road.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 days and thought the service was excellent! The staff was accommodating and the rooms were clean with a soft bed and a good view. The free shuttle service came out handy because I didn’t expect that and it took us to the night market without any problems. The staff are friendly and helpful and the concierge desk was very informative. They are also able to store your luggage for free after check out while waiting for your flight. We can’t beat the rate we got so we’re staying here again for our next trip to Seoul!
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very clean and tidy, they are very tourist friendly. Because they can speak english, mandarin, and japanese. We came early in the morning and we can leave our luggages safely. So we can go outside looking for foods and wait until we can get our rooms after 2pm. I will come back to this hotel next time!
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good Tripadvisor-Reviews were responsible for our booking of PJ Myeongdong. And this was the right decision. We stayed here for 9 nights. No problems with Check-In/Check-Out, clean Hotel and great breakfast (Korean style, American Style, different kinds of eggs, vietnamese rice noodles, some kind of sausage/cheese and much more). WLAN worked fast and without problems. Safe and coffee maker were on the room. The location is also great, 3 metro stations with 4 different lines are only a 5 to 10 minute walk away from the hotel. The hotel offers also 2 free shuttle bus lines to the stations and some other locations (i.e. Namdaemun Market and Dongdaemun Markt). Nearby to the Hotel you can find small stores (i.e. 7 eleven), a cafe and small restaurants. They also have a lot of baggage lockers (free for 12 hours). All over all we had a fantastic stay here.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel is good and really enjoyed with all facilities , I have booked for one person only initally but late one more firend added to booking and the hotel was really coperative with this issue .... thanks for help
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sometimes I visited this hotel for business, but this hotel is always under construction. Last month did lobby construction. And now on the outside!! even 3-4 am.I think that's really crazy!!! I wonder why the hotel didn't complain strongly to the government about the construction at dawn. Really terrible. I'll never come again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed five nights - had a room with balcony first night but on that side of the hotel demolition was going on. We complained and got a new room -more traditional Korean. Good, friendly service - but the breakfast buffet was boring.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gone to Korea for business trip and stayed at Hotel PJ.Didn't expect much at first but while staying there for a couple of days, it turned out to be great stay.The employees were very friendly and helpful, clean and quiet room, and the business center had everything i needed for my business meeting.Next time i visit Korea, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked two rooms to stay at this hotel. Arrived at hotel during midnight. We had five pieces of luggage and asked at reception that we need help with luggage. One guy came but didn’t help us, and we left the luggage near the elevator. Then I went to receptionist for check in, she was even more rude then him. She didn’t say hello or anything. The whole process of check in was so uncomfortable that I got upset. At the end, instead of giving me information about breakfast and other things, just weaved with hand that I should walk away. Then I got very upset and asked her what kind of hotel this is, or someone going to help us with luggage. Then the same person helped us with luggage with very rude manner.When we got in the rooms, not by far the standard, shown in the pictures. Smell was coming from the bath rooms and old type with plastic curtain in it.Then during the check out another receptionist, again not polite and when finished with checkout, instead of saying anything, just gave me look that go away. Same person helped us with luggage during checkout with same rude attitude. This tells the mind set of management of this hotel.This was our first time visit to South Korea but very much disappointed because of this hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to any international travelers. You can find much better hotels with same price.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned from a 4 night stay at Hotel PJ and it was a wonderful experience. The hotel is not exactly in the heart of Myeongdong, but for us that was perfect because you will have a nice break away from the hustle and bustle. The free shuttle ride to the main shopping districts were only 5-10 minutes (depending on traffic) and runs quite frequently. The front desk was extremely professional and quite helpful. If we have the opportunity to return to Korea, we would definitely stay at Hotel PJ again. For us, taking a taxi from the airport to the hotel was quite reasonable and I would suggest that route of transportation after a long flight.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great place to stay for your visit to Seoul. You are out of the way enough for it to be quiet at night, but close enough to everything you want to see that it is a cheap taxi ride or a stop or two on the subway.We had a family room which gave us a king bed and a twin for our son. Ideal! It was clean and the staff was very helpful in all manner of things.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are other hotels around but this one is close to some shopping area although the hotel itself lack of facilities however I found it acceptable, just be sure to have a room on top floor, it was a bit noisy from the street
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: General Hotel amenities/good stuff: 1. In the lobby you can find english speaking staff2. Also in the lobby, you can find a tourist booth where in different tourism companies have their own packages and offers on different tours (& the hotel helps you pick and makes it way easier for you to book on those tours!)3. You can walk the hanbok village (traditional korean village) from the hotel4. Myeongdong (shopping district) and Nandaemyun (another shopping district more of thrift shops) are one cab ride away at minimum rate (about 3000-5000 won)5. There's a cafe/restaurant in the hotel6. There's 7-11 convenience store when you cross the street. RoomsSince we're a family (mixed boys and girls) we were put on the Men and Women Floor. If you guys are a group of girls they have a all girls floor.1. The room we got had 2 beds.2. There's a mini living room with TV (yes, there are english channels)3. There's a area for writing or for putting on makeup in the room (just want to imply that the room is very spacious!!)4. There was a veranda in our room5. Big bathroom, hot water included, tub included, bidet includedFloor1. VERY safe as you have to tap your card twice (one to get in the floor and one for your room)2. 24/7 water station per floor (so you wouldnt have to buy outside!)3. There are smoke-free floors.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel. Price is reasonable and its location is great. It’s close to both Myungdong and Dongdaemoon. Furthermore the hotel provides free shuttle buses (one toward Myungdong and the other toward Dongdaemoon) many times a day. One of the shuttle’s stops is at the airport bus stop so you can easily take the airport bus and not a taxi. Amenities at the hotel were good (toothbrush and paste included). Water bottle is given to each person everyday. The building is a bit old but inside is nicely renovated. The only complaint I had was the location of TV which was located all the way left of the room, making the viewing angle awkward. Overall I give the hotel 4.5 stars!
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel is between 2 subway station chung muro and eljiro 3 to get to the hotel from the airport bus stop is around 4-6 minutes walk thru a alley some say thats the low point for the hotel but i saw a few restaurants and tried a few to great suprise good quality food and not to pricey.. the rooms were big there were english channels in the tv ok buffet breakfast great concierge and over all very happy with the service
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed staying in the PJ hotel. Reception staff was very helpful and they found a perfect large room for our family. Room was perfectly clean. Bathroom was large. Breakfast is very good with lots of choices. WiFi in the room worked well only half of the time. In the lobby WiFi works good but not in the room.
hotelName:
7    Hotel PJ Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are so many great hotels in Seoul, it’s hard to truly rate them. Often times, it just comes down to location. Nestled in an uniquely green part of the city, the way to the Shilla hotel was really beautiful - winding through a beautiful tree lined driveway. There’s also a traditional building in the center of the compound, which was unexpected and quite interesting. It is also a big tourist attraction as it is attached to their Duty Free store, so can be crowded and chaotic in the lobby during peak hours. Nevertheless, service was great, very consistent throughout my stay. Rooms are very spacious, though a bit dated. Overall recommend, but would suggest location as key decision factor. Myeongdong is my preference, so Shilla is not usually my top choice for that reason.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the best hotel in Korea. I was really happy with its service and the parties were nice. They hold small events and they gave us pleasure. Room condition, pool and sauna were good enough. The food in happy hour time was a little bit disappointed.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just stayed here for a conference and had a lovely experience. My room was spacious and featured all the amenities that a traveler from the USA could want - from Edison based outlets to a kit of tech cords to automated blinds and lights and a very sophisticated toilet! It seems as if the hotel was designed by travelers for travelers which is so greatly appreciated after a long haul flight from the States. The staff are totally on point and at your service and plentiful - you see staff supporting throughout the hotel including at the front desk helping manage the check in/out and concierge lines. Breakfast was part of my room charge and was perhaps the best I've ever had at a hotel. The freshly stocked buffet lines went on forever and featured everything you could imagine from local delicacies to our creature comfort go-to traditional breakfast options. The male hosts seemed a bit stressed about the seating in the dining room area (ie we asked if we could sit at a table where a diner had just left with his bags and a male host nearly had a breakdown which was odd) - otherwise the entire staff were very pleasant, accommodating and available. I had a dinner in the dining lounge on my arrival night and all tasted great. The conference rooms are stellar and in a gorgeous setting in what looked like traditional Korean buildings. I would return to this hotel in a second.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms, spa, restaurants...have been renovated (I stayed here few years back). The service is excellent, the staff is outstanding. The breakfast buffet may seems expensive but definitely worth it, same for their lunch buffet (high end price) but again the quality and incredible number of foods worth the price. The bar has live music (jazz, classic,...) in the afternoon until evening. Nice cocktail and wine list but little pricey. The hotel is 40 min by cab (no shuttle bus available) from Gimpo International Airport which I personally prefer to Incheon airport. The hotel is 5 min walk from a subway station.I have two (small) negative remarks: in the past their spa was offering high quality traditional massage and scrubbing. I tried their new fancy Guerlain spa which is very expensive and I was not impressed by their service. They should bring back their traditional Korean services at least for non Korean customers who don't really care about Guerlain french spa :) in Korea.My last remark is that despite being one of the most important hotel in Seoul its extremely difficult to get a taxi from the hotel after 10:30 pm you have to wait 15 min even more until a taxi comes to the hotel. Very strange! good market opportunity for Uber :)But again a top five star hotel. Will definitely come back
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff on the executive level. Beds are very comfortable. Paying extra for the Executive floor is a good value as they offer a full breakfast and dinner as well as an afternoon tea and happy hour. While there was little change in the menu items from day to day, every thing was very fresh and tasty.The hotel is in a somewhat secluded location. However, they offer a frequent shuttle to the metro, and two shopping areas from 9:30 -8:00pm and taxis are very inexpensive.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was nice located in a good part of town. Rooms were very clean but small. Breakfast was good area was good for walking easy to get a bus to and from the airport. Interesting lobby area decorated with old computers and cameras
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the executive business deluxe room. Very good room size with wonderful breakfast and service staffs.Shuttle bus services provided which will bring you to a nearby train station (walkable distance) and also car transport service to bring you and your luggages to the nearby airport limousine bus stop
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I usually write reviews once I’ve left the place just in case something goes awry but I’m writing this as I sit in the lobby lounge having coffee listening to the pianist - nothing can change my view on this hotel!We’ve had an amazing time here. The rooms are beautifully appointed and great amenities. Really good size rooms with large bathrooms, couch and plenty of room for luggage. We opted for the executive lounge package which includes breakfast, afternoon tea, happy hour etc in Level 23. My goodness - such great quality food and beverages! After a full day sightseeing, of heading out is the last thing on your mind the executive lounge is so relaxing and the food options are outstanding. The staff are so professional and friendly. Last night we were in search of a cigar lounge and concierge found one close by (approx 10 min and AUD$10 in a taxi away). As far as location goes, it is a little secluded in that I don’t think you can just walk out the door and find loads of restaurants etc but it is close to the metro and very close by taxi. There are several restaurants on premises as well as duty free shopping.Highly recommend this hotel and we will be back!
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here while visiting my son at Dongguk University as it was so close . We loved our stay here with its fantastic breakfast with so many options and great jazz lounge. The bed was super comfortable and the room was a good size.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Customer Satisftaction, service, flexibility I’m completely disappointed about the reply I got from Concierge, where i kindly asked to cancel my transfer to airport (9:30pm time enquire) planned at 07:50am day after. I have been told the the "policy" doesn’t allow any change if not before 24 hours the pick.up time. come on!Are you a 5 stars hotel working with business men or an Hostel accomodating students?!You will charge me 100% of the service even if I gently asked to cancel WELL in advance and after spending in your hotel 4nights (4) and my colleagues 3 nights (2 persons).I suggest you to review your level of service and the entire Policy procedure, since smiling it's not enough to be defined a 5 stars hotel.I will never come back to a Shilla Hotel.Best Regards,Cesare Silipo
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Though the outside of the hotel is nothing glamorous, the inside of the hotel is kept up extremely well. The food is wonderful. The breakfast buffet is hard to beat. The gym is among the best I have been to in a hotel. And the service is exceptional. Top 5% of hotels I have frequented. I will happily return.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have eat in this restaurant for over long time ago then now I try because of new management the rib is excellent and the steak is ok yea the bacon is good too also the service was very good the waitress cook all for u and bring out all Kim Cher fish as u want it
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Shilla is a fantastic hotel in Seoul, and in my view the best one. It is definitely pricey, but not so much the rooms. The food is absolutely excellent and fresh but restaurants are quite overpriced: I personally love the Ariake Japanese restaurant but clearly my wallet likes it a bit less. Rooms are great, even though it is a shame to stay in and not enjoy the fitness center (incredibly large) for instance. The only negative I could find is that there was a very long line for breakfast even at 8AM on a Sunday morning. Where do all these people come from?
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the Shilla several times over the past few years. You will get a top tier service experience. The staff are courteous and effective. The gym and sauna are fantastic - although you need to pay an extra fee to use the sauna. The spa is good for massages - although not outstanding relative to other top tier hotels in Asia that I have stayed at. The breakfast buffet is very good but again, not the top of the heap relative to other hotels in Asia. The views from all the rooms I have stayed at our spectacular given that the hotel has unrestricted open views in every direction.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were very nice but I have never been to a hotel where you need to pay extra to use the Sauna. I have stayed at the Four Seasons in Seoul and I would highly suggest staying there for the same price. When you are paying a lot of money for a hotel you should be able to use all the amenities free of charge.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All I have to say is when my mom and I were being a hot mess and ran for our airport shuttle, the entire front desk plus the taxi driver were working together to get us there. They checked us out quick, carried our luggages and jackets and ran with us, and even stayed at the bus stop to make sure if we made it. We were very impressed by the level of service we received.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is probably one of the best in Seoul, and as well the most rated! The service is perfect, rooms are big, many facilities and small details which make the difference! The hotel is not necessarily located is the greatest neighborhood (as far from most business / shopping neighborhood) but benefits from great views in Seoul and beautiful gardens around. The entrance and lobby may be sometimes crowded with the adjacent duty free mall and the numerous summits; but the staff is very dedicated to make you feel home!
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was great, the bed was excellent. I had a lovely and comfortable sejour at the hotel. The staff were friendly but not too much. I also appreciated how the room was efficiently equipped. Even the fact that there were no password needed for the wifi pleased me. However, I had a major complaint about the hotel’s restaurant: the Parkview. The nursing room was inside the lady’s room! Impossible for fathers to use. It was a huge and unacceptable disappointment. I sincerely hope to see change in the future.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Shilla Seoul for a week.The room was spacious and the amenities were very chic. My room had a view of the hill and it was a good way to see half of the city given the elevation. It's quite a walk up to the hotel from the subway station if you miss the last hotel shuttle at 9pm but it is doable. The duty free is quite busy with a lot of tourists from the Chinese mainland.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Shilla staff are pros who really know how to make guests feel comfortable and taken care of. Their breakfast is superb. No one else has aronia juice. I sorely miss it! This hotel, staff, amenities and food are worth the stay!
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just perfect service, rooms, breakfast, restaurants, quiet, facilities. The gym is stunning, as the breakfast choice and quality. Rooms are spacious, super well equipped and very quiet, albeit the hotel is always busy and the lobby always very crowded. This, if you want, the main and solely negative point of this stunning hotel
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Shilla Seoul is a deluxe hotel with premium service, rooms, and restaurants. The downstairs bar offers a refined experience. Not the liveliest of hotels (If you want somewhere more lively try The Grand Hyatt), but an deal location for a business stay. If you do visit, you must try the buffet breakfast in the Parkview Café & Terrace, probably the best breakfast I have experienced !
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in this amazing hotel. While prices for food and beverages could be a bit more moderate the price value for accommodation is clearly fair. Very nice rooms, great spa, outstanding friendly and helpful staff, we couldn’t but u should try the Michelin are rated Korean restaurant in the hotel. The breakfast is clearly worth 5 star!
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here at the Shilla for a night. Enjoyed the stay. The bed was incredible. Even my colleagues stayed here mentioned that bed was great to sleep. The best bed among all the hotels I have stayed. Breakfast spread was excellent both local and international. I am a vegetarian and was pleasantly surprised by the good spread of vegetarian dishes. The standard room is spacious and well kept. A good place to stay.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I used to be a fan of The Shilla Seoul in the past but my last stay just became a big let down so I will not be returning anymore. What I like about their hard product (my past stays include all of their room types: superior, deluxe, executive and suites) is their bedding (one of the softest in the industry), the bathroom and the amenities in the room but the decor, the size of the room and everything else are just average. The rooms are on the smaller size in general with low ceiling in comparison to the newer hotels that opened up in Seoul. Where this hotel used to excel really well was the service - every staffs you interact with will make you feel genuinely cared for and respected. What lacked in hard offerings were all made up by the quality of hospitality. I remember the staffs going above and beyond to ensure my family/friends and I had a wonder stay whether it was in-room service, the urban island pool, restaurants, front desk, etc. I also remember sending a sincere gratitude e-mail to one of the managers for the exceptional service provided at the pool. The Japanese restaurant has one of the best sea urchin dish that I kept on going back for (no longer offered) and the executive lounge does actually offer decent food and beverages, enough to make you stop by to enjoy the offerings (unlike many other hotel chains offering bare minimum enough to deter from making an intentional stop). The breakfast spread and quality is one of the best in town but also, the most expensive breakfast offering in town. On the other hand, the 3 Michelin starred La Yeon happened to be a disappointment. The dinner was just nothing memorable and the flavor for almost all of the dishes - underwhelming and bland. The reason why I would never be returning is because in my last trip, the hotel repeatedly let me down by not providing the room type requested ahead of time (they prioritized group tourist over me), refused to honor room upgrade voucher (not asking the reservation staff at the time of booking was the reason per the staff), refused to provide additional toiletries (stating one per day so if u happen to use the whole mini bottle by taking a bath...well, you are out of luck), additional charges for 2nd person for 2 twin-bed room for breakfast (make sure that the correct number of person is selected when making the reservation even though at the time of reservation up to 2 person doesn't change the price anyway), and then trying to recover the situation after making one after another complaints. By the way, this hotel will never give out the name and the contact information of the general manager for the guest to communicate directly (I guess only VIPs get access to that person?) All in all, it seems like this hotel is becoming too crowded by group tourists and I guess less revenue generating guests are simply treated with lesser importance. I would definitely take my business elsewhere as it lost its charm.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Shilla staff looked after me from the point of check-in all the way to check-out. Upon arrival hotel staff very helpfully contacted my taxi driver from the airport to try to locate something that I had lost. I did not manage to retrieve the item but felt much better that the sympathetic staff of the Shilla were there to help. Busy as usual the team still paid attention to detail so that I was still well taken care of after my check-out with access granted to the spa before I took my taxi to Incheon. Hotel room was pristine as always and I love the bathroom products from Molton Brown. Wifi speeds were fast ( generally so in Seoul) and the hotel is good for both business and pleasure. Will definitely be back.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This beautiful hotel delivers on five star service and huge rooms. The only drawback is that it is located on a hill not in the center of town. Their Korean spa and indoor pool though is incredible. It is a large hotel, so if you want a quiet, boutique experience this is not for you.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located in Seoul, this oasis is a treasure that many families and dignitaries come to enjoy and to be seen. It was a hot week and a holiday week so it was full of people looking to be seen. Fabulously spacious lobby. Great Room and the rates are very competitive with good views over the city. The grounds are amazingly well done. The indoor Pool has a retractable ceiling so it looks great outside and you can see the pool scene outside. Lots of local families with kids in the outdoor pool area that you can either have as a part of your package or pay $100/day and upwards for cabanas. Parking is very limited and it takes about 20-25min to go from street to the front door as there is lots traffic. Plan ahead for a taxi from here. Room service was well done and very nice staff at all points.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. Need to walk for 10 mins or ride shuttle bus from airport limousine bus stop or subway.2. Hotel is so sticky about late check-out. We only ask for 1 extended hour and they only agree to extend for half an hour due to peak season. Quite unacceptable considering the hotel size.3. Staff is so rigid and they won't go above and beyond to impress your stay. With the same amount of money that you pay probably it's better to stay in other 5* hotels.4. Hotel is overcrowded with local who came for staycation over summer seasons
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is beautiful, it has amazing staff and facilities. The rooms are great with the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The hotel has an amazing gym and spa with good trainers.So , with all of the above why would I never go back?The hotel makes a point of raping you on pricing for anything you order above the room rate- here are some examples;Breakfast $70 usdCup of tea $20 usdSandwich $ 35 usdWashing 1 shirt $30 usd ( cost of new shirt $ 50$Ice coffee - $35 I constantly felt like I was being ripped at every opportunity in a country that actually is reasonably priced.The hotel is also located very far from everything we which makes eating out etc rather tough.I have stayed in less fancy but better hotels in Korea!
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed at the Shilla under an AMEX FHR booking. Got all of the stated benefits even though the hotel was quite packed. It's summer in Korea so local hotels are crowded with staycationers and one of my nights was a Sunday.The hotel was extremely busy on Sunday. From entering the front gate to being dropped off at the lobby, it took 15 minutes. A 1 1/2 hour wait for a table at the lobby lounge. Service was slow and inattentive at that lounge. Once the dinner buffet opened, there was a line of 50 people waiting to get in. Was quoted 100,000 won per person to use the outdoor pool but when I went to check it out, I was told they sold so many packages that I probably wouldn't be able to use it. I've been to other Seoul hotels on weekends but there's so much going on at this property (duty free shoppers, weddings/events, people coming for restaurants, hotel guests) that it's very hectic (the lobby in particular).The property was much more tranquil on the weekdays. Room service was very fast. Although the breakfast buffet was very crowded, the staff was very attentive and professional. Front desk staff also friendly.At the end, I give the Shilla a "very good" rating on TA. The reason being, it's still one of the top 5 hotels in Seoul but no longer the very best (my vote goes to the Four Seasons).
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, very modern, clean, perfect for what I needed. Would definitely return. Airport bus stops right outside the hotel so makes commuting back and forth between the airport hassle and stress free
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the best hotel that I was able to check in to, at least as of this posting. The rooms are amazing, the services are superb, and it is in the heart of Seoul were you have access to almost everything.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Korea itself is just beautiful, the hotel is one of the best is Korea, and they do walk the talk, the room is great so clean along everything else in Korea. If you want the best this is the place to stay, Oh and you must try their buffet restaurant for breakfast etc. just wonderful, their services are always on point. Loved it so much.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives: Ideal size rooms with a terrific bathroom | best breakfast I've ever had with hundreds of cold and hot dishes (from traditional food to continental buffet) | very large and luxurious common areas | the hotel has a duty free | free shuttle service to myeong-dong several times a day | metro station just in front of the main hotel gate | attentive and dedicated staff without being intrusive | live music every day in the hotel bar | Conference spaces and coffee breaks of the most beautiful I've ever seen | best heated interior pool I've seenNegatives: bar price table is very high (+/- 12 euros for an espresso) | the level of English of the employees is not all the same (only those of the reception communicate competently in English) | you have to pay a fee to use their external pool
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great long weekend in Seoul with our family with older children. We’re members of the Leading Hotels of the World and had 2 rooms. The rooms were very nice and the beds great. Also the service was very good and everybody was very attentive and helpful. My wife and me wanted to chill at the outdoor pool one evening for less than an hour and we heard that there is a fee of 60.000Krw (approx USD 60) per person. We argued that this was not indicated anywhere and we were guests of the hotel that the pool must be free of charge as we have never experienced this on any continent in any hotel in the world. They let us in and we got lounge chairs by the adult pool which was forbidden for children under 13 years. However, the pool had tens of screaming kids with their parents which is fine for us but not if it is supposed to be an adult pool!It seems Shilla is selling some Pool packages to outside guests, but please change this for guests staying at the hotel as it is expected that Hotel guests have full access to all the pools. Also, please keep the small children in the children’s pool.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Shilla is a great hotel. The rooms are nice and the service is top.Especially the indoor swimming pool is nice. Obviously the hotel is a little bit pricey. Especially drinks and food are expensive.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’d say that this is one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed in and I’ve atayed at most top hotels !! Beautiful rooms with stunning sunsets from upper floor rooms facing the mountains . Wonderful , just amazing . The outdoor pool was great , tasteful and fun ! Sadly the staff are too over zealous and unfortunately, I’d say this was the most unwelcoming hotel I’ve been to . No smiles , and when they do it feels forced and with an air of disdain . My biggest regret was the lady in charge of The Library Restaurant. I’d invited a beautiful Korean Artist friend , and we were seated next to the band stand ! The trumpet player almost burst my ear drums , so we asked to be moved !! This lady moved us to another area , with a look of a boss lady at a goulag . Made us feel totally TOTALLY awful !! Nasty !! Just for this reason , I’d never stay here again . Which is a shame because it really is a stunning hotel > NOPE NEVER . Other points to be aware of , the rooms are very reasonably priced and out of proportion to the exhorbitant restaurant prices . Also this place is not for the casual traveler , it is totally out of the way of any thoroughfares .
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I stayed in the Shilla Seoul for 4 nights.We arrived the hotel at around 10 am and was told that one of our rooms is ready. It was a pleasant surprised as the hotel did not reply my email on early check in request in spite of repeated mails. The hotel stands on a stunning green beautiful landscape and a grand exterior.Rooms were very comfortable though not the most luxurious among the 5 stars. In fact there is a broken tile in the bathroom which I wonder why was is not replaced as it was a loose floor trap tile.Otherwise we enjoyed stunning view of the mountains and the Seoul tower with comfortable beddings and the standard 5 star bathroom equipments.Staying in the executive business deluxe rooms allow us the access to the lounge which provides real quality food (breakfast, snacks, afternoon tea and cocktail) and service and a well equipped gymn plus a lap pool. Generally service staff are very helpful and polite but business like that results in lacking in personal touch and warmth.The hotel is not near any places of interest. But there’s free frequent shuttle service to Myeongdong and Dongdaemum so it’s quite convenient after all. On the whole, my family and I had a very relaxed and enjoyable stay in this traditional yet modern hotel.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was not happy with the stay. Room temperature was too hot. Even in 18 degrees it was hot. Japanese food was not up to the mark. Very expensive and the food was not that great. Bar was nice and service was good.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the chance to stay in this hotel several times including the royal suite with sauna in the room. This hotels combines luxury and comfort seamlessly with impeccable service. The in-house Chinese restaurant is my family’s favorite place to go have Peking duck. In addition, you will never look at jajangmyeon and tangsuyuk the same way after eating here. This hotel also happens to have the best quality duty free shop in the city in my opinion. Just expect the usual army of Chinese tourists who shop here in droves. But once you get over that (if you can), then this place offers quality name brands to shop duty free.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m traveling quite often to Seoul and tried several hotels. I must say that The Shilla is to ne by far the best hotel in town. The rooms are very spacious and elegant. Amenities are perfect and most of all the staff is incredibly nice and helpful. I’d definitively stay again (and again) at The Shilla.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked 2 nights and had expectations.It was only after the first day then I realized there’s only 1 day breakfast included in this "business package". I called to check and the male staff sounded so rude and aloof.The reason why I booked this business plan is because it sounded that breakfast is included during my stay. It is package/plan for a reason.I also wrote to clarify but reservation still didn’t make it clear. I also asked the receptionist when I check in but nothing was said.It's like i ordered a gimbap but there is no egg, spinach and ham in it. This is very misleading because of how it is worded on your website.Thanks but no thanks.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just checked in at Shilla hotel Seoul. Since we arrived early in the morning (8am), they didn’t have a room ready so we were asked to wait until 3 pm. We wanted to make a reservation at the Guerlain spa while waiting and asked the front desk staff if that is possible but he responded, “I don’t know. You will have to go upstairs yourself to check the availability.”I mean... Why is it not possible to check it at the front? We asked again and he responded back saying “so you want me to make a call?” in a pretty rude tone. Am I asking for something impossible? He insisted he can’t make a call or make a reservation because the room is not ready and we don’t have a room number. Huhhh? Why can’t we just give them our credit card and charge it to the room when it’s ready?I asked to speak to the manager, she came out and called the spa and the spa didn’t have availability til later today. That means, if we had gone upstairs to ask ourselves, we wouldn’t have been able to get in anyway, so why was it a big deal to make a simple phone for the guest? Mmmm. This is my second time staying at shilla but I definitely think the level of service has gone down a lot.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed the hotel. Nice room, good views. The location is a little far away from places you might want to go. Restaurants are excellent, but pricey. Staff was very helpful. Meeting rooms were very good.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel for a living. I'm in hotels every week. I've been in Asia since the early 1990s. When I checked into The Shilla, I had no idea that my mind was about to be blown away.South Korea is NOT known for having quality English speakers... Although you'd not know that if you'd only been to the Shilla. The majority of the front desk staff speak such excellent English I wondered if they had some sort of exchange program.Additionally, there are several that speak accentless Mandarin Chinese!The happy staff, from the doorman that refuse tips, top the bell hops, to the cleaning staff... Just fantastic.The spa is wonderful... Gotta go try. Next time I think I'll stay an extra day.The bedrooms... Perfect design. Huge flat screen TV, with a medium sized table, couch and a chair to sit at and watch... Plus a desk and desk chair.A king size bed with almost too many pillows. Air conditioning will go to whatever temperature you want.A bath tub and a separate stand up shower. The shower has the hand held wand as well as the RAIN shower head in the ceiling, and the water pressure is FANTASTIC, and the water temperature gets as hot as you want. A toilet with three Japanese style accessories.. From heated seat, to the bum gun bidet, to a light that goes on at night time helping men see where to aim! Automatic window blinds... A swimming pool outside (for use in summer) which apparently ous the best in Seoul... I'll find out I'm sure. Top floor business club...I brought some of the soap back home and my wife loved it (she normally throws it away saying poor quality).Live jazz off the lobby every night, multiple restaurant options. Nice views from the rooms, and sedate locale in Seoul.I'll never stay anywhere else in Seoul.I couldn't recommend it more.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here on our first visit to Seoul for vacation. The Shilla is a very top quality hotel and the service was some of the best we have ever experienced. We were always greeted when we arrived and left the hotel, the concierge desk was extremely helpful on several occasions, including helping us with a minor medical issue. I would definitely recommend this hotel for both a personal stay and for those doing business travel. It is located on a hill which offers some nice views of the area and also provides some "built in" exercise when you walk to the surrounding area. We booked a Business Deluxe Double room - which has King size bed, a sofa and chair, and one of the largest big screen TVs I have ever seen in a hotel room. Everything was very well maintained and well appointed. We found the room to be a great value. The one comment I offer, and this is not a complaint but an observation, is that the services in the hotel - restaurants, lounges, bakery, etc. are quite expensive, which was a surprise given the value of the room. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to those visiting Seoul.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Some designers have branded this hotel as a cold, functional place to sleep in.The lobby resembles a train station, an empty abandoned space with no character whatsoever.SHOOT THE DESIGNERS!Not a single plant or flower, except some on the reception desk.The breakfast area the same, cold and frigid.No lobby sitting for meetings, forcing guests to order beverages at the library at $19.00 for ONE CUP OF COFFEE!!If this is not a rip off I do not know what is.The rooms at those prices are nothing great.The toilet flush system is written only in Korean, I flooded the bath by pressing the wrong buttons.The only good thing justifying the high prices is that the staff in general makes huge efforts to please.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an exceptional hotel - Incredibly luxurious with spacious rooms, super comfortable bed, excellent service and an attention to every detail to ensure your comfort. The bathroom offered 3 different shower heads and a generous bath tub.There’s a great city view and though fairly near the busy Dangdaemon (20 min walk), the rooms are very quiet since the hotel is set back from the road on a hill.The breakfast buffet is a substantial one with both choice and quality.For the more active, we enjoyed the challenging 6-8km walk around nearby Namsan Park which is on a hill so provided us with the equivalent of 72 flights of stairs in a 2.5 hour walk.Definitely highly recommended!
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The elegance and comfort of the Shilla Hotel is still unsurpassed in Seoul. I have stayed with some international colleagues for two nights here and everything is flawless from the renovated rooms to the excellent restaurants, ranging from French, Chinese, Korean, Japanese to a great high-end buffet restaurant to the fantastic gym and spa. In the past I have stayed here numerous times and sometimes for weeks, but had not been back in 3 years, but everything is still perfect and even better. Definitely one of the best hotels in the world and a top member of Leading Hotels. This hotel belongs to the Samsung empire, so every room is equipped with the newest smart TVs and other gadgets, but no more free cell phones as in the past, when South Korea was using a different system. The staff is wonderful and highly efficient. A true home away from home.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel’s executive grand deluxe room in Sep. 2016.If you are planning to stay at the Shilla Seoul, I definitely recommend you to book an executive business Deluxe or a higher category which allows you to access the executive lounge room where they offer a very high standard food presentation 4 times daily and the fitness club including indoor pool and sauna. Even though it was my first visit to Seoul, I wished if I could stay whole day here rather than strolling around town.For shopping lovers, the Shilla’s duty free shopping place is located in a walking distance. Luckily, I have chance to stay at Shilla again next month. I am a great fan of their green tea chiffon cakes! Can’t wait to have them again.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first trip in korea…I can say it's really great place to stay at shila!Everyone looks very happy!That room was reall nice and i decited to visit there In may or june again!Thank u for gaved me a great memory!
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don’t know how long this hotel has been in existence but I am sure this is a Grand Dame of hotels in Seoul. Impressive lobby, a variety of restaurants and grand guestrooms attest to that. Even if it may be old, there is no indication that it is because of technology present everywhere from universal Wifi to hitech toilets and entertainment systems. I heard that Korean culture is striking a balance between tradition and modernity. The Shilla Seoul epitomizes this.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful service, great ambience, and near a Shilla Duty Free. The rooms are very clean and spacious; fun automatic blinds for the windows and high quality toiletries. Good Korean restaurant onsite. Very friendly service staff.
hotelName:
8    The Shilla Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is very good, convenient to shopping and eating. Opposite to the hotel has a 24 hour restaurant and a 7-11. Take 6015 bus from the airport direct to Royal Hotel. It only take 3 mins walk from Royal Hotel to Skypark.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, super close to metro station, staff very friendly and super easy check in.  Lots of restaurants and shops very nearby, Cash exchange machine in the lobby which we found very convenient... highly recommend!
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Im told Myeongdong is the #1 tourist destination in Seoul. Maybe. If so, then this hotel takes the sweet spot. Its just along the fringes of Myeongdong so nights wont be chaotic outside, but just really close enough to let you dive into the streets. Repeatedly. Its also just a few minutes’ walk away from Euljiro-1 train station, and from there you can get to most anywhere in Seoul. If that wasn’t enough there's a scheduled hotel shuttle that would take you to Dongdaemun and other areas.Check in was smooth and relatively quick. The hotel has a modern feel to it. The room is reasonably spacious for a family of four. There are a sufficient number of electrical outlets, but most are of the type peculiar to the country. Better check your device chargers to ensure they are compatible. In-room wifi can be spotty at times. Sleep quality is good, but at times the airconditioning can get a tad warm.Breakfast buffet is served in the basement. Not very much in terms of variety, but thankfully the food tasted great. If you tire of the pickings, theres plenty of restaurants outside: A Starbucks just downstairs, Mos Burger, a McDonalds a street away, a 711 just in front of the building, and an Isaac's about a block or two away. The staff was very professional and willing to help. All of which make for a great stay in the country’s #1 tourist destination. Do I consider staying here again? Absolutely.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Skypark Central is in a good location. Easy access to Myeongdong and Euljiro3 stations. Hotel provides complimentary shuttle bus round trip from Seoul station to hotel. For schedule refer to hotel website. There are 3 Skypark properties in Myeongdong. I like the location of Skypark Central best. There is lots of eateries and cafe and 7-11 across from hotel. Shopping street is less than 5 mins away. Room and toilet are clean. We had a comfortable stay.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were okay. But frankly. The breakfast was worse than a 3000KRW breakfast in a 3 star hotel in Busan. And I paid 11000KRW for theirs? It was a rip off. And being a 2018 Golden Circle award winner? You should rip that off while you’re at it.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in the heart of the city. Just few minutes walk from the Line 2 Subway and the 6015 Airport Bus from and to the airport. All the hotel staff are friendly, helpful and speak fluent multi languages. We stayed five nights and there are a street of 24 hrs stores and restaurants out there but still very quiet and safe. The housekeeping was good, clean and tidy. Except one thing that the toilet is relatively small, other than that we felt satisfied our stay in Skypark Central.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this for the location knowing that it was going to be a basic hotel with basic amenities and not much more but it meets expectations for this. Our booking included complimentary breakfast and late check out but the breakfast is very dismal (terrible coffee, basic choices like rice, soup, bread. The only fruit was oranges. By the way, plenty of 24 hour korean restaurants around that would serve better food so you wont miss out on much!They have a coin operated laundry on floor B2 which would be convenient for longer stays. We also liked that they had hot/cold water dispensers on our level and on the ground floor. No need to keep buying water at the convenience stores (for those picky about tap water).Location: EXCELLENT. 3 minute walk to the green subway line and also the airport bus stop. And literally steps from Myeongdong shopping and restaurants.The room: we were in a twin room on the 12th floor. It had a fake window that did open but opened up into a fake garden that has an overpowering room freshener smell - probably due to the smoking room nearby. Our room was non-smoking. Bathroom was good sized and shower was great. Basic amenities (shampoo, shower gel, lotion). There's a TV in the room. We requested for an iron but the ironing board was broken. The room is also very hot and stuffy we so basically left a room key in the slot to keep the power on and blasted the AC. Even then, it was only marginally better and the air is VERY DRY.Overall, fine for 3 days ... everything we needed for a shopping weekend in Seoul. As i mentioned, turnover is super high so there are tons of people leaving their luggage for storage at the ground level and people coming in and out of this hotel. Also the hotel does not have a safe in the rooms.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is so clean, staff is courteous and helpful, location is near the subway station. And a lots of things to do in the area. There are a lot of restaurants near by and even stores. It is a really great place if it is your first time in korea because you can try different kinds of street food and buy a lot of things for you to bring home for pasalubong/ gifts for your family. The hotel is very convenient and there are 7 elevens near by if you want to buy some snacks or things you need.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: OK.. good location within myeongdong at reasonable price ..Clean room.. gd service..However the pillow is too soft and only heater is available (no cool air con)..Bed may be abit soft causing slight backache..
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel with superb location. If you love shopping and eating but do not wish to travel, this is the hotel for you. Staff are also very friendly and helpful. Hotel also provides free shuttle bus to various locations. Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel location is very convenient that the airport bus stop and metro station are within a few minutes walk. Also it is good for those who love to shop around Myeongdong.Concierge is very helpful and polite.The air-conditioning of room was not function well.The food served at the breakfast was not warm/hot enough.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although we were here for one night, both my spouse and I enjoyed our stay. Reception staff were polite and efficient. Rooms were clean and very spacious. Best of all, in the heart of bustling Myeongdong and next to many good shops and eateries. Only drawback is that hailing a cab requires you to go to the main street to a cab shelter which is a bit inconvenient when hauling luggage in the rain.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whilst looking for a hotel in the Myeongdong area, I had initially looked pass Skypark Central as the reviews for the other properties within the group in the area weren’t favourable. Luckily, due to great value offering on one of the OTAs, I decided to click into it and was surprised to learn that the rooms in this property was more spacious and location ideal. Skypark Central was in the heart of all the Myeongdong action yet nicely tucked on a quiet street just a few steps to the nearest metro exit. We enjoyed a comfortable stay over 4 days though 1) sheets were never changed once 2) I question if towels were simply folded back or replaced each day 3) if you’re arriving early do not expect to try your luck to see if you can check in early regardless of whether rooms are available/not - you will not even be allowed to approach the front desk by the concierge/guest services team at the door and will be told that if you want to check in early you’ll have to pay. Otherwise, highly recommended and will stay again.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was perfect in Myeongdong - on the edge of the busy tourist zones but conveniently close to airport bus stops and the trains. Lighting next to the mirrors could be better and brighter but given the spacious room for 4 friends, we could live with it. We were put on the level with the smoker's room, which wasn't the most pleasant place to walk through. The staff were courteous and friendly. The hotel was exactly as expected from this chain and I will continue to stay at this chain for each of my future visits.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed this hotel on 14-17 Jan.For several years, I use it five times a year.Everytime,very Comfortable,very enjoyable,and very convenience stay ! I stayed with my mother.my friend. I am always pleased with all,because it is a good hotel. Always thank you the kind staff with a smile.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on 24-30 Dec 2018 and it's our second time here. We liked how the hotel is very conveniently located and everything was great the first time round, that's why we came back. BUT on our first night of the second time, we faced a big problem. While the outside temperature was -7 degree Celsius at 1.30 a.m. but, the temperature in our room was 28.5! (When we came here the first time, it was in January 2018, we got a room with proper window but this time our room has a window that opens to an indoor garden, which didn't seem to be useful at all.) It was suffocating and we were sweating and couldn't sleep. It was so bad that I had to go down to talk to the staff at 1.30! and all the staff could do was telling us that the hotel is operated with central heating/cooling system, and there's nothing we or they can do to make our room cooler. Their only advice was to turn off the heater (in which we did, but it didn't make any difference at all, the temperature in the room still fluctuated between 27 and 28.5 degree). In the end, the staff gave us an electric fan! Believe it or not! We had to turn on a fan while it was -7 degree outside! And the result? I got sick the next day because of the unnecessary heat in the room, the breeze from the fan, and the sleepless night. We had to endure it the whole night and the next morning, I asked and was able to move to the room with the proper window that opens to outside world. It was better but I was already disappointed and I wish the staff could be of any better help, as we had to pack our bag and check-out of our old room before 12, and had to come back at 2 to check in to our new room. Apart from the central heating/cooling system problem, I really like this hotel and I really want to suggest the hotel to do something about it. I was gonna make Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong my go-to hotel every time I visit Seoul, but with this problem, I think I'll have to reconsider.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the staff speak very good english. rooms were kept clean always, the only comment i need to make is the time the room is made up, it takes them quite a while to clean but other than this, definitely worth staying. over all location is excellent for our needs, good restaurants just steps away, shopping is very accessible. we wl be staying with them again come april 2019, in fact our reservations have been made.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very conveniently located near 2 subway stations and tons of eateries and shopping. Airport bus drop off point is within short walking distance too. Most importantly, room though a bit small was very clean and housekeeping did good job of cleaning up the room and replenishing necessities daily. Will definitely return again!!
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel is located inside Myeongdong, therefore it is easy good if you will like to do last min shopping also have late meals. the room is big enough, even we go with triple sharing, the staff is friendly and helpful. they also cater shuttle bus to Seoul station, therefore it is really convenience to go to the airport express at Seoul by the shuttle bus. traveling to the subway is also easy, myeongdong station or the other station is only mins away.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is on the edge of the streets of Myeongdong. Close to the bustling pedestrian streets, but nice and quiet at the same time. The airport bus 6015 stops just around the corner, so it's very convenient.The room was clean and cozy, but I found the twin beds a bit small. The design of the bathroom isn't great either as there are no shelves to place your own toiletries.As for service, the bus to Seoul station was great, however I am disappointed that when we checked in and asked about directions etc, the staff did not mention anything about the free shuttle - surely that is one of the first things they should respond with when asked questions about transport?We are definitely going to stay here again as it's good value and the location is really unbeatable.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 何度も渡韓していますが、初めてこのホテルに泊まりました。エントランスのスタッフさんは、入るなりスーツケースを運んで下さり、とても丁寧でした。乙支路入口駅のショッピングセンター2番出口（階段です）から近いですし、近くにスターバックス、セブンイレブン、オリーブヤング、両替所もそろっていて困りません。ホテルの下にはネリムソン参鶏湯があり、とても美味しいのでおススメです。同時期に中国からの観光客の方々が同階に泊まられていたので、騒々しいのは仕方ないかなと思いました。I have been to Korea many times.I stayed at this hotel for the first time.The staff at the entrance was very good hospitality for us!!!Nearby is the Station, where there are a convenience store, Starbucks and Olive Young.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Right inside Myeongdong, yet very close to the Airport Bus stop. The Euljiro-1-ga subway station is also a 2 min walk away. So in terms of transportation and connecting to the rest of Seoul, this is an ideal hotel to stay.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel located in the central of shopping district in the heart of myeongdong. Easy to find food esp korean bbq and typical myeongdong street foodNear the station (Euljiro1 il ga station / line 2)The hotel provide free shuttle bus from hotel to seoul station, shilla duty freeStaff are very friendly and helpfulStarbucks located at the first floor and 7/11 infront of the hotel.Myeongdong cathedral, city hall and N tower can be reach by walking.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very Clean Room, Super Convenient , Train Station within 5 min walk , Famous Night market just at the hotel . Will be back to stay again in future . staff are super friendly & Starbucks cafe is just beside the hotel
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a few steps to the Mueongdong street food, shopping streets, euljiro1 metro and airport limousine bus stop. Less than 10 mins walk to the Myeongdong metro station also. You’ll never get hungry because this hotel is very near whatever kind of restaurant that you can think of. Staff are very nice and accommodating. Room is clean and relatively spacious. I’ll stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I find that Skypark hotels are generally very well-located, and this is no exception. It's tucked in a quiet area, but still within the bustling shopping streets of Myeongdong. Plenty of restaurants and shops around, rooms are of a good size. I love the touches like the free nail polish bar in the hallways and the amenity samples that they provide! Breakfast is free if you book directly with the hotel, but I'll skip that if I have to pay for it.There are plenty of options around.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location with lots if shopping and food. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Only setback is the breakfast. Soups are cold and they do not replenish unless you ask. For the price, it's better to go out to eat. Will still highly recommended.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good service at concierge and spacious room layout in great location for street food & shopping. Highly recommended for shoppers who value convenience and variety all in a centralized location. Overall great experience.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception was polite and helpful. Two twin bedroom was small but clean. On rainy day umbrella was provided. Lot of restaurants around hotel. Closed to subway and department stores. within 5 minutes walked to airport bus stop. Recommended.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Location is excellent. Right in the middle of Myeongdong. Rooms are good although a bit smaller than what I was expecting. Tons of restaurants and boutique shops surrounding the hotel. Near subway station as well.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location which close to subway and airport bus station. Easy to go shopping and nice to have free shuttle bus to Seoul Station. Quick service response and can communicate with English and Mandarin.
hotelName:
9    Hotel Skypark Central Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
