The royal hotel is a patriotic to China, using china made tooth brush, shampoo, shower gel despite most korean hotels are using korean made shampoo and bath soap, this is something I like and the quality is good, definitely will come back to stay for these pro-china products and speculatively, may be the hotel restaurant is using ingredients from china instead of korean which I have not idea. Even the curtain is the ? china made $10 one, if not wrong, i can recognise the buckle on the rail. It is clean. The bed has only one pillow, for a person. The bed quality is good. I, just happened to look down at the floor underneath the bed, when I was searching my headphone, it was dusty, dirty and there was a piece of candy there. As a whole, a very enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Royal Hotel is a gem! Location is in the heart of Myeongdong which is known for night life because of the vibrant street food, street vendors, restaurants, shops, malls etc.... everything is nearby including the MRT , bus stops, Lotte World mall. Mc Donalds, starbucks, Paris Baguette and others are just around a block away as well. Everything is really so near! Korean BBQ’s are everywhere too. The rooms are a good size! We stayed in a room with 3 beds and it fit 4 adults and a kid comfortably. The beds are soft and crisp as well as pillows. The rooms are very clean and made up daily with water replenishment. The bathrooms are an average size and kept clean. They provide toiletries daily and slippers. I would definitely stay in this hotel over and over again ! Loved it!!!
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was unsure what area to stay in in Seoul, because it's such a vast city, but Myeongdong served us well, with great food, shopping and train access nearby, and major tourist attractions including temples, the N Seoul Tower and markets within walking distance.This hotel's exterior, lobby, bar and other exclusive spots are all a little bit fancier than the rooms themselves. I was disappointed with the mini bar (and the bar shut before midnight), and no iron in the room, but these were small things. Largely, we had everything we needed.The airport shuttle was very helpful!
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location around tons of foot traffic areas. Always bumping and crowded outside in this neighborhood. Street vendors and stuff will sell you tasty food at night and random stuff during the day. The hotel is a nice little oasis in the busy street below. Super sexy bar in the lobby. Wife and I also got a couples massage that wasn’t very expensive and felt ahmazing. We didn’t find tons of restaurants in the neighborhood we loved. So we would go to Itaewon or hongdae.Close to a few different subway lines, and you can buy your T money card across the street in the 7-11.Can walk to the cable car that takes you to the top of the mountain. 30 year old Americans point of view anyway! Have fun in Seoul.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotels location is super convenient and its easy to get around the city. Rooms are super clean and very reasonable for the price. I would highly recommend this hotel for everyone visiting Seoul, you wont be disappointed.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first trip to Seoul. I did research all the hotels’ reviews in TA here to find the best hotel to meet my preferences.Why did i choose RHS?Was it its location? It’s right inside Myeongdong, so enough said already. But so are the Lotte and Skypark chain of hotels. But it’s worth to mention that RHS is situated between 2 subway lines within 5 mins of brisk walking.Or because it’s conveniently accessible from the Incheon and Gimpo Airports? Most who stay in Myeongdong would surely use the airport limousine bus which made stops within yards of most hotels. Though RHS offers free airport shuttle, any day there’s only 2 service running and your arrival may not fit into its schedule. But then there’s another option. Ride the AREX to Seoul Station. Take the lift to 3F to exit the turnstile and immediately on your right take the lift to 1F. Out of the lift on your right you will see one of the station exits. Here you can take the RHS free shuttle right to the hotel doorstep. But i also knew that Tmark and Skypark hotels operate free shuttle there too. [Here i deviate so as to mention the Seoul Station Airport Terminal. If you are flying out of Incheon on a SK airline flight, and use the AREX Express, you should take advantage to do the flight check-in at the station. You bypass the crowd and long lines at the airport checking-in, and also enter airside through a dedicated express immigration/customs clearance. Save you much hassle and extra time to explore the beautiful airport.]I decided on RHS because they offered a affordable package stay for members. Free instant sign-up at their website. Included were a deluxe room, daily buffet breakfast for 2, in-room premium coffee, daily 1-piece laundry, 1-time welcome drink and daily cake & beverage (choose from menu) in the coffeehouse, a welcome gift and Club access.Why did i give a 3* rating for my stay? The property itself deserves fully 5*, but i rate my stay experience 2*.Really there’s nothing to fault the property. My partner loved the entrance revolving door which so far we had only seen in 5-star hotels. It’s relatively new, so condition is spick and span. The ambience throughout is quite nice and one could get a good feel like being in a 5-star property. The Club on the 21F has a stately atmosphere and great view of the iconic Seoul N Tower. The room size by Seoul standard is quite good. The king-size bed is firm and very comfortable. The website says they have a pillow menu but I didnt have the need for it. WiFi connectivity is good and fast. The big LCD TV offered a wide selection of channels. All the amenities one would expect at a 4-star hotel are there. The bathroom was equipped with full set of bath amenities which were replenished daily. The shower and taps water temperature & pressure was consistently good. The buffet breakfast in the restaurant had a very good spread and live egg station. At the Club continental breakfast was served and as normal choices are limited. We did have the option to dine at either place. I would say that the property exceeds its 4-star rating. Perhaps 5-star but without a swimming pool.Why made me not too thrilled with the stay?I arrived Incheon early morning after the airport shuttle scheduled time. So proceed to Seoul Station on AREX to catch the station shuttle bus. (Personally it was more convenient for me as I wanted to limit my walk dragging 2 large suitcases.) I almost missed the shuttle. The minibus with the RHS livery was in the parking lot all the while before the scheduled departure time. The driver drove up to the assigned waiting spot, took a glance at us (there were only 2 of us) and before i could react he drove off. I chased after him and luckily he did stop for us. He came out and I told him we were going to RHS. He then demanded proof that we were RHS guests. I would not say that he was rude but his manners were curt.We could not do the check-in but were allowed to leave our suitcases at the Concierge. It was 10:30am. The 3-staff Concierge was especially busy with guests streaming into the lobby to deposit their bags, but the 4-staff Front Desk was relatively unoccupied having only to handle occasionally guests checking out. Made me wonder why they couldn’t just do the check-in process and then we returned later to pick up the room key. (This was my experience with hotels in Bangkok, HongKong and China cities.) It was cold outside so i hanged around in the lobby for awhile using the WiFi to organise my emails. And as I observed the happenings in the lobby, I noticed the staff attitude towards different guests rather inconsistent. So much so that i thought they were actually selective, if you catch my drift. I did not have a good vibe being there so I spent the next 3 hours at the Starbucks opposite the hotel.At check-in time, joined a line and when my turn came, was told to bring my bags with me to do the check-in at the Club on the 21F. Here the management ought to take note for improvement which is my objective for writing this review. An prior email to prompt me of this privilege would have save me some hassle. And if had allowed the early check-in (just the registration) and let me rest in the Club it would be excellent. And also save me the hassle trudging with my suitcases up to the 21F and then to my room. Could not arrange for my bags sent from Concierge to my room after check-in? And on the subject of email, I sent an email to reservations to seek clarification of the airport shuttle schedule which was ignored. Subsequently i posted the enquiry in the website then the reply came.On one occasion i was waiting for the lift with 2 staff in suits who appeared obviously to be RHS managers. We exchanged glances, yet they just displayed a nonchalant attitude. Not a greeting or just a smile for a guest your hotel?Throughout my short 3-night stay i felt an air of snobbery among the staff. The only greetings i got are from the humble housekeeping staff i met at the rooms corridor and the servers at breakfast. But there were 2 saving grace. One was a young female Concierge staff whom i approached to asked about the free shuttle to Seoul N Tower. Knowing that the bus was already scheduled to depart she personally ushered us out to catch the bus. When i realised that we were the only 2 passengers i didn’t want to be bothersome and suggested making the 20-minute walk there instead. But she was so persistent that I use the shuttle, repeatedly assuring me that it was the hotel service which I was entitled to use. The other was the male service staff at the coffeehouse where we had our daily cake & beverage. Seem like he was the only staff then (before noon, April 16-18). Very friendly gentleman who could remember our preferred beverages after the first day order. Regretfully I did not get either of their names because my poor eyesight couldnt read their name tags. The concierge girl spoke good English.And by the way, another good reason I choose this hotel over the nearby Lotte - I smoke, and this hotel has room that allow smoking.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay here. The location is right at the start of the street shopping craziness of Myeongdong. So easy to bring your bags of shopping back to your room to go out for more. The hotel was built with 5 star aspirations but the location and current pricing is bringing tacky tourist like me feeling a bit underdressed when I walk in the lobby. We had the standard king room which was small but very clean and nicely appointed. Nice bar set up with wine glasses and free coffee and tea. The wash let toilet was wonderful. The housekeeper on the 12th floor was amazing. So friendly and helpful. I wish I got her name. Late check out at 2:00 pm cost me an extra $22 but was worth it. Free shuttle to the airport. Highly recommend for the price we paid. Side note: we arrived at the airport just before midnight and most of the trains and busses were stopped. We took the international taxi for $65 door to door. Great service from our driver Mr. Jin.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the Incheon airport, take shuttle bus 6015 (cost KRW $15,000) and it will take you to the main street (Eulji-ro), once off the bus, just walk east (continue with the direction where the bus travels) to the first small street, turn right to walk up hill and turn right again at the end of the road and the hotel is at your right hand side. The hotel is very similar to hotels in Japan. Small room, but clean and comfortable. There is also an umbrella in the closet for rainy days. The toilet has bidet and automatically flushes. With jet-lag, I was looking for the flush button and pressed the "Emergency" button by mistake. 15 seconds later, the front desk called to make sure that everything was ok :)I got a Myeondong map from the front desk and it has pretty much all the key points of the area. Day 1: I walked east from the hotel to Kwangjang market (~30 min) and Dongdaemun though the alley with many restaurants selling the special chicken soup. I ate at the one with less people waiting and it was not too bad, though cost KRW $22,000! There is a restaurant next to it selling dog meat soup :(I did not visit Jongmyo shrine, but you should add it since it is in the same area.Day 2: I walked north through Insa dong to Bukchon village (~ 40 min.), to Gwanghwamun and then back. I also recommend visiting Myeongdong Cathedral, which is just southeast of the hotel two minutes walking distance.There are two restaurants that I highly recommended, once is the Sinseon Seolleongtang (milky bone soup), which is across the street from the hotel to the right. Another one is Myeongdong Kyoja, which is famous for their dumplings and noodles.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very nice and clean, but the best about it is fact it is located in the middle of the Myeongdong street, where you can buy and eat everything. In the evening whole life is here! Disadvantage can be small room, but this is something very characteristic for whole Asia. In this place you will eat very tasty breakfast, so be sure you buy option including it. Recommended place!
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lots of stores, restaurants, and street food vendors right outside the door! Short walk to subway. Changdeokgung Palace, Gyeongbokgung Palace, Namsangol Hanok Village, N Seoul Tower all within walking distance. Room was very spacious compared to rooms in Japan. Rooms are very clean. Robes and slippers are provided and makes you feel right at home. Bed is very comfy. Two free bottled waters everyday. We included the breakfast when we booked. It is buffet style and caters for Asians and westerners. A really great value considering the variety of food that they serve. Staff is very friendly and attentive to their guests. Would definitely recommend and would stay here again next time.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel is conveniently located in Myeong-dong area. The only plus. But we encountered a lot of issues/problem during the stay. 1. Upon arrival we checked in at the front desk and a guy who doesn’t have any name plate assisted me. I have several questions and he said “stop talking” with a hand gesture.2. The a/c inside our room wasn’t working retaining the 26 degrees temperature which wasn’t really comfortable. I tried telling them 3 times but wasn’t fixed during pur 4 night stay. 3. The lounge access wasn’t really worth it paying extra. 4. They made a mistake regarding my bill. We stayed at the lobby for an hour to wait for the bus shuttle but did not realize the error they made. Upon arrival at the airport we weren’t allowed to go down the bus and an “employee” ( claimed he is) in civilian clothes, without any if id with him told me to pay them the balance i “owe” them. A girl who wasn’t even apologetic over the phone which the guy handed me. demanded me to pay them the money i owed them. I told them it’s your mistake and now you are harassing me? This is something that can be handled properly if they can communicate in a nice way. But the way they approach me and told me about the error wasn’t really right and even told me i cannot ever leave the country. THIS HOTEL MADE ME FEEL UNSAFE IN SEOUL.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my girlfriend stayed in room number 1110 for 8 nights from 09- 17 April, we are glad that we made the choice of staying in this amazing hotel. The staff were very helpful, the rooms were neat and clean and the location was excellent. It is totally worth it! Loved this area so much
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided to stay at this Hotel, instead of Marriott Courtyard Namdaemun (where we stayed last), to be in the middle of Myeongdong. We were so happy with the decision.The Hotel is great - great location and great price. We booked a Family Room with discounted rate for being the Hotel preferred guest. When we checked in late (after 11PM), the Room was already prepared for us on the high floor with a bottle of wine. We were also given cakes and drinks as welcome gifts, which we picked up 2 days later.The Family Room was spacious, with 3 beds. It was perfect for the 3 of us - one bed for each. It was clean. Bottled water was put in the room daily. I am not sure whether because I am a Hotel preferred guest or not. But the additional care is nice.The location is perfect, as we could walk to any restaurants and shops, and the street vendors. They are literally just outside the hotel door. Lotte Department Store is just a few minutes away. My wife and daughter enjoyed their shopping as they just walked back to drop stuff and continued their shopping. Other shopping (Namdaemun Market) and attractions are nearby. We were able to walk from Gyeongbokgung Palace back to the Hotel.The only disappointment is the light daily schedule for the complimentary shuttle to/from airport, as we were not able to take advantage of it. I wish the Hotel would add more trips to the schedule.This hotel is DEFINITE our Seoul hotel from now on.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is right in the area of the night markets. This is very interesting and gives a great Seoul experience. The hotel was comfortable and very clean. Staff was helpful and friendly. The only negative was we could not get a late meal in the hotel. Our flight was delayed and we arrived later than we expected. Went out to Macdonalds! We had no Korean cash for street venders.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The royal hotel is the best place to stay if your looking for price, location and comfort. Great staff great location and always great on price. I’ve stayed in a lot of overpriced hotels in Seoul with substandard service and rooms. If you looking for a fantastic economically priced hotel with a central location then this is your place.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The room was very comfortable and well appointed and very quiet, however, it was not as spacious as other rooms we've had in the city. It is very centrally located in Myeongdong so close to shopping and restaurants as well as Namsam. They offer a free airport shuttle 4 times a day that was also handy. The only complaint is that they only offered a very expensive breakfast and that they took all day to clean the room - sometimes not even done when we got back around 4pm.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good 4 stars hotel in the perfect location for shopper. Clean and the best is that they have 3 individual single beds...perfect for odd number travelers. Highly recommended. Although there is a little bit inconvenience for airport travel. But in overall is good
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling for business but will surely come back for please.Perfect location smack dab in the middle of the Myeongdong district. Close to hundreds of restaurants and enough shopping to surely make a dent in your wallet.The hotel is in superb condition. The staff super friendly and super efficient.Top notch and would recommend to anyone traveling solo or w/ a family.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a late review, I've finally found some time to login and actually do reviews. We stayed with our three kids and was our first time in Seoul, and could not have picked a better hotel to experience Myeongdong. Hotel is clean and well maintained. We did not use any of the hotel amenities, so can't comment, staff were very helpful in making recommendations and answering questions. They are better hotels, for sure, but for those visiting Seoul for the first time, I highly recommend staying at the Royal.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the reason for the stay was location as is located in the heart of Myeongdong the hotel staff is a reason in itself .They are polite and go out of the way to make your stay comfortable , as should every hotel .Beautiful rooms serviced with daily toiletries tnhen there is akettle and a coffee maker too in the room .Their club for executive rooms at the top is a nice place to unwind though not many food they serve .Breakfast very good with huge selections and the view from the top 21st floor just magnificent .They have shuttle service for Seoul Station many times a day though Metro station is a mere 4-5 mts walk away .
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've booked the room on smoking floor, however, hotel given me the room on non smoking floor and i want to change the room. And hotel said no more smoking room.An email was send to hotel for upgrade the room as my birthday trip, they do nothing.Hotel was bad, only one thing, hotel location was very good. That it. Never back to this hotel when i back to Seoul
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient location in Myeongdong for easy shopping and access to a number of street food at night. In addition, just across the hotel is 7-11, Starbucks, Congee House and the 24-hours Sinseon Seolleongtang. Room was a bit small, which is fine except that it might be tight if you bring several large luggage. No need to bring an adapter cause the room is equipped with The complimentary shuttle to Seoul Station also made it more convenient to go to the airport during the afternoon.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had our incentive trip this year in Seoul Korea.We stayed here for 4 days .This hotel is very accessible .Food park,shopping .If you plan to visit to visit korea with your family ,this hotel is well recommended.Rooms are huge and staff are very friendly.The toilet bowl is electronically operated.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel is really convenience, which located at Myeongdon and you can buy almost everything downstairs. shuttle bus is provided by hotel.however I had got a room without window , it was really bad.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was everything with this hotel and for the most part, staff was friendly, especially the guys calling for cabs or greeting you at the door. There were two gentlemen that I wish I knew their names because they were super friendly and always greeting me every time I came into the hotel. That was a good feeling. The room was nice and comfortable. I think my only gripe is similar to the others who mentioned about early check in. I think perhaps the hotel should review its policy on early check-ins. In our case we were super early to the hotel as we flew in from Los Angeles. It's kind of beyond our control that our plane arrives in the early morning. I was willing to pay extra for early check-in but they said no. As a result we had to wait from around 8am to 2pm. That's a long wait especially when you've already had a such a long night/day of travel. As the final hours approached during our wait it became almost comical as we noticed the staff were running out of space to hold the luggage of other travelers waiting to get their rooms. The staff then had to place suitcases in the lobby area and then they put some sort of large fishnet over the suitcases to designate the area I guess. It was quite a sight. Overall, I actually would stay here again as I really loved the location and being so close to the street food and easy access to transportation is always great. Seoul is quite a city and if you really want to make your stomach happy, go to the incredible Gwangjang Market. Wow! The food there is so amazing and the overall atmosphere is really nice..
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros Location - Hotel is situated in the quiet zone of Myeongdong shopping area. Shops and restaurants are within a very short walk. The hotel is in between 2 subway stations, blue line and green line.Free hotel shuttle bus to airport - i is very convenient to travel to airportAmenities - high quality of in room amenitiesLots of plugs - the number of plug provided in room is sufficient for 2 people, near 2 side of the bed, at the desk with additional usbNesspresso - the complimentary 2 nesspresso capsules a day, normal one and decafOusulloc tea - the famous tea from Jeju is in the minibar with complimentary :PConsService at reception - the hotel claimed 5 star at the entrance, but services from reception when i checked in was much below 5 star standard. the staff is not friendly, not helpful and lack of service mind. early check in is impossible, you need to pay an extra. Gym - small room with limited equipment and no swimming poolAll in all, i would recommend this hotel, given that perfect room experience, you can ignore services from staff for a pleasant stay
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a layover in Seoul I was fortunate to be booked by the air,ine into the Royal for the night. A lovely hotel with a terrific staff. Their dining room on the 21st floor had spectacular vies of the city. I would stay again.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, there is a free shuttle service that runs between Incheon Airport and the hotel which was a great relief as this hotel is right in the city.My husband and I were travelling with family members and we were provided this hotel by Korean Air as our stop-over hotel. We arrived fairly late in the evening but staff were very friendly and efficient. They quickly checked us in, gave us meal vouchers and informed us of the restaurant location, meal times and pick-up times.This was good as we were all very tired and did not want to be hanging around for long.Complimentary dinner consisted of a meat or vegetarian option. Each option was accompanied by soup and bread roll for a starter. Dinner was lovely.Rooms are very clean and warm. They also provide you with shower gel, lotion, shampoo etc, as well as other amenities such as a shaver and ear buds. This I found to be perfect as often you forget to pack these things in carry on luggage.The beds were comfortable to sleep in and curtains did a good job at keeping the lights out.Breakfast in the morning was more than enough and we all were able to make sure we had a good meal before heading back to the airport for our next flight.The hotel is also right in the city and if you have enough energy, walk into the city after dinner. There is a lot of activity, street food and a lot of shops will be open! This was a bonus for us as it allowed us to see a bit of Seoul in the few hours we were there.I hope we get to stay here again!
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We flew Asiana Airlines and had an unknown hotel in Seoul between connecting flightNote - When you arrive in arrivals afte4 baggage collection turn right and you will find Asiana desk down on the left - as we had difficult in finding.We were given a free complimentary transfer from the airport to the hotel which is about 60 km away.We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by reception and informed we had an evening meal and breakfast included, as it was late arrival we got to the restaurant about 9.55pm, we were the only ones there and felt the whole experience was very rushed, and there was no mention of alcohol to purchase when we made our order. We were done within 20 minsThe room was quite nice and a twin room, heated toilet seat was a bit different, and shower okay, good to see a variety of adaptors to charge the phone. View was of a building very close and opposite to our room.Breakfast was okay but several of the cooked items available were cold and had to wait for more to be cooked, staff appeared abrupt on service.The hotel is in a good location and appears to be in Cental Seoul. Sadly we didn’t have time to explore on arrivalOn booking out front of house staff very friendly, made sure we got to the correct transportation for the hotel, they shook our hands and wished us a safe journey which was a nice touch.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: and they do airport shuttle bus back and forth, amazing beautiful hotel right in the heart of myeongdong, step outside and everything you need is there, great for shopper price isnt that over the top. great value
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Royal hotel in located within Myeongdong and it has a driveway for cars/taxi while i noticed other hotels in Myeongdong doesn't have. -Shuttle bus to Seoul station -7-11, Starbucks, famous porridge and other restaurants around the hotel -3mins away from Myeong-dong Cathedral -Nice Club lounge with good view and ambiance
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 1 night as a layover provided by Asiana Airlines. Although it took an hour to get here from the airport it was well worthwhile. The hotel is immaculate, the welcome by the staff was fantastic and our check in was extremely fast.The room was amazing with every kind f extra you can imagine provided as standard!We had dinner on arrival in the 21st floor restaurant, fantastic food. Likewise breakfast in the morning. Wide choice and copious amounts of excellent food.I have absolutely no reservation about coming back here or recommending this hotel.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We we en-route to the Uk after spending time in Australia and our airline put us up in this hotel for one night. Korea is technically advanced but the simple touches at this hotel made it stand out from the rest.We got the usual you’d expect from a good quality hotel such as tea and coffee, complimentary water, shampoo and shower gel. There were also robes and slippers to make you feel extra comfortable. It seemed they’d thought of everything as in the bathroom drawer there was a hairdryer, toothbrush, toothpaste, shower cap and a sewing kit. The toilet had a lovely washing system which including bided, seat warmer and bottom dryer!My favourite and most useful extra touch was the electrical sockets which had usb, European, British, Australia and US. Why can’t every hotel provide this simple item? It made life much easier than rummaging for adaptor plugs.The staff were courteous and friendly, we didn’t eat dinner as we’d eaten in the flight but had a nightcap at the bar. They didn’t seem eager for us to go to bed and brought us a second sink when they saw that we’d finished our first.Breakfast was great. Again the staff were courteous and the food was lovely. On departure the concierge and reception manager came into the bus to wish us well and thank us for staying with them. They then waved us off until out of sight!A very pleasant stay in an interesting, bit very cold Seoul. If you ever visit at this time of year, take plenty of warm clothing as it’s freezing! But I would definitely stay at the Royal Hotel Seoul if I ever visited again.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, newish, and reasonably priced Myeong Dong hotel with some stylish touches. A good, if not great choice for the following reasons:Posities:-stylish executive floor lounge with sweeping views of central Seoul.-Central and convenient location, within walking distance of many sites.-free shuttle bus service to airport and elsewhere, but running during only limited hours.Negatives:-charges for ice delivery: $3. (pick up your ice at the 7-11 across the street).-some staff did not speak good English or were not particularly accommodating.-Limited food and drink choices in executive lounge, but still well worth the extra expense.-smallish rooms but not crampt.Overall, this hotel offers good value for the money. The location and executive lounge experience set the hotel apart from others in this upper-middle class range. During my two previous stays in Seoul, I stayed in fancier and much more expensive hotels in Gangnam. I spent half my time on the subway and in taxis, and would definitely stay at the Royal Hotel Seoul again.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a week in the ski resort and hongdae area before spending 9 days at this hotel. I gave an average rating as it's a great location but how it got a michelin award for 2017 beats me as the rooms are a little dim. I should have stayed Hotel 28 again as it's just on the other side, brightly lit and their staff .. thumbs up. Royal hotel however, has a mix of helpful and rude ones particularly the shuttle bus driver whom i have even attached his picture for rude behavior. At Seoul station boarding area, 13:50, 2 of us asked if the bus will leave at 14:10 since it's our first time taking the shuttle. He asked to see the hotel room card so we went up to the entrance to get it from our friends. Took just a minute since friends were just waiting behind the door entrance but the driver drove off to the parking lot?! We walked out to where he parked ..he was on the phone so we waited for quite some time and decided to show him our card from the window but he ignored us so we walked to the bus door but he shut the door immediately. Fine... got back to the entrance to wait, we saw him walk pass us twice to get his coffee and smoke, he saw us too but ignored us until it was 14:10, he drove to the boarding area and said we can board. When there's a little traffic jam, he was impatient and made some noise cursing some other driver. What is wrong with this guy.. First and last time to take this shuttle.. on another occasion, I wanted to borrow a lighter for a birthday cake but the female receptionist told me to buy it as she does not have one. Okay sure i can do that but she could ask the staff beside her or the staff room ..come on, most koreans smoke. I mean, she should be telling me that rooms have smoke detectors and it is a risk to lend guests lighters, hotel policy etc etc.. But don't tell me sorry I don't have it, you can buy it. ?!!!! thanks for being so helpful.....?
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As per the previous review posted, the room has been ridiculously hot since check in. I woke up from my nap in the evening at 7pm because of the heat even though I have opened the only window in the room. Staff mentioned the centralized heater can not be disabled. even with the heater on, the room was stuffy it was hard to breathe in it. Staff mentioned there was nothing that could be done. I have 5 more nights to endure in this heat, and I am questioning my decision on choosing this place as management response was poor with no solutions suggested.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m writing this review at 7:30 a.m. local time inside the hotel room. I’d prefer to be sleeping at this time of the day since this is meant to be a vacation. This is my second night here. On the first night, I must have woke up at least five times in the night. The heater in the room is somehow set at 27C and there’s nothing I could do to change it. So when it’s 2C outside I was sweating all night trying to get some sleep. Worse still the auto sensor doorway light which is meant to switch on when someone enters the room just randomly decides to go on and off at midnight, which is terribly annoying if not freaky. Second night, I figured that I should open the only window inside the room for some fresh air and to beat the heat. Unfortunately it was Christmas Eve and the rap music from the street is clearly audible even on this 19th floor. I ended up pulling the room card out from the electricity supply slot to stop the air con from functioning and rushing hot air out but this means no light whatsoever for midnight bio breaks. I booked last minute so had paid US$400 for a hot and tiny room with a double bed and not much space left. Breakfast choice is very limited also. It’s the location you are paying for and not much more. I booked this hotel based on TA reviews but hopefully others will know what to expect before booking.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For me the location of a hotel is always of prime consideration, along with price and quality. The Royal Hotel Seoul met my expectation across the board. The Royal is situated in the heart of the Myeongdong, an upscale shopping area of Seoul with a wide selection of restaurants within easy walking distance. It was also close to the departure point for the Seoul City Bus Tour and to the departure point for my visit to the DMZ. My room, albeit smaller than one might find in the USA, was comfortable, well appointed, and very clean. In all fairness smaller hotel rooms are pretty much the norm in Seoul so the overall hotel experience does not rate a penalty in this regard. I took a bus from the airport to the hotel. The bus does not stop directly at the hotel, rather nearby, which required a relatively short (several hundred yards) but uphill walk to reach the hotel. If you are traveling with a large amount of luggage or are disable to some extent than another mode of transport might be more suitable. The bus driver was not very helpful in pointing me in the right direction to find the hotel but a private security guard at an office building next to the bus stop set me off on the correct course. Overall I would most certainly opt to stay at the Royal Hotel during my next visit to Seoul, and would definitely recommend it to others.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is right in the streets of Myeong Dong.Very accessible to the subway via walking. The hotel is surrounded by many great food and shopping.The hotel room size is reasonably and the beds are big without the need for extra bed for kid.The hotel staff are friendly and helpful especially the concierge who are very eager to help us point the directions and best way to go around to our places of interest.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a Michelin rated hotel with great service and very nice rooms. The location is great. You are very close to many abstractions in the city and in the middle of the main shopping area of Myeongdong. Lot's of stores but mostly make-up and skin care. But also many great restaurants are nearby.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 6 days while touring Seoul and the surrounding cities. It is centrally located in Myeongdong. Perfectly located in the heart of a bustling area with all the shopping and eating places. The rooms are well-done and comfortable. The staff are nice and efficient but dont expect them to speak English well. I will stay here again if I go to Seoul.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a conveniently located hotel in Myeong Dong if you are aiming for a shopping trip with girls. Centrally located in the area accessible to bus and train stations. It has spacious rooms. Just 1-2 mins walk to restaurants and cafes as well as shops. Highly recommended for a shopping or short trip where you can get everything in Myeong Dong within walking distance.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having breakfast in The Garden was beautiful and relaxing. All the staff were polite and only too willing to help. Local knowledge was spot on and if ever I have the chance to return this will be my first choice. Even the maid service was special although their language skills were not so great but with a little effort I was understood..
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Asiana airlines booked me into this hotel whilst I was in transit and I am so glad they did. The hotel is about an hour from the airport but you get to see the city en route.The hotel staff were welcoming and the room was fantastic with a comfortable bed and other amenities. WiFi was great too.The breakfast room is on the 21st floor offering great views of the city. The choice was good too.I would recommend this hotel,
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I go shopping in Seoul every year. This is the first time I stayed in this hotel. The hotel overall is new and modern and the location is very convenient. Just few mins away to different subways stations and department stores. I booked a corner suite at reasonable rate. We even are given access to the club lounge at top floor which can oversee the beautiful view of Seoul and where you can enjoy some light snacks, fruits and drinks. The quality of breakfast is very good too with sufficient choices of food. I highly recommend you book the suites if you stay more than 3 days. Also, the hotel has free shuttle from or to airports which is very convenient and efficient. Last but not the least, I want to thank for a waiter in the lounge who helped providing a pack of ice cubes every morning for my husband to relief his shoulder's injury during the trip. The staff are very helpful although their English can be improved a bit. Overall, I highly recommend to stay in this hotel in Seoul. You will find everything is above your expectation against the room rate that you pay.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in the heart of Myeongdong where has many shops and street foods. Hotel itself is very clean and modern. Breakfast was good. There was no flexibility for early check in time because my room wasn't available. Otherwise, there is nothing to complain.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights at a premier corner room that was about 100 sq ft bigger than a regular room, it’s well worth the extra money. The décor was modern and clean, the toilet, the sink, and the bathtub/shower were in separate rooms, very convenient for 2 people. The Manager left us 2 small bottles of Australian red wine as a welcoming gift, a very nice gesture. There's no swimming pool but the gym was newish. The best part was the location, you stepped right in the core of Myeongdong, you could go to all the food stalls, cosmetic shops and restaurants in your pj’s! The cathedral and 7/11 were right across the street, the Metro was a few blocks away. With all these conveniences, the hotel stood on a small slope so the noise was cut out considerably. I’d definitely recommend Royal Seoul.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is very good and hotel was cleanly managed. The staff were friendly and helpful. However, the rules for early check-in seem to require changes. I arrived at the hotel at 12pm and had to pay a fee so i was bad mood at check-in. I was embarrassed that other hotels were usually offered as a service.
hotelName:
13    Royal Hotel Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lotte city mapo is conveniently located, right above metro station and Korea air limousine bus stop directly in front of hotel that goes straight onto highway towards Incheon, was only 50minute ride. We stayed in 1 of large suite rooms as part of a special deal which had sitting living room although no window there and no kitchen but perfect for family. There is the Lotte supermarket in basement which is wonderfully stocked with all types of food and extremely convenientThe breakfast buffet is simple but still abundant and was very goodThe pool was wonderful, clean and large, and fairly quiet when we went in eveningThe hotel is great value given location and price
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at, perfectly clean. Everything i top condition, and maintained. a 7/11 shop inside the hotel and awesome breakfast. Who doesnt like Bulgogi with Kimchi for breakfast along with all the usual stuff :)
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an excellent experience during my stay at the Hotel. I also had good services and co-oper.ation from the desk as well as all other staff of the Hotel.I wish to visit your hotel again in the near future.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This supposed to be four/five star hotel situated in Mapo area has no room service and hardly has any choice for Vegetarian people. The restaurant closes sharp at 10.30 PM so if you are coming late after spending a day outside, chances are you will not get anything to eat here.The hotel is situated above Gangedeok substation and is on Line 5 of sub urban metro network. If by any chance you have to stay here and looking for good food, just cross the road in front of it and there you will find wide variety of food ranging from Indian food to Italian and other choices.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Lotte City Hotel for 3 nights before our tour started and would definitely stay there again. The rooms were extremely clean, beds comfortable and bathroom was lovely. All the staff were friendly and professional. The location was very convenient to access the subway and there is a good range of shops and restaurants underneath the hotel if you don’t feel like venturing far.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family was there during the last summer.. it was a really hot summer and staying this hotel relieved us from all the stresses we were suffering from.. Great staffs and service.. fantastic facilities.. would recommend anyone to stay this hotel.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed five nights, four for business and subsequent one for private purpose. The location is at Exit #2 Gongduk Station, Subway Line No. 5, very convenient. It has a convenience store, convenient too. Front Desk Staffs were warm and heartful. Room is well equipped and the hallway is impressive of its width, luxurious interior and private arrangement of each rooms. Above all, one of the most satisfactory facility is swimming pool located at fourth floor and served free for guests. The pool has three lanes about 17 meters. There is no Safe Guard but I used it everyday early morning. Breakfast was good and delicious. I understand that Lotte City Hotel brand is one of low cost business hotels produced by premium grade Lotte Hotel Group, but it is a five star grade and not inexpensive. The last night fee including breakfast was payed by me and it was affordable but too high because of Friday. It was my only hindrance for overall 3 stars.출장목적 4박 후 개인일정 1박 숙박함. 공덕역 2번 출구와 연결되어 있고, 맞은편 공덕동 족발골목과 건너편 마포갈매기골목이 위치하여 비즈니스호텔의 입지로 손색이 없음. 프런트 직원 친절도 만족스러움. 롯데호텔답게 모든 시설과 어메니티 깔끔하고 고급스러우며 조식도 매우 훌륭하고 다양하게 구비되어 감동받음. 4층에 수영장이 있고 6am부터 10pm까지 투숙객이 무료로 자유롭게 이용할 수 있어 매우 흡족함. 3개의 레인으로 구성, 길이 17미터 가량, 깊이 1.2미터. 시티호텔 브랜드이지만 특1급 못지않게 인테리어와 시설이 고급스러움. 복도가 잘 꾸며져 있고 실내공간 배치 역시 수준급이지만 첫날 화장실 바닥에서 체모가 발견되고 새 타올에 머리카락이 한올 있어 빈정상함. 마지막날 개인용무로 이용하며 지불한 요금이 주말이었음에도 불구하고 위치나 시설, 롯데라는 호텔 전문 브랜드, 직원 전문성과 친절성, 조식의 수준 등을 모두 감안하더라도 과한 수준으로 평가됨.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're visiting Seoul Startup Hub this hotel is conveniently just a couple of minutes walk away, with the bonus that when it's freezing cold you don't get much exposure walking from Gongdeok station to the lobby. It's above a mall with a great supermarket if you get bored with the one restaurant that offers a buffet. No room service, quite average rooms with slightly aged fittings but clean and comfortable and well heated.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really liked this hotel from the Lotte chain. It is close to Gongdeok subway station. Hotel room and bathroom are clean. The hotel has a nice indoor swimming pool. Friendly hotel staff. Would definately recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Lotte City is located slightly outside of central Seoul but well connected with the train as one of Seoul’s main station is less than 5mins walk away. Gongdeok Station is actually connected at the B1 of the hotel. With that in mind going anywhere is not a problem at all. The basement also house the Lotte premium supermarket, few coffee shops, and restaurants so getting anything you need will be hassle free. The rooms are good, clean and comfortable. With friendly and well English spoken staff helps in the overall experience. There’s even an in door hot swimming pool, gym, sauna, coin operated washing machines, etc in the hotel so it’s basically have everything you need!
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very basic hotel. No conceirge to assist with taxi. No iron in room and they won't give, you have to use the laundry with 1 iron for whole hotel. No coffee shop, restaurant charges about 12 AU coffee. Staff are ok but over helpful as they are to busy.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outside the hotel look old but when seeing the room and toilet - wowww amazing ! Toilet and room are much biggger than the hotel in myeongdong. Location is good, convenient and only take short time from and to airport. At first we chose to say at high floor ie 8th floor but it takes time waiting so staff gave us the sixth floor instead. This floor is much better ie more quiet, and not too crowded with lots of people as they may choose this floor. Pool is nice and very clean. Good price for this hotel with pool except there’s nothing surrounded interesting for shopping.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To me when I go to Seoul not the area I`m staying in but which hotel with the best transportation access is the most important thing to consider because you spend pretty much all day riding metro or bus to see everything and it can get tiring. This hotel was perfect. When you come from Incheon or Gimpo you can take all stop KTX and get off at Gongdeok station that`s it. Station is bigger than I thought but just go to Exit 2 and look for Lotte premium market. If you`re not used to public transportation it might be confusing at first becuase there`re many people and many exits but just remember to go to Exit 2 and from there you can`t get lost because if you look up this hotel is right in front of Exit. When you arrive at night everything is so dark because supermarket and restaurants are closed so you may think this is not the right entrance but it is. Just walk through dark alley and you`ll see their elevator. There are several metro lines from this station and Seoul station is next stop so it is very convenient if you`re using KTX (bullet train). Honestly small supermarket downstairs was not what I was looking for. They call it lotte premium and more like small whole food or bristol farm in the U.S so everything was overpriced and many imported items which I was not interested in after coming to seoul. I do recommend to walk to Emart very close to this hotel if you like to buy lots of stuff and Lotte supermarket at soul station. It is huge and exciting because there are so much stuff to see and buy. Hotel breakfast was excellent and I loved their udon noodle and caramelized almond mix. Don`t worry they have plenty of choices for everybody. It can get very busy so go earlier or later. Hotel is so quiet and peaceful the only time I saw people was when I was eating breakfast and pool area. Their pool and gym were very nice but I wish they can seperate their lanes for people who want to actually exercise and for kids who just want to have fun. Make sure to bring swiming caps otherwise you can`t use their pool. I highly recommend this hotel to everybody. Convenience to public transportation fast access to both airports, clean and modern room and nice breakfast, pool and gym you can`t beat it with this price.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was convenient to reach by public transport. Airport bus stops outside, so does the train but walk underground to/from the train is long.Loved being on the 4th floor close to the pool and lifts.To roll out of bed in the morning and go for a swim before breakfast couldn’t have been easier.Long pool 20 m? With lots of day light streaming in and charmingly lit in the evening for a relaxing swim.Open 6 am until late. Mostly quiet at the pool over the weekend.Also gym facilities next to the pool . Running machine, cross trainer and some weights etc. Did not eat breakfast at the hotel.In the basement of the building there are cafes selling excellent coffee. Fabulous supermarket with stunning fresh food for sale.Our room was a bit small with twin beds.( requested) One of our party had a lovely bright large double room. Street noise did not disturb us, AC worked well.None of the sights are on the doorstep but public transport it fast, frequent, inexpensive and easy to use.Interesting choice of places to eat around the hotel with : modern, traditional, market , food available.Hotel gave a good recommendation of traditional food restaurant which was tasty, varied and Korean. We were grateful for the direction otherwise would have been tricky, most people speak only Korean .... surprise surprise!!!!! People are helpful and really want visitors to enjoy their stay.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: recently most important thing choosing is wifi! i don’t understand why this kind if best hotel ignored wifi so easily ! no connection! i waited 2 hr and finally changed wifi router then i got very slow signal. room is perfect! swimming pool is good. even there are many restaurants in basement shopping mall
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only stayed 2 nights following my arrival in Seoul before my Tour.Train from main Airport stops under hence my choice .The price at the time was very good. Finding the entrance I found most difficult and got lost but luckily I made some notes from reviews ..thanks( so check !) . Once there I got used to the multitude of subway levels etc. There are some dining locations around both in railway shops and other levels but again I initially struggled and nothing open early mornings and later at night. After my tour I stayed in the Center Mark hotel which was more convenient but so tiny and noisy and I should have come back to Mapo because once you get used to the subway system getting about is a dream (study the subway system) Clean modern, full shower, sleep quality was good , staff helpful .Would I say again … for sure If your arriving late at night --eat first and if you like an early breakfast .then .I bought some snacks at the supermarket under and kept in minibar and made coffee etc in room and saved money ( I did not do the $25 buffet breaky in house -see reviews )
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is very convenient - if you take the airport bus it is the second stop on the route, and going to airport it is the second to last pick up...so you don't have to spend lots of time on the bus. The station also connects 3 major metro lines, one of which is the airport line. The metro connects almost directly to the mall beneath the hotel, so if it is cold and rainy, you can get back inside without bringing out an umbrella (you step outside for a minute but there is cover). Nearby is Gongdeok market and emart, along with small shops and restaurants scattered. The hotel itself is a little bit older and the temperature adjuster seems to be for looks only (probably central controlled because the heat is not warm and the ac is not cold). Do not be tricked by the pictures as this hotel is 8 floors high only - the building behind is not part of the hotel! I was disappointed in my 5th floor room at first, only to realise there weren't that many more floors to choose from! It was pretty noisy with the traffic pretty much all day, every day...weekends included.Compared to Shilla Stay Hotel down the block, I would say this is more conveniently located, but not as new and comfortable.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in Mapo but got metro station straight at the basement connecting with many places. Convenient if you want to go to Myeongdong, Gyeongbukgung palace, Dongdaemun market, Hongdae...Got supermarket at the basement as well.Staff is helpful and friendly. They speak fluent English.Just a note if you want to swim at the hotel swimming pool, please bring your own swimming cap, if not you have to purchase at the reception.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel located in downtown, The Gong Deok train station juxtaposed next to the hotel. Very convenient.One point for improvement will be the hotel does have a sterile feel to it, it feels devoid of furniture to fill up the area that the hotel is still in the midst of opening. This is attributed to the lack of indoor plants and the lobby feels really.. quiet. Some background music playing will create a more relaxing feel upon checking in. Staff members all speak English and very polite and willing to engage with guests. Hotel room was splendid, good strong shower pressure and room was very clean. Bed was comfy and the room offers good views of the skyscrapers in front of us. Complimentary hotel wi-fi was very fast.Didnt get to try the indoor swimming pool and the gym, they also have a sauna and a coin operated laundry. Will highly recommend the hotel to other travelers looking to stay closer to the shopping belt.Helpful hint: At Basement 1 upon exiting the Supermarket, if you turn left, there is 1 set of lifts that state 'Lotte City Hotel Mapo' (Near the shopping trolley carts). It requires hotel card access but leads you directly to your floor! Very handy and it feels like your own private lift.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located right in the heart of Mapo district. Easy to reach and easy to move around from here to any corner of Seoul. Rooms are big enough for a single occupancy. Breakfast is great. I was provided the vegetarian breakfast courteously. WiFi is excellent. Bed, shower, fittings and amenities are good too. BUT THE ENTIRE ROOM HAS ONLY ONE CHARGING STATION. PLEASE CARRY THE CONVERTIBLE/GLOBAL CHARGERS. Myeongdong and Namdemun markets are easily accessible from here.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I think the location and convenience are the best part of this hotel. You get to be very close to Hong-dea where you get to be surrounded by energetic youth with trendy and arty stuff. Night clubs, bars, food, shopping, college students, Inde-music.. you name it. The staff service was not bad but some what a bit robot like as if this people are trained in a way no human touch but provide just service. But just my personal opinion. I traveled all over the country but most in-friendly staff. Doesn’t mean they are bad. Kind and well mannered but it’s like with no feeling. Strange. But I get to talk to cleaning ladies they weren’t like the front desk people much friendly with sense of humour nice. But I loved the bath room with a cloth line very convenient! A small thing make difference to travellers. Coin laundry was helpful too. I stayed about total 3 weeks in and out of the city. Easy go back to the place. Didn’t take photos. But it was exactly the same as they advertised so I went back to this hotel 3 times.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was suggested this hotel from a friend who had stayed a number of time prior. Location is close to shops (Supermarket and mall below), trains and taxis. The rooms were clean and generous size. There was a bath in my room which is not too common for the area. Indoor pool was nice touch although the Gym was a little disappointing. Worth the money.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent two nights in the hotel. The room was modern, quiet, relatively new and spacious with a large bathroom. Everything we needed for the stay.Although not internally connected, it sits on top the Gongdeok train station which caters for 4 different metro lines and you can get to the hotel from B1 via the lifts adjacent to the Lotte market. The lobby is on L2 and no porter service, which means that if you arrive by car and get off on L1 you need to lug your luggage up via an escalator or elevator. While we stayed there was only a security guard (in a suite) posted on L1.Check-in / check-out service at the front desk was fast and efficient even with trainees taking notes.The reason I'm not giving this hotel 5 stars as it should have been easy for such a nice and clean property, is because of two things - extremely slow and frustrating lifts and no one on L1 to assist. There are businesses on the lower levels which share the lifts and found that that most of the people using the lifts were actually going to these businesses throughout the day. There is one lift dedicated to going to the hotel levels down to L1, but doesn't go down to B1, which means you either have to walk out or take another lift down. The other lifts stop at all levels which mean that at times it can take 5-10 minutes to get a lift.There is no one on L1 other than one security person (I'm assuming he's security as he had an in-ear) and when we asked him to get us a taxi, he replied by saying there's a taxi rank out front and that he can't leave his station. Because of this, I had to go down driveway, out to the curb with our luggage and secure a taxi myself. The hotel really needs to rethink what customers expect/want and the services they need to provide as this is something I've taken for granted at any established hotel anywhere in the world. I was surprised because I though it was a inconsistent with the Lotte brand name and being rated a 5 star hotel. Getting to both airports is easy via trains, but beware that if you have bulky luggage it's not easy finding lifts in the station, so figure out how you're going to be getting down to the platforms beforehand, especially if getting to Incheon. Coming from Kimpo was a breeze as we managed to find the lift straight away from the platform and by doing so unintentionally bypassed going through the turnstiles as we ended up on ground level. Noticed that the lifts are normally for the disabled so we didn't make use of them unless we had luggage. We later found it easier to go to B1 and take the hotel lift up. There are some nice restaurants in the basement levels and an upscale Lotte supermarket that carried local produce to drinks and snacks from around the world. Gongdeok is also has a lot of offices around, so finding a decent place to eat isn't hard.We didn't do Gangnam, so in our case the hotel was a good base to get to the places we were interested in - City Hall area, Hongdae, Dongdaemun, etc.Price was reasonable as it's not in the heart of the city but the lobby debacle aside it didn't disappoint on quality.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself was in a great location. While it may have been in a business area, it was easy to get around Seoul because there is a subway station right below the hotel. There was also a supermarket and a few restaurants and establishments below the hotel as well which made it easy for us to grab a quick snack or buy supplies. The staff were friendly as well. My only problem with the hotel is that the temperature of our room was so hot. We visited in April 2017 and the weather in Seoul was pretty cold (ranging from around 10-5 degrees) and I'd understand that they would keep it relatively warm in the hotel, but it was so hot that none of us could sleep properly and we were sweating! We asked multiple times for them to fix it but only on our last night (we stayed for 5 nights) were they able to finally fix the temperature.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has all the usual facilities and the room was spacious. Seemed to be designed for a disabled customer. Was very well designed. Lunch at the buffet is a bit too costly. Just below the hotel is a nice bulgogi place
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've spent 7 days in Lotte Mapo Hotel and I have to admit that it's perfect choice for people who wants to travel around Seoul. Rooms are elegant and extremly functional. Reception Desk Officers are helpful and really profesional. They have perfect breakfast!I can honestly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: +location: just in front of (old headquarter of)kodit, besides there are plenty of companies around hotel, perfect for business tripservice: offered shuttle bus from seoul station-a bit pricey if staying alone
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the opportunity to stay at this Lotte City as well during my recent visit to Seoul.The hotel, although it is bit older than the one in Myeondong, it is great. The staff was extremely friendly and the service was outstanding.The rooms were more spacious than the one in Myeondong and they were very clean and comfortable. The bed, no disappointment here either. I slept very comfortably. These Lotte City beds have nothing to ask to the ones at the Four Seasons in Dallas Texas. The bathrooms are very nice, spacious with an electronic bidet and a soaker tub with shower combo.The hotel has free fast wi-fi, laundromat, gym and a pool. The location is in a less tourist area, but has direct access to the subway and major avenues. The hotel is on top of a subte complex with restaurants, hair salons, and supermarket.Loved it and I would go back without any hesitation.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay here! I want to return to Seoul, and when I do I'll likely come back to this hotel.The room wasn't huge, but it was well-appointed and didn't feel cramped. There was a fridge and a safe in the room, and the bathroom had a tub and a separate shower (plus a retractable laundry line). Bed was comfortable but on the firm side, as seems standard in Korea. There is a control for all the lights and the A/C next to the bed. The room was really quiet, too (I stayed on the eighth & top floor).Everything in the hotel was very clean and modern, and there's a pretty little pocket park outside with places to sit. Staff was very friendly--I really don't speak Korean well at all, but they spoke or understood enough English that it wasn't a problem.The hotel has a buffet restaurant, which is very good but pricey. It's also located atop a small but complete supermarket and a bunch of casual eateries, so there was no shortage of affordable, convenient, and quite tasty dining options. The airport train stops here, as does a commuter rail and two subway lines (Gongdeok Station), so getting around is super-easy. In addition, there's a big bus stop outside.One thing that I found extremely charming about the hotel is that, because there's a women's clinic in the building, there are TONS of families with small children staying there. If you're hoping for quiet time in the swimming pool (or planning a Spring Break rager), too bad, but I thought all the kids were absolutely adorable. If you're traveling with young family members, I would definitely recommend this place--you'll fit right in!
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located and right on top of Gongdeok station. It's a good 7 minutes walk from the airport train to the hotel within the station. A bakery right across from the street, and a supermarket in the basement. I have stayed here multiple times and it's my to-go choice!
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed in the hotel for a short trip. So far so good until I checked out and left my luggage and backpack for 3 hours at the hotel left luggage area as I decided to go nearby for lunch. However I forgot I left my home currencies in an envelope in my backpack. I claimed back my backpack and luggage and only get to remember about my home currencies in my backpack while on the way to airport. I then realised the whole envelope was gone from my backpack called the hotel reporting the incident. It did surprise me that they called me in less than half an hour informing that they saw nothing wrong from CCTV...I could not help feeling disappointed theft could happen in a hotel of reasonable standing..though I had my carelessness to blame..I do not think I want to stay in this hotel again...
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a really lovely hotel. Room was beautiful and the bathroom was super. I couldn't stop raving to my friends about the shower. I would have stayed in there forever. Comfy bed as well. Hotel is also located above a major subway station so was very easy to get around the city. There was also a Dunkin Donuts across the street, which being from Boston, made me laugh. The pool was also pretty fantastic and I had it to myself both times I went down to swim.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel located above several floors of light shopping, few restaurants, and a huge supermarket.Note that hotel does not provide room service, however it's locality makes up for that. Hotel comes with great indoor pool but no lifeguard, which is alright. The pool is a great place to destress after a days work. Location wise, it is linked to the Gongdeok station which is a huge train interchange for many lines. Also the airport train line has a stop here. Airport bus 6015 stops at the main road of this hotel as well. Hotel room is great and modern. Clean and I felt at ease during my 2 week stay. It's a great hotel overall, and if I had to come back to Seoul, this would be my choice.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a clean, well-managed hotel in the Seoul Mapo district. The room we had was small, but well maintained. The hotel has a well-maintained swimming pool and a bar/lounge. The staff were polite and helpful, and spoke English. We had a late flight and they were happy to hold our luggage for the day after we had checked out. The bar is overly expensive, as is the breakfast buffet - arrange to eat and drink elsewhere unless you're on the company card.There is a close airport bus pickup, but be aware that the bus does not come to the hotel itself. I would advise having someone point out exactly where the pickup is before you head out to catch the bus, as there are a number of bus stops close by. If you don't speak or read Korean, you are likely to get confused (as we did).
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptional customer service from their outstanding and professional staff. Very clean rooms and the hotel has a laundry facilities on site. Very nice gym. This hotel is a very great place to stay for your business or personal travel. It will be my pleasure to stay at the Lotte City Hotel, Mapo, South Korea
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the superior double room and the toilet is huge. We arrived to the hotel at 9.45am but were not able to check in and will be charged for 1 night's price for early check in so we waited till later. The receptionists speaks English which is a good thing. If you are looking for eateries, it is across the road. Just ask them where as it is hidden in an alley. The train station at this hotel is Gongdeok so it's 2 stops away from Hongik University station (that's where Hongdae area is). The shuttle bus service is really helpful as it goes to Myeongdong, The Palace and Seoul Station. The shuttle bus ajusshi is really friendly, just that he cannot speak English. Just right below the hotel, there is a large supermarket and some cafes. If you are looking for a quieter area to stay, this hotel will be perfect.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a European the most disappointing aspect is surely breakfast.At a 4 star Hotel I would expect some choice for fruits in the morning, non only overripe bananas, canned fruit and apples and oranges that besides are not even in season. At dinner they offer fresh pineapple, it would surely be appreciated also in the morning.What is served as croissant is in reality some sort of sweet bread. Ever tried a real one? Swimming pool was ok, but quite crowded also the changing rooms are tiny.Rooms are ok but a little out of style with that old carpet. Some charging possibility near the bed area would be appreciated.Reception was friendly.At night you can still hear a lot of noise from the streets.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel located downtown. easy to go to tourist places. The room is cozy but very homely atmosphere!staff was super friendly, everything was very clean. If I have a chance definitely stay at Lotte city hotel mapo.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean, has a decent swimming pool (heated water), a small fitness centre, and is well located, less than 20 minutes away from Yeouido, Hongdae, Itaewon, and Gwanghwamun. The food is okay, and the rooms are - as you'd expect in this part of Asia - pretty small. Staff are friendly.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service in the hotel is excellent. There is a very nice sauna at hotel where you can relax a tired body after a long day of work, and plenty of nice places to eat nearby in Myeongdong.The room in itself is not very big. I also stayed at Hotel Shilla at Mapo-Gu. Same room, less bowing, and not the nice sauna, but half the price - if you want to indulge yourself choose Lotte City Hotel, if you want something slightly more cost effective go for Hotel Shilla.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean hotel, well located and reasonably priced...good quality breakfast! Agree with previous comments, lack of choice ENG channels on TV is disappointing as is supply of iron and board...provided iron and board by housekeeping was simply inadequate!
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we have stayed here two times now- in 2012 to adopt our first son, and again in February 2017 to meet our youngest son! The hotel is extremely clean, comfortable, and convenient! especially with young kids, it was nice to have the grocery and restaurants in the basement of the hotel, and not have to walk far for food. There is a Paris Baguette pastry shop, and Subway Sandwich shop, a waffle shop, plus several restaurants with tradtional Korean dishes. we also found a Starbucks and McDonalds within a couple blocks walk. The subway is right out of the door of the hotel as well, making it extremely easy to tour the city.  The rooms are very comfortable-- we liked the rain shower, and the tub was nice for our young son. was always cleaned and restocked with towels, etc.  Staff at the desk is very helpful and speaks English, which is nice for international travelers, like us. The indoor pool is very big and was nice and relaxing after a long day of touring the city.  would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Conveniently located next to an underground station, with easy access to buses also. Decent size room and the indoor swimming pool is a bonus. Facilities are clean and staff are friendly. Definitely recommended.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very good, clean hotel with no frills. Location is excellent and price is reasonable. I think this is a good place for business trips and also for families that want a good place to stay when doing tourism in Seoul.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 10 nights at this hotel on a business trip and don't have even one thing to complain about. The rooms are very tidy and have very good facilities which you would require on a business or pleasure trip. The buffet breakfast and dinner is excellent with a lot of variety and the hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is connected to Gongdeok subway so very convenient to move around Seoul. I highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room is basic, standard and rather small. The best part of the room is the HUGE shower! Incredible rain and handheld shower system. Tons of water flow at the perfect rate, volume and temperature. Truly the highlight of staying in this hotel. Breakfast restaurant is ok - not bad but not stellar. Lobby is extremely uncomfortable. Backless upholstered benches, no chairs. Lobby is not warm nor inviting, it's actually a waste of space.
hotelName:
14    Lotte City Hotel Mapo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lotte City Mapo is located in a tranquil neighbourhood with Lotte supermarket and cafes and eateries in B1 and B2. Besides the good location near the Subway, we chose this hotel as its family rooms are of a good size at a reasonable price. The family room has a queen-sized bed with a single bed, big enough for a family of 3pax or even 4. The heated pool is wonderful for the kids to play in and we had the whole pool to ourselves as no one else was using it.
