The room is relatively small but if you had been to Japan, it's a size like Japan hotels.There is also a room on each floor where you can refill your water bottle if the bottles the hotel had provided ran out. So you do not need to worry about having insufficient water for the day. The wall is thick enough for soundproof so for those who are lightsleeper, need not worry too much on this.Overall, the stay had been wonderful
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel around 4 months of the year so I know what hotel standards should be. Living in Japan I know the service to be great and having travelled to Korea a few times before I had never been impressed. Saw great reviews for this hotel but I won't be back.The pros are nice location for shopping but not for business. All the local restaurants are tourist traps.On checking in I was given a twin room, but they would not swap for a double bed unless paid. You ask for an iron and you have to bring it yourself , not something you associate with 4 star hotels.I didn't book breakfast with my agent so I paid at reception. At about 25 USD per day, the breakfast is probably the worst I've seen.No fresh fruits , frozen berries one morning. No decent bread, your find better in a supermarket.You may find bibimbap but no bacon? No egg section but dried scrambled eggs.I was checking out at 6am and breakfast starts at 7. I asked for a takeaway box, something they don't do. I then asked for a refund and was told no. After asking the manager they finally did it.Won't be back sadly.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel so much that i decided to write a review even though almost a year has passed. I particularly appreciate how helpful the staff were when i needed translation from korean to english and one of the staff even helped me to call a restaurant to confirm if they are opened as it was during the Chuseok holiday. The room was spacious and clean. Bed and pillow was comfortable. Being a Japanese hotel, they had automated toilet (which gives me a scare sometimes when the cover closes on its own haha). Location is good and you dont have to worry about food or shopping as you are right in the midst of Myeongdong shopping street. The famous Myeongdong Kyoja is just opposite the hotel, super convenient. The bus stop for the airport limousine is also just 3mins walk away. I would definitely recommend staying here.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 2 rooms- the Hollywood bed and Standard Twin and stayed for 5 nights at Solaria Nishitetsu. The size of the rooms is just right and as a lot of the reviewers have ready mentioned, they have toto toilets. One thing that I would loved to have in the hotel is a coin operated laundry area, so that I could do the laundry in the evening. Another thing to take note of is that your key card only works for your floor. If you have other family members who are booked in another floor, they will have to fetch you.We loved how it is right in the middle of the foodie places we want to visit and is in close proximity to several modes of transportation. You can also easily access some restaurants in M Plaza from the elevator (Floors 4-6) as well.We will definitely be back here and we can see why it has received good reviews and awards. Until next time! Thank you!
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very central in Meyongdong -- just a few minutes walk to the metro, right in the heard of the street market and shopping, and easy access to the President hotel (where the DMZ/JSA tours start from). The rooms are a nice size and well appointed - as everyone talks about, the hotel is Japanese so they also have the Toto toilets installed. The lobby is on the 20th floor, which is a nice space and the staff are nice and helpful. My only complaint was the wifi was a bit slow - not terrible but it could be improved.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At first we were surprised that the lobby at ground floor was empty as we enter around midnight but then we saw a notice that the registration desk is on upper floor (cant recall which floor). staff were polite and helpful. Our room decorations was very nice with modern contemporary design and clean. My daughter love to play with auto seat cover in the toilet and bathtub was big enough for my big frame. The hotel situated in the middle of Myeongdong evening market. The only problem as pointed out by other reviewer, somehow we cant control the temperature of the AC unit. it keeps going back to low temperature. Highly recommended place to stay in Seoul!
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just came back from a 5 nights stay in this hotel with my family. We booked 3 rooms, and we had a great experience. This hotel reminds me a lot of Japanese hotels. Pros:- great location right in the smack of myeongdong. Very close to famous restaurants ( Myeongdong Kyoja, James cheese ribs, Issac toast, gogung, wangbijib BBQ and many more!) - very clean(kudos to housekeeping)- loved the toiletries - the toilet bidet was amazing(best ever!)- staff were friendly(they speak multiple languages like Japanese, Chinese and English)- loved the toilet layout - view was great - many complained about the AC, but we had no problem. We could control it on our own. - room size was sufficient for 2 adults considering the hotel location to be in the center of town. Cons:- no cars were allowed to stop in front of the hotel at a certain timing. Nearest Location for taxi drop off/pick up is Myeongdong station Exit 8(about 3 minutes walk). - breakfast can be improved(more variety), or price can be reduced as it was quite pricey. -no gymAll in all, we will definitely come back to stay in this hotel~
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came here for a long weekend with my mom and sister. Arriving and leaving from the hotel can be tricky especially if you have plenty of luggage as cabs/cars cannot drop you outside the hotel. Wished it was flagged up on the website. Note: check-in is at the reception on 21st floor rather than at the ground floor. Location wise, its smack in the middle of Myeongdong surrounded by shops/cafes/restaurants. Very convenient if you are shopping and have plenty of bags to drop off; also close to Lotte/Namdaemum market and a short cab ride to Dongdaemum market. Hotel is modern, rooms are a little too small for me though and could do with some touch up/refurb given the high traffic of tourists staying there. If you dont like crowds, this hotel is probably not for you (note: hotel also has 2 floors for food which is open to public).
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time I came I was confused to find the entrance and when I approached the main lobby with the brown door but the door was not open (maybe my position was not close enough because I was not sure the door was right, because the door don’t have handle or anything). I finally had to go through the side door with escalator as much as 3 floors carrying luggage before i came in to the lift and go to the receptionist, and i like the receptionist is very friendly and I can leave my suitcase before the hotel check-in time (i sent request early check in by E-Mail but there is no answer).The advantages:1. right in the middle of myeongdong, the distance from myeongdong station and the airport bus stop to the hotel not too far away.2. the size of the rooms are quite spacious, the spacious bathrooms that provide toiletries and facial treatments. 3. there is a sofa on the edge of the window so I can look at shops in myeongdong. 4. soft mattress and pillow and temperature that fits in the room. 5. what I liked most was the Bathup water filling so fast I could soak my feet after walking around in Seoul. unfortunately I did not take the breakfast package so I can not review the food. For next holiday at Seoul, i will stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just booked a room via Expedia to stay 3 nights. By mistake I have booked a twin room instead of a double room. As I was entering the payment details, my hand pressed the enter button by mistake and it went through without having a chance to review the booking :( I have emailed the hotel straight after my booking tonight when I checked the itenary and realised I made a mistake. I hope the hotel can make the change and not make a big fuss over this as I genuinely pressed enter by mistake on the keyboard which meant payment went through without being able to double check on my choice! I hope Japanese culture is as they say as lovely and kind and I hope they change my room without making a big deal. As this is our honeymoon and we will be visiting from 14-17th May, I hope it doesn't disappoint even before we get there. Let's hope the hotel responds back 2 of my emails. I hope my very good review will be right....and wont prove me wrong!Best Regards, Nevin Thomson
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed in this hotel at the beginning of October 2017 for 2 nights. This review is a little late, but it was such a fantastic stay that I had to write something. Location: The hotel is in the bustling center of Myeong-dong, which has 100s of shops and restaurants for you to choose from. A great ambience generally in the area, especially when the street food market is on during the weekend. Really a fantastic location.Service: Great service when we arrived at the hotel, although after a long flight we arrived at 10:30 and hoped to get into the room earlier than our allotted time of 12pm for check-in, but no luck. I suppose it was a busy weekend as it was a national holiday, but would have been nice to get in the room a little earlier. The staff however, were very friendly and helped get us settled in the lobby.Room/Hotel: The views from the hotel are amazing, pretty much every place you look there are floor-to-ceiling windows with a great view of the city. The room was perfect - not too small (as I had been warned that many rooms in Seoul were on the smaller side), the whole place felt clean, well furnished, and pristine. Bed was great, bathroom was lovely, and the amenities plentiful.Value: For the amount of money I paid for this room, I'd say it's an absolute steal. Great location, great lobby, staff and room, and fantastic ambience. A fantastic stay in the center of Seoul!
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Made a change to this hotel from K-Guesthouse 2. Last minute booking managed to get a room even though no king/queen size bed but as we booked super last minute we are very happy to get a room. Lobby is situated on the upper floor (level 21) with great view of Myeongdong area. Toilet comes with bidet (japanese style). Able to leave our luggages at the reception area when we have to book out earlier. Room service was done on time. Not allowed for a late checkout even for an hour as i guess the hotel is busy during this period. Will come back to stay here when we are in Seoul again.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located at the heart of Myeongdong, lobby at level 21, there's also a smoking room at level 21. There's a hot & cold water cum ice dispenser at each level. Can leave your luggage at level 1 if need to check out by 12pm. Room is small, clean & comfortable. Limited Tv channels. Toto washlet is amazing & user friendly. Shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, toothbrush, shower cap are provided. 2 bottles fo water is provided daily. Will consider this hotel again when in Seoul.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the heart of the energetic Myeong-dong area, and within mins of walk from the subway station. Tons of food and shop around the hotel, and many of them open until mid-night!Stayed in the Standard Twin room, not a very spacious room but I've enjoyed that it's bright and well-maintained.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: SOLARIA Hotel has 2 doorways both opening to extensive shopping and eating explorations... taxi can drop you off in front of the hotel only before 10 am. The AIRPORT BUS TERMINAL is a leisure walk of 150 meters. Very accessible if you booked a day excursion to Nami or Petite France because the meeting place is at a walking distance. The new Daiso Korea building is just 2 blocks away. UNIQLO is very near also. You get to enjoy the Japanese TOTO TOILET comfort experience.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just along Myeongdong area. When you go down the hotel, you will find streets of restaurants and stores. At night, the foodstalls appear and you can try different Korean food. Our room is very comfy but what I noticed is that the room heater is controlled by the hotel so it gets warm at night to the point that you need airconditioning and that is during winter. The AC switch can only do so much and you can’t control it. Space is also another issue but then, we travelled as a family of 4.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location : As others have mentioned is great - right in Myeongdong but still closer to the south side so that walking in from the bus stop (airport bus 6015) or metro station (Myeongdong station exit 8) isn't too far, about 3 short blocks. Other than in the early morning, the surrounding roads are closed to traffic, so you will have to handle your own luggage coming in and going out of the hotel.The hotel is on the upper floors of Forever 21 and right next to Artbox, opposite Myeongdong Kyoja.Lobby : right near the top of the hotel on the 21st floor. It's great that all guests have an opportunity to see a nice view, facing east and west on both sides of the building, instead of limiting it to the more expensive rooms. Nicely decorated with seating areas.Room : we had a triple room. The layout was good with the toilet and bathroom placed at the entrance, quite far away and not in direct line of sight from the beds. This was good as switching on the bathroom lights did not disturb others sleeping. There was lots of storage space, with 2 cupboards & bedside chests. There were 2 pillows on each bed; 1 hard and the other softer. Great option as pillow firmness is a very individual choice.Bathroom & toliet : the bathroom had 2 sinks with lots of horizontal space to place toliteries. There was both a bathtub and shower. The toilet is in a separate room from the bathroom, Japanese-style, and is equipped with a bidet.Amenities : each room has its own individual router, which was much faster than the hotel's general Wi-Fi. There is also a water and ice dispenser on every floor. There was coffee and tea provided, with cups, but no spoon or stirrer.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is centrally located at Myeong Dong, easily accessible to subway station and the shopping area. It is a very new and clean hotel. The price is reasonable but be prepared that the room area is small. My kids like the bathtub and automated WC very much.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - Great location as it is in the center of Myeongdong where all the shops are located. - Room is very clean although a bit small but acceptable given it is in such a busy area - Very polite staff (it's a Japanese hotel)Overall a great stay and will definitely come back
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 8 nights in this hotel. Pros:1. Located right in the middle of myeong dong where food and shopping are easily available. There is also a 24hr mart less than 5 mins walk away but stuffs are overpriced there.2. Clean room. Separate shower and toilet.Cons:1. No shelter when it rains.2. No access road during normal day times. Made it hard to take a taxi to and fro hotel, especially when you have large and heavy luggages.3. Told the staff to help us get a taxi from the main road to airport but was told they don’t offer such service and we need to pay double for hotel taxi if we need their help.4. Centralized aircon and was set to 26°C. We are sweating in the room and can’t adjust it at all.Do take note that myeong dong station do not have lifts and escalator are always down so I have to carry my luggages up 3 flights of stairs and then squeeze through the crowded myeong dong just to get to the hotel.While the stay is ok, I won’t be returning for another stay as there are more cons factors around the small details that made me felt that I can get a better and more accessible hotel at the same price in Seoul.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 5 nights here & chose this hotel for many good reasons.Based on our actual stay experience, we were not disappointed.Pros1. Excellent location. Right inside Myeongdong. And only few minutes walk to Subway exits 7 & 8 & Airport Limousine bus-stop.2. Modern, luxurious, very well designed & functional; with top quality fittings.Excellent shower fittings. Auto control panel for all lights, aircon,etc. Good accessories eg good toiletries, slippers, comfortable bathrobes. Even an air humidifier provided. 3. Alot of power points. No problem to charge all your mobile devices & powerbanks. And there are 2 types of adapter points ( round pin & flat pin). Very thoughtful & useful accessories. Rarely found in other hotels.4. Bright & well lit tastefully designed cosy rooms, yet not glaring. Unlike many hotels which are dim with insufficient lightings.4. The different staff we met during our stay were warm, friendly & helpful. Great service - duty staff came immediately when we called regards humidifier problem. They always smile & acknowledge you when seeing guests on ground floor lobby.5. Good security. Lobby on 21st floor whereas rooms are from 7-24th floors. Access to rooms floors only possible by tapping room key cards on lift on any floorsCons1.Bed was a little on the hard side. 2 sets of pillows were provided. One too hard & other too soft. Something in between would be more comfortable.2. The aircon was put automatically to heater mode during this period. Although it was cold outside ( about 15-18°C), it was pretty warm in room with heater on. Cannot adjust to cold mode unlike other hotels.Hope the cons factors could be improved.We had 2 different rooms as we checked out after 2 nights to go to Busan, & returned for balance 3 nights. Both rooms were similar but at different floors.At the ground floor lift lobby entrance, a 3 Stars rated sign sits below the hotel name.In our opinion, this hotel is 4 to 4.5 stars! We will definitely stay here again in our next visit but hope improvements could be made to the 2 cons mentioned.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my 2nd time stay in Solaria within these 2 months, and in my recent stay on 28 Oct, I was quite upset when I can't be arrange in upper floor, double bed room and prefer not at the corner.Though the front Desk is very polite , but not helpful at all, and only tell me sorry they can't make it, finally I was being arrange on the 7th floor. But then the next day at 9am, it is very noisy due to the contraction on the 6th floor of the shopping mall.I called the front desk again, and luckily Mr Hatano picked up my call, he has very good English and come up to my room to check. He immediately asked the workers to pause for half an hour and arrange another room for me before I have to go out. Further to that, though he is the manager of the hotel, he personally come up and help me to move my stuff to the new room.It's so impressed with his excellent service , it totally changed my unpleasant image on the first day.However , the next date when I called taxi, problems comes again , the same polite lady that serve me the 1st day , help me to chase the taxi, but the taxi late for 10'minutes , though she keep saying sorry but really don't help .I really hope every staff in Solaria has the same service standard as Hatano.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This year I stayed at Solaria again during my visit to Seoul. The hotel has all my needs and for that it will always be the best:-Easy access to/from Incheon airport with the 6015 shuttle bus-Located in Myeongdong which has a massive selection of restaurants, many skincare and fashion stores and streetfood-Easy to get to all touristic areas- Bukchon Vilkage, N Tower, Gyeongbukgung Palace, Insadong (only found CoEx mall/Gangnam a bit far to get to from here)Plus the staff at the hotel are always willing to help, the room is clean, well maintained and the amenities are always well stocked.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Solaria Nishitetsu in Myeongdong is situated right in the heart of the Myeongdong shopping area. It is very accessible with the Myeongdong and Euljiro 1 MRT stations within walking distance from the hotel. The hotel has a minimalist modern design. I like that the bathroom and toilet are separated. The room itself is spacious enough and it even was able to include a bathtub in the bathroom. A small detail that impressed me is the bathroom mirror that doesn’t fog when I use hot water when showering. The middle area of the mirror stays clear and not affected by the steam at all, like magic! My room was made up everyday and I find that the housekeeping personnel does a good job in ensuring that the room is clean and arranged. I stayed in the 17th floor and had a good view of the Myeongdong Cathedral. I would recommend this hotel to other travellers who would like to stay in the Myeongdong area and I myself would stay here again should I be in Seoul the next time round.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The biggest draw of this hotel is it's fantastic location - right smack in the bustle of Myeong Dong; minutes away from the train station; very near to the airport limo station and walking distance to places such as Namdaemun and the Myeong Dong theatres.Secondly, hotel room is kept very clean and staff are friendly and helpful.Hotel doesn't have it's own car access lobby so be prepared to navigate from main road if you are taking a taxi.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who can't get enough of Korean beauty products shopping and who is looking for an accomodation with super convenient location.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As expected, the rooms were small.It is clear that regardless if your room is ready or not, they will only check you in at 2:00PM.Breakfast “process” is very inefficient. You have to go to the receptionist to get a coupon before entering the breakfast venue. Why not have the staff at the breakfast venue just give you the coupon upon giving your room number?Don’t also bother asking for any other kind of egg because the “chef” will not accommodate your request. You eat only what they have in the buffet.WIFI IS HORRIBLE! We’ve been here for 5 full days and it drops every 5-mins. You are better off getting wifi from a close network.Doubt if I will ever come back here. Hospitality & Customer Service is most certainly not their norm. So opposite from Ginza in Tokyo.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every shops is on sale! Solaria still the best in location for shopping or eating. The air conditioning is good. Very comfortable bed and pillow. Shower is good. Toto auto- lid open loo, top in the line. This is the second time stayingin this hotel. If the room is slightly bigger, it would be perfect.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very comfortable hotel in a very busy district! Service is nice with attentive attitude. Drawback is taxi cannot access directly to the hotel so if you are carrying a lot of luggages then you will need extra strength indeed! Overall my stay is good!
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We go there at end of Jun 17 , 3 nights and 4 days Seoul weather over 40% raining but this hotel location is fine easy access to all shopping and eating area , less than 5 mins walk to underground metro. Staffs are okay to communicate and room is clean and elegant. Definitely will choose this hotel again.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's location is unbeatable, closes to everything and easy to locate ( just next to Forever 21 shop and behind Zara). It closes to metro station exit no. 8 and airport bus station. You can take airport bus 6001 or 6015 to get there. Though the room and the toilet is pretty small, you can't complain as the price is reasonable. Bed and pillow are comfortable, the only drawback are there seems to have a sterilized smell in the room and don't have many English TV channels.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located in the center of Myeong-dong that you can shopping and back to the hotel to have some rest very easy. Very near to metro station, Just 5 miniutes walk from Myeong-dong station. Staffs were very helpful and room was very clean.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Did a trip with 5 friends, good size room, excellent location right at Myeongdong (near metro exits and near main road for taxi and buses), clean room. Not much service but cannot ask for much as this is a 3 star hotel. Would high recommend.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: located in the heart of myeongdong, near to airport shuttle bus stop and subway station, about 5-8 mins walk. there was no bell service though so it's all self-help. very little if no negotiation space for early checkin or late checkout. bathroom was sufficient and definitely not luxurious. For a lone stay, the room size is decent and comfortable.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect for shopping, dining and the train station is central enough to make getting places super easy.It's a quick 5 min walk to taxis as well.The room is uber clean and comfortable. The staff are polite and helpful.The hotel is an oasis to the buzz and excitement in Myeongdong, while allowing you to be right in the middle of all the action.No complains!I was traveling with my elderly mum who also enjoyed the hotel and the location.Thank you Solaria, we had a great time in Seoul thanks to you!
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would highly recommend to stay at Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel, if you want to be within extreme close proximity to shopping.It is conveniently located within less than a 10 minute walk to the train station and bus terminal. The hotel it's self is well kept and the staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are a decent size however I would recommend to utilise the humidifier. Overall I enjoyed my stay!
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really loved the location and my previous stay last year. Decided to bring my family this time round. The service was perfect and the rooms were wonderful. The location is my favourite been a short walk from the nearby metro station. Restaurants and shopping was just at the doorstep of the hotel. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time staying in Myeongdong and it was also my first time staying in a Japanese hotel. I was caught off guard. Not by any bad experiences, but by how much a hotel stay can be this wonderful and memorable. Solaria Nishitetsu is located just above M Plaza, right in the middle of the bustling street of Myeongdong. However, the soundproofing of the hotel was so good, that you could not even hear a single noise from the streets. The ambience of the hotel was extremely great too. The mixture of the warm lights and the dark coloured furniture made you feel cosy when in the room. The bathroom was nonetheless very clean and the bathtub was sparkling clean! I might have stayed in the females' floor as my room was provided with facial masks and facial lotion too. I was also amazed by the provision of a humidifier, linen water and shoe cleaner gloves as well. Very impressive!The toilet seat is automated and separated from the bathroom. Some might find it weird but I thought it is a rather efficient arrangement as it separated the use of the toilet and the bath facilities and you can't blame your travel partner for hogging the bathroom for the bathtub. The dressing table was a killer too. The lights were very bright and you could easily put your makeup on without having to struggle on any shadows on your face. The table was very big too. Enough for you to place a laptop and yet have space to sprawl a meal on it.A slightly painful memory might be the day I arrived at the hotel when it was raining and I had to drag the luggage through the crowd to realise that I had to go behind Zara for the hotel entrance. And as the hotel lobby is located at the 21st floor, you will need to take a lift up and then go back down to your assigned room (if you are staying below 21st floor).The hotel room might be a bit tight but I didn't mind that much as the entire stay was truly perfect. A point to note. The lobby also provides T-Money topup services. So you can spare the trouble to meddle with the topup machines in the subway and approach the English-speaking staff at the front desk. Also, a special shoutout to the housekeeping staff. I had seen them struggling to clear the rooms during one of the peak days and they were really having a hard time to clear the back logs. Nonetheless, they still managed to keep the rooms extremely clean. Thank you to them, truthfully!
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was situated within the Myeongdong shopping area and was very convenient for both shopping and food. It was also minutes away from the subway station and easy to commute to anyway in the city. Best of all, the airport bus limo stops near the hotel as well. The hotel room is great especially the 'Japanese style toilet '. Highlight recommended.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel biggest selling point is location. There are a lot of beauty shops, cafes, restaurants at the door step of the hotels. We tried all sort of food stall on the street which is within 100m radius! Style Nanda, Line Store (Note: they have lesser stock on this branch), Olive Young and all K Beauty products are just few walks away.The nearest subway is also few mins walk to Myeondong Station exit 8 (stairs) and exit 7 (Escalator). The hotel has a good view at the smoking room on 21st floor overlooking Myeongdong Cathedral.The room size is good enough for asian with a queen size bed. The Toto Washlet and the bath tub are great. The rest of the facilities are pretty much standard and with the price you pay I think it's a good deal.I'll definitely return when I'm back at Seoul.
hotelName:
19    Solaria Nishitetsu Hotel Seoul Myeong-dong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful time staying in Fraser Place. The rooms are clean well kept. Many local and international eating places in short walking distance. A few places open 24 hrs. Only issue was the extra charge to receive bedding for the sofa bed in the room. They treat it as an extra rollaway bed, which was a surprise considering Fraser place being an international company and I have never seen this type of charge in any other hotel which has a sofa bed already in the room. My advice, bring a sheet and blanket to avoid the $35+ /night to use the in room sofa bed. Fraser should re-evaluate this policy. Overall, I would recommend the hotel based on service, cleanliness and location. Easy to walk to local markets, restaurants and the subway and bus stops.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was awesome! We got the premium family suite. There was a separate living space with a couch, coffee table, dining room table, chairs and kitchen with a full fridge! The room was spacious,clean and modern. My aunt loved the room! The hotel was located to two near by subway stations so it was very convenient to get around the city. The Grand Place was within walking distance (~20mins) . Staff was very friendly and spoke English. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is near the centeal station and a good place to start your city tours. The staff is not unfriendly but a greeting when coming or leaving the hotel would feel better. Our room was on the 12th floor but the windows were so badly sealed that we could here all noises from the streets that prevented us from finding any sleep. And at the end of the day thats what a hotel is made for... sleeping.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location. 5 min walk to subway. 10-15 min walk to Myeongdung. 3 min walk to Nandammun.Good quality of TV. Free shuttle to Seoul station. Airport Bus stop just in front of the hotel. Convient for eating and shopping
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and tidy hotel. Courteous and English speaking staff. A good hotel for airport limousine drop off and pick up. Personally I find it quite a distant to walk to Myeongdong with kids though reviews stated it’s nearby.However it’s quite near City Hall station which is a good station for a lot of places of interest.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have travelled a lot, and am frequently in places for a stop-over, This was the best place that I have been to for a stop-over. It was clean, quiet, easy to check into. The room was pleasant, and gave one full control over the air temperature (a big plus). The lights and TV controls were easy to operate. The room service was basic but good and good value, as was the breakfast buffet. The bedside lights had a touch-operated system, and the light near the lavatory came on when one walked into that section of the room. All told, for a basic stay to catch up on sleep etc, this was just the ticket. It was also very reasonably priced for what it offered, and the airport bus was convenient (though make sure that one gets off at exactly the right stop: the previous stop is also called 'Fraser Place'.)
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location 5 min walk to the underground station, taxis wait outside at all hours. Very close to the Seoul tower a £3 taxi ride away, it’s also a short walk to the skyline park and the choice of restaurants in the immediate area is brilliant. The staff are welcoming and very helpful. The view from the bar is incredible. The apartment style rooms are very well equipped with rice cookers, microwaves, coffee machines, kettle iron, ironing board everything you would need for a long stay.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here six nights. Very convenient location within sight of Namdaemun gate and <5 minute walk to Namdaemun Market and 15 minute walk to Myeongdong. Near subway station and lots of stores around including Starbucks and Paris Baguette. Room was very spacious and well equipped. Wi-Fi was decent, water pressure in shower was ok, bed was comfortable. I requested a room with washer/dryer but I couldn’t use it because buttons were in Korean with no translation in guide. Staff is extremely accommodating, both before arrival and during stay. They responded promptly by email before stay and the front desk is fluent in English. Esther in particular was very helpful and friendly. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service provided by the hotel staff. The counter staff, Rick, assisted us with making the reservation for shuttle bus to Nami Island. Esther from the front desk is also very helpful by providing us with valuable suggestions on the places to go and she’s very friendly and fluent in English. Every time we walk past the counter, she never failed to smile to us. On top of that, the room cleaning services is one of the best. We had a very clean and big room for our deluxe room. Totally love it! Also, amazing rooftop view! Will definitely come back again.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel with my wife and my 1 year old daughter. This is our first time travelling with our daughter and also our first time staying in a hotel with her. In my opinion, this hotel has the best location as it is situated away from the more touristy area, away from the busy streets and sea of tourist. From the airport, you can take the airport limousine bus and alight right at the doorstep of the hotel which is very convenient. Going to the airport was just as easy, just board the same airport limousine bus across the street. Going from the hotel to other touristy area like myeongdong, dongdaemun, and gyeongbukgung palace were just a bus ride away and the bus stop are conviniently located 2 minutes walk from the hotel. For this trip, I've favoured public bus as my main mode of transportation, but if you prefer metro, the hotel is between 2 subway station which both is about 5 minutes walk away.There is a local food street right behind the hotel with many Korean restaurants where you can also find 24 hours convinient store as well as coffee shops around the vicinity. Traditional namdaemun market is just a 5 minutes walk away and there is 1 subway station located near the market.This hotel also have the best front desk service I've experienced ever. We arrived early about 10am and the hotel's policy for check-in was to start at 3pm. To our surprise, the front desk check us in without us even requesting for early check in. The room also have what we have requested when booking like high floor, non-smoking room, room with sofabed & baby crib. Then the front desk service staff (sorry I forgot her name) again amazes me as 1 night my daughter lost her teddy bear on our way back to the hotel, and since not all the Korean speaks & understand English, we sought help from the front desk. We just told her that we could have left the bear in a coffee shop or in the bus, she helped us to call the coffee shop but unfortunately the bear was not there. Then she helped to call the bus company and since the bus were still ferrying passengers, they could not search the bus either. But she promised that she will follow up with the bus company. Then the next morning, we got a note from her saying the bear is found in the bus. In the note, she have gave us clear directions in english to the lost and found center. Then when we were about to leave the hotel to the center, again we ask the front desk staff to write in Korean our intention to collect the teddy bear for us to show the staff of center. Then when we were at the center, the staff denied there is a teddy bear found and again we asked the bus company to call the front desk to clarify and it turn up that the she had asked the bus company to keep it somewhere else so that other will not able to take it. We are really grateful that our ordeal were handled by such a responsible hotel staff.Now, something not so great about the hotel. First, sound proofing wasn't the greatest as I could hear the busses honks during the morning rush hour traffic. I can also hear people using the gym above my room sometimes during the day. The rice cooker buttons, air conditioner and heater switches are all in korean and while there are English instructions for the heater and air conditioner, there is none for the rice cooker.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel location is excellent. There are 3 metro stations near the hotel, about 2-3 minute walk. Also a lot of restaurants behind the hotel so finding a place to eat wasn't difficult. The staff are excellent, they are polite and accommodating, and excellent English speaking staff. I do hope that they install a clock in the rooms, that would help. I used taxi to and from the hotel, and that was easy to do, although a bit more costly than taking the bus or the AREX.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent proximity to 3 metro lines.good food and shopping near byexcellent Onsen/Sauna and gym facility Very helpful front desk.the room was always very tidy, nicely presented and a good size for the money we paid.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wrote a couple of emails, one asking how to get there by bus and received instructions on the bus number. It would have been helpful for specific instructions on reaching the hotel (just a few steps from the bus stop) because the signage for Frasers Place was blocked by several vehicles at that time. A kind fellow passenger helped otherwise I would have been left a bit lost.The second email asked a specific question about booking an Express bus ticket online and whether waiting till I arrived would be too late given that the online system would not accept a foreign phone number. The answer took a couple of days but the service level was exceptional with Rick from the Concierge offering a mobile phone number for use. By that time I had already figured it out but that is truly going many steps beyond in order to help a customer! Truly outstanding service!
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception staff very good with good English and always ready to help. Bed was massive and comfortable. Nice view over Namdaemun, and good location for walking. Restaurant pretty good for breakfasts. Thumbs up
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a find! Stayed for 3 nights in a large efficiency with kitchenette which was well kept. Liked that the windows could be opened. Very good location for strolling around and easy to pick up quick food items nearby. Had room service one night (risotto w/mushrooms in cream sauce) and it arrived quickly and was quite good. Front desk very professional and well-staffed. Would stay again!
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: beautiful and very clean hotel, the location is superb! Very close to Myeong-dong.comfortable beds and pillows.very clean and beautiful shower,Clean towels.We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and it was amazing, the rooms are quiet, even on the lower floors.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed 1 night for transit as my friend suggested the area. the bus stop from the airport was in front of the hotel which was very convenient. the room was a good size and clean. reception people were lovely too.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled to Seoul with a 9 month old baby, which was a big part in selecting this hotel because of the suite and kitchen option. Good:- great location! Namdaemun market is across the street, perfect for grabbing street food/night eats to eat in kitchen while baby sleeps. A lot of main sites within 20 min walking distance - metro access is close by, but the metro lines are not very well connected and not very stroller friendly so was often easier to walk. - large room with fully stocked kitchen (premier suite). Kitchen had utensils and pot/pan for home cooking. Sliding doors to close bedroom off when baby sleeps was nice. - lots of restaurant options behind the hotel- hotel staff spoke perfect English and easy to communicate Bad:- the shuttle service from Seoul station only runs at specific times (last one being at 5pm). This was not clear when I was planning my trip and made it quite inconvenient when we got to the station and told we had to cab to the hotel (which was an adventure in itself!)- the walls are very thin and you can hear your neighbors quite clearly...especially at 2 am and their kids are running around screaming waking up our baby- the bed is very hard and can feel the springs coming through...after a whole day of carrying baby in a baby carrier, my back really needed a break. Unfortunately the hard bed has made my back worse. - the shower door doesn’t seal properly so you end up with a small pool in the washroom after every shower (not a deal breaker but worth a mention)Overall great stay and great value. Some small inconveniences but I would say the good outweighs the bad IMO.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super convenient central location! Walking distance to Meyong Dong & gyeongbok palace. The street behind the hotel is lined with restaurants. Couple chicken & beer places that open past midnight for those that get into the city late. Front desk staffs spoke very efficient English, very helpful on providing direction to various locations.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, but very disappointed with their customer service. Checked into a suite with my father assuming I could use the sofa bed as it’s advertised online, but when I asked for bedding from the front desk, they said to “set up” the sofa bed with sheets and a blanket would coat an extra $45 a night. Outrageous. I will be buying my own sheet and blanket for that much rather than give them extra money for a ridiculous policy.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms at this hotel are awesome - large suites with plenty of space. There’s a separate bedroom, combined living and dining area. The restaurant, however, has very strange policies. We went to have dinner there our last night at the hotel because they advertised several specials that looked good and were reasonably priced. When we ordered, we learned that the specials are not available unless everyone in our party (3 of us) ordered the same thing. We didn’t want the same thing and the prices provided were per person (we were not ordering a dinner for the table). In addition, my son was unable to order anything off the “tapas” menu because you couldn’t have tapas unless everyone at the table had tapas. These rules were not noted on the English language menu and there was no rhyme or reason for them.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would say this is the one of best hotels ive stayed after travelling 13 countries. The hotel room and hotels location is perfect. But the best part is their staff. They were so helpful in directing us to the best restuarants nearby, and to get to the sightseeing place easily. keep up the good work. Iam looking forward to stay with the fraser group in all my future trips.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel provided us with all the "pros" which justify our high satisfaction. Perfect location with walking distance to many attractions: - Sungnyemun Gate, - Daehanmun Gate, - Deouksugung Palace, - Kyongbok Palace,- Myeondong area,- Lotte Department Store,- City Hall,- Namdaemun market, - Seoul TV tower,- Cheonggyecheon Stream ...etc.You should not also miss to explore Bukchang-dong street located behind the hotel, so to say "mini Myeondong next door".Room was cozy, with modern design and comfortable forniture and equipment (which included even smart toilet). The breakfest exceeded our expectations (do not miss an aloe juice - a great crescendo in the morning). The personnel was very helpful and attentive (special thanks to Ms.Esther Kim from the reception who recommended to us an experience with local Korean BBQ - a fun and a pleasure in one place). Good fitness center. Free WiFi. As a conclusion: Fraser Place Namdaemun is a perfect place for staying during your visit to Seoul.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was on the 2nd floor; a great view regardless. It was a beautiful room, a comfortable bed. The bathroom already had toothbrushes, toothpaste, shower caps, hair ties so you didn’t have to call down or go down to ask. I don’t like how their heating system is set up but I’ve heard heating through the floor is traditional for Korea. The front desk woman (I hate that I can’t remember her name) she was great! When the concierge was busy she still helped me in securing tickets to a show and an English speaking taxi driver. She was friendly and welcoming. Checkout was an easy process and the restaurants breakfast was yummy! It’s in a great location for late night snack as well.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great family hotel, centrally located, walking distance to many attractions. Rooms are spacious, we loved the kitchen and a washing machine in a room. Kitchen has all the tools you might need. Staff is helpful and speaks good English. Check-in was smooth and it was very nice to get a fruit plate in a room upon check-in. There is a restaurant on the 1st floor and a long on the 16th floor with great views. Gym and sauna are also on the 16th floor. Lots of eateries and cafes around. Namdaemun market is practically across the street and a has many street food stands that are quite an experience:) If I am to be back in Seoul, will definitely stay there again. Thank you, Fraser Namdaemun!
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 6 nights at this hotel recently. I was here in 2014 and the great service still remains! Excellent and helpful service from the front desk staff. Great location if you love to walk, shop & sightsee! Namdaemun and Myeongdong street shopping within walking distance.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The position is very good as Seoul station is really close and you are also able to visit many attractions by foot. The breakfast was great and our room had separate bedroom and kitchen-living room with sofa where children could sleep.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great service, nice location, bathub in the bathroom, they also have smoking rooms, but i dont know hows the food bcs my room was without breakfast. the perfect thing about this hotel is the location, not far from station, lot of resto near thishotel, and the airport bus pick up and drop off location is in front of this hotel (so much better than taxi to airport). recommended, sure will book this hotel again when i go back to seoul
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful trip, the hotel close to subway station and accessible to many restaurants and attraction. The room is spacious and comfortable. gym and spa are good and worth to try. a friendly team from the reception.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all i would like to thank you David and Rick (concierge team) who really help us so much in delivering the local tourist service.. We came without any guide but they assist us whenever you want to go to local attraction place.. The hotel is nice, has spacious room and they give u option between shower or baththub facility.. toilet is clean for my room 901. If u came to seoul and got no information to do. You may come to this place, they will give you the best.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great gym, perfect studio rom, central we could walk around or the tube is very close, one stop from the link to the airport. Theres also a really good sauna and steam on the top floor and cool bar. WELL worth the price. very clean, very modern, good wifi, we were on floor 13 and wifi was great.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for the second time! Extremely friendly front desk, very helpful and attending house keeping staff, great location, spotless clean, comfy bed and well kept facilities! Good breakfast too. The view from the top floor panorama bar is gorgeous! Deffinitely recomend and would surely love to stay again if the chance occurs!
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is very accessible. Seoul Station is less than 5min if you take a cab, with shops and restaurants a few meters away. The NAMI bus trip is just a block away while the DMZ bus trip is also a few steps from the hotel. But what sets them apart in my view was the warmth and Friendliness of the Front Desk Staff. Will definitely go back.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am writing this letter as a humble note of appreciation for the outstanding customer service provided by David who are working on 31st January, 2019I really commend the prompt service provided by him. He did an awesome job.He is a cheerful, polite, helpful and thoughtful staff.And providing professional manner. Action before customers ask. Meanwhile, we are quite upset that on 30th January, 2019 night. As we would like to order the delivery order from outside restaurant but they cannot speak in English. We would like to find the front desk staff for assist since that day is my boyfriend 's birthday and this is the last night stay in your hotel. Therefore, we would like to try again the Korean fried chicken before we leave on 31st January, 2019. However, the front desk staffs regrets..... I know that your hotel had provide the food & beverage as well... But why don't you do it specifically for the in house guest just one time off. And Front desk staff ask us to call the restaurant again in hotel room..but it cannot help as the restaurant staff told me that they cannot speak in English......THE FRONT DESK STAFF charged us the local call fee during we check out the room as well .....fine...........Its break the good impression for this apartment!
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was staying there for 7 night as a family of 4, room was spacious, location was great close to major tourist site. Transfer from and to airport was just in front of the hotel. The staff was really knowledgeable and helpful. Will definitely stay there again if we come to Seoul again. Kamsamida
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very spacious. Much bigger than most of the hotels around. Clean and cosy. We had to walk a little bit to get to Myeongdong, maybe around 10 mins. There is a washing machine, dryer and pantry with a stove top in the living area of this room. We enjoyed staying here. Will definitely be back :)
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was spacious, the bed very comforable. At least in my room the flooring was in bad condition because due to the floor heating the floorboard had substantial gaps, so sometimes - with naked feed - I got caught up in these gaps.Location is great,In regards to the breakfast (I stayed for a week) I wish they would change the selection more often than just alernating between two sets.Note: What is really disturbing - but it seems to be a general trend nowadays (and I travel a lot, esp. in Asia) - is the appropriateness of the clothing. I am in my fourties (and not super-old-fashioned) but I find it extremley irrtiating when guests appear in their sleeping wear or naked feed and hotel slippers in public space. A short notice at the entry would be advisable! :-)
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is excellent but the service was most outstanding for me. All staff including Esther provided quality advice and so polite. The plus was a great gym and hot bath/sauna. The Namdaemun market is just around the corner. Great value for money.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay for 3 days 4 night, have a very good accommodation in the central of the city. Close to shops and public transportation. Quality of food and room are good. It's very recommended hotel for family vacation in Seoul.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is the second time we have stayed in this hotel. fantastic location, great price and very helpful,kind and well trained staff.rooms are clean, modern and warm during the cold winter monthswe will always stay here in the future when visiting seoul
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights in Month of November, and booked the Premier Queen Bed with Sofa Bed Inclusive of Breakfast ! We had a perfect stay and its is good Value for money!The Room is modern , lit well, absolutely clean ,Comfortable and with a nice view and small Kitchenette! We had Requested for a Premier room with Washing machine, and for that we had to wait while Checking in for half hr which was not a problem with us ! The Staff at the Front Desk are very Helpful , kind and friendly! The Check out and Transfers were flawless! The Location of the hotel is just perfect , walking Distance to The City Hall Station, Myeongdong, Lotte Mart, Seoul Station and many Convenience Stores! P.S. The Apartments only dont have a Dishwasher I highly recommend this hotel and would Defn stay here when I return to Seoul!
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We tried premium one bed and it was very satisfying. We enjoyed sauna often(facility was amazingly good), location was convenient, service was excellent. We will stay here again when visit Seoul next time.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the the staffs at the reception who all speaking fluent English to the other teams. All were really good. Very impressive and happy with their service. The facility provided in the hotel is up to the 5 star standard.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in deluxe room that offers spacious size for two. I enjoyed a beautiful namdaemun view. There was a sauna on top floor. Open-air hot bath was great on a cold night. Staff was helpful and attentive. Breakfast was not sumptous, but decent to start off a day. Overall, it is recommendable for all who seek a value hotel located in the center of Seoul.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ok hotel for what it costs. Nothing extra special. Really central location to many interesting places, so thats a big plus for it. The breakfast was quite disappointing considering it costs extra to eat.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was well maintained and is in heart of the city, Front office staff is very supportive with informations. The total ambience of the property is so good and happy to stay at the same hotel for 4 days while i was in seoul
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a great place to stay with young kids due to its convenience. Staff are very helpful and responsive. However, i do have a few suggestions for the hotel to consider :1) will be good if there can be washer/dryer can be guaranteed upon booking. I was quite worried that there wouldn’t be a washer(it’s not guaranteed) in the room allocated so I brought along more clothes for the kids. 2) pillows are too soft , by the time I requested, I was told the memory foam type are all taken up3) the flooring may need some upgrading works as the laminated floor in the room that we stayed in showed signs of chipped off and gapsDespite the above, we truly have enjoyed the stay Will stay again in our future visit !
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 nights at Fraser Place Hotel. Very fast check-in/check-out, excellent staff who went beyond the call of duty to make our stay enjoyable. Excellent continental and traditional breakfast for $19 per person. Free water bottles in the room. Nice room with comfy beds and all expected amenities for a 4-star hotel, spotless clean room/bathroom (free toiletries provided, etc.), daily bedding change (unless you opt out). Umbrellas provided in the room, too - very necessary in Seoul in November. Wonderful views of the Namdaemun Gate. Excellent location, 5-minutes walking distance from Seoul Station (metro, train, etc.), close to N Seoul Tower, etc.. The only negative is that the hotel was build a while ago and it shows a little but we would stay again at this hotel. Overall, very good value for the money and a great stay!
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice staff /Big room/Convenient/CleanPremier 3 night 4.5/5ข้อดี:เดินทางสะดวกมาก ใกล้ city hall exit8 ~480 m Airport bus 6005 limusine ขามาโรงแรม Airport-hotel จอดหน้าโรงแรม ขากลับไปสนามบินอยู่ฝั่งตรงข้าม ร้านอาหารรายรอบ มีโพจังมาจากรุบกริบ ร้านไก่ทอดเบียร์ some staff very nice and helpful สตาฟให้การช่วยเหลืออย่างดี ห้องกว้าง เตียงนุ่ม มีครัว ห้องอาบน้ำแยกชัดเจน ห้องนอนกับห้องนั่เล่นแยกกันทีวีคนละตัว โต๊ะทานอาหาร ครัว จาน ชาม มีด หม้อ พร้อม ไม่ออกไปไหนก็ได้ส่วน sauna บริการฟรี แต่ไม่ได้ไปย่างกราย คนพักส่วนมาก มีต่างชาติและเกาหลี มีรถบริการshuttle bus free ไป seoul station หรือถ้าไม่อยากเดินข้ามถนน ข้อเสีย: ห้องไม่ค่อยเก็บเสียง เสียดังตึงตัง แต่ไม่มาก ไม่ได้ดูรบกวนจนนอนไม่ได้ ของใช้ไม่เติมทุกวัน อาหารเช้าราคาแพงมากเมื่อเทียบกับที่อื่น ของมีให้เลือกน้อย ถ้าให้กลับมาพักอีก กลับไปแน่นอน แต่คงไม่รับอาหารเช้า
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the chance to stay in this brilliant hotel for 2 days with my friend from Turkey and we both really enjoyed our stay here.The best part of this hotel is the location. Many famous tourist places such as Gyoungbok Palace, Myeongdong, and Namsan Tower are all located within a walking distance. In addition, the staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Whenever my friend and I didn't know what to eat we would simply ask the receptionists or concierge for suggestions. There are many options for you to choose from and the staff are well aware and are willing to help you try the best ones!The room we stayed (deluxe) was spacious and comfortable.We both really loved our stay here and will definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a good quite place in the center of Seoul!
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated a 5 minute walk from Namdaemun Market and the start of Seoullo 7017 Skypark, and a 10 minute walk from Deoksugung/City Hall, Fraser Place is a great base of operations for exploring central Seoul, and further afield. We were not able to get an early check-in, but did drop our bags here on arrival. We had a high room which would have had a view of the nearby Gate if not for a billboard - but we did have a nice city view including N Seoul Tower. There was some traffic noise at night - but this we were on the front side of the hotel facing the road. We tried out the suana/baths, which was nice - the men's has an open-air heated pool (no view sadly).Everything you could want is a short (or mid-length) wander away - and for longer journeys within Seoul the public transport connections are excellent. The staff kindly flagged us a taxi when we needed to depart. I would stay here again in a flash.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is brilliantly located for the Metro, markets, shopping, sightseeing. We stayed four nights & really enjoyed it. The staff were so lovely, helpful & friendly. The suites are huge & tastefully decorated. There is plenty of choice for breakfast. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay at Fraser Place Namdaemun this week... Professional, helpful and friendly staff, especially the concierge team, and in particular, Ryan and Rick. The suite is spacious, bright with clean and comfortable beddings. The bathroom is equipped with everything one would need, and beyond, such as the multi function toilet and rainfall shower head... They though of all the details to make your stay hazzard free, such as motion activated room entry light and key card controlled elevator. The dining is pleasant, and room rates and dining charges are of great value. It is located in the middle of everything, tons of restaurants, coffee shops and stores, farmers market... You can just walk around and enjoy what Seoul has to offer. I will definitely stay at Fraser Place for my future visits to Seoul. Highly recommended!!
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located, it's 5 mins walk away from City Hall Station, which is an intersection of 2 major subway lines. It's near Myeongdong yet away from the hustle and bustle of the noisy streets.Reasonably priced and very clean. Excellent customer service. The airport bus station is just outside the hotel, which makes airport transfer a breeze.
hotelName:
20    Fraser Place Namdaemun Seoul
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the first time in over 11 years as a platinum member, this hotel wanted to charge me a full nights stay for an early check-in. I have never had this happen to before. What a joke! Going forward, I would never stay at this property again.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If the plan is to do skincare shopping and to be in the middle of Myeongdong, Aloft is a good place to stay. Food is easy to find many are open 24hours. The hotel is clean and compact, front office and concierge can speak English very well and they're helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a laundry picked up at 11am,which should be returned by 11am next day, but they were dishonest about their timing and only to say they could only return my garment in the afternoon 4-5pm. Really unprofessional service.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the pre-booking, Aloft was very accomodating in ensuring I get connecting rooms before I prepay the rooms. I was travelling with my husband and 2 children aged 10 and 5. We were very comfortable in 2 Aloft Rooms. One had a king sized bed and one with 2 single beds. There is no way we will fit in one room because they will not allow a rollaway bed. They can set up a tent/kid's bed on the floor but that will leave us with no room for our 2 luggages. One of our rooms was an Accessible room so we didnt like to take a shower there so we all took a bath from the other bathroom but at least we had an extra toilet so we are more efficient in preparing every morning. We had comfortable sleep because the bed was firm enough and we love the pillows. The temperature in the room was also perfect. We also love the toiletries and enough shelves, hangers and space for all our luggage and things. The elevators can accomodate all occupants and we never waited a long time for an elevator to arrive.Checkin was a breeze. I requested to have our rooms ready on the wee hours since we got a room even if we were arriving the next day. They kept our room until we arrive as planned.Location is superb. Quiet enough to rest and near enough to get to the Myeongdong Shopping streets. We wouldnt want to stay in the hotels right in the middle of the busy area because it will be too noisy.Only drawback is there is no view. We got the back view with not so nice view but it wasnt so important to us. We just opened the curtains when we wanted to check if it was sunny/cloudy.Our stay was more than perfect. From the helpful concierge (especially Gina being our favorite), to the friendly front desk, to the very accomodating chefs making our eggs at the Nook restaurant. The hotel has all that we could ask for. The weighing scale at the lobby is also a good addition. We admire hotels who think of this.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms and the hotel overall fall a bit short of a 4star and really are more like a 3start rating. The rooms a decent size but they are noisy (both street noise and noise from the other rooms) and they had no view at all. The fixtures are also very average and the toiletries were bad quality. The cleaning was also VERY inconvenient...for example, one day we had no toiletries replaced even though we used up most and the next day we had even extra.What made me give them an extra star though was the excellent service everywhere (the check-in desk, the concierge, and the rooftop staff), the amazing location (close to the subway lines and walking distance to all palaces, to the hanok villages, and to the Namsan park). Also, they had a coin laundry on the third floor which was an amazing find and saved us one house chore back home.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am in my mid-60s and have never stayed in an Aloft property. This one was in an excellent location for this section of Seoul, a $6 cab ride to Incidon and walking distance to the Korean street scene that is so engaging. It was very clean and well appointed with a fairly small room. There were several free welcome amenities. It is a modern and "hip" brand with a nice rooftop bar and live music on Thursdays. I would stay here again for sure.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here 5 nights. Amy upgraded me to a beautiful Breezy Suite on the 17th floor. It was AMAZING! They placed a lovely assortment of Korean snacks in my suite. Check in was a bit bumpy when I arrived at 8am on Saturday, May 25th. I didn’t expect my room to be ready this early, but I did expect superior customer service, or at least a friendly greeting. The young lady on the 2nd floor front desk couldn’t be bothered to say “good morning” or “welcome”. Instead, She kept her head down acting as if she was busy on the computer the entire time I was standing there. This really irritated me. Mind you I was completely exhausted from a 13 1/2 hour flight from the US and would have loved a warm greeting. Sadly, this is not what I received. I am immediately started to regret my decision to stay here. They took my credit card, information from my passport, and made me sign voluminous documents even though I wasn’t able to check into my room. I asked if they could at least keep my luggage until I could get into the room. They allowed me to do so. There was no recommendation for a place to sit down and have a coffee or breakfast while I waited for my room. I asked about an approximate wait time for the room to be ready. They were not able to assist. I walked around from 8 AM until 4 PM until well beyond Check-in time. At that point, I was irritable and super exhausted. When I arrived at the front desk there was a long line of people waiting to be checked in. This did not make me a happy camper as I had already checked in and only needed a key. Needless to say, I was asked to wait in the long line of people. Thankfully, that was the last of the bad impression which was left on me about this hotel. Everything else was uphill from here. The best thing about this hotel is the housekeeping staff. I had the absolute best housekeeping attended. Each and every day she went over and beyond to service my room and leave me more than enough goodies to make my stay comfortable. She greeted me with a warm and genuine smile and hello each and every day. I was actually very sad to leave such a warm personality. The assistant front desk manager “Elle” introduced herself to me the night before my departure. She was extremely kind to ask me if I had the opportunity to indulge in the Korean snacks that they left in my room. I explained that I loved the soup. She immediately went out of her way to stock my room with more Korean snacks. This truly warmed my heart. Not only did they restock my room with more Korean snacks, they also left me a Korean face-mask and beautiful hand cloth with Aloft Myeongdong engraved on it. This touched me in such a special way. I am already making plans to come back due to the excellent service.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff we encountered at the bar and front desk were great. Rooms were decent size and everything seemed fairly new. Overall, not a bad hotel, especially for the price and in a pretty good area, close to all of Myeongdong shopping and the subway.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is modern with good breakfast. It’s very close to shopping , eating and the metro . The staff is very friendly and helpful to tourists . The price is very reasonable for a 4 star hotel . The bed and pillows are very comfortable . Nice stay overall .
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The last hotel on a two week journey through Japan and South Korea, we were feeling weary when we arrived at the checkin. We were greeted by the amazing Front Office Supervisor, Linda, who I have to say is possibly the best hotel staff member we have ever met.We were shown to our room personally and as we enquired about different room options, Linda showed us another room type. Having decided on the room type we had already booked, Linda suggested she would try and find us the highest floor possible as we have a five night booking.Advice on shopping needs was expertly provided as well.The room was great. The location amazing. Right near everything you need. Night food market is one street away as are all the great shops and department stores.But apart from the great design, you can never underestimate the impact of brilliant staff and how an everyday routine action and make you feel so welcome and valued.So great work Linda S. You are a star. Thank you for presenting the hotel and Seoul so wonderfully on our first day.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m impressed by the check in efficiency friendly concierge and the thoughtful design. Hotel is clean and modern and has everything we need. V convenient location good value for money. Highly recommend! I’m still staying here tonight but can’t help to express my pleasant experience esp as compared to similar hotels I stayed in the past.
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the property claims to be an ALOFT hotel, it is anything but an Aloft. I have stayed in dozens of Aloft across the world, but this one is quite different. It doesnt have the ‘Spartan-Style’ element of Aloft hotels but attempts to add some elements. The room layout and fittings aer different, The Bathroom amenities are not from BLISS, the mini-bar treat are not there, etc. IT is more of a Asian feel hotel than a Aloft style. But still at the price we paid and the location it is a great value for money.LOCATION: Excellent location near all the action of the Myeongdong neighborhood.DINE + DRINK: They have a bar and restaurant on the 2nd floor. Not too chic, but funky enough for a drink or a quick mealROOM: We stayed in 2006, so this review is based on that; VIEW: lovely view of the mountains and the cityscape ; SIZE: Very spacious room; AIR-CON: Perfectly functioning cooler that helped in setting the perfect room temperature; BED: Comfortable bed that played the expected part to put me to sleep; BATHROOM: Stand in shower; TOILETRIES: Excellent spa quality cosmetics by BIGELOW brandFACILITIES: A Joke of a ‘Fitness center’ that is nothing more than a bigger room fitted with a few cardio machines. No free weights or any other equipment. No Swimming pool either!SERVICE: Friendly staff that took care of all my needs with a smile and made us feel pampered and well taken care of. HOW WIRED YOU WILL BE: Free high speed Wi-Fi that works well all over the property. Big Plasma TV screen dishing out dozens of channels spanning sports, news, music, movies and a wide variety of entertainment in multiple languages
hotelName:
21    Aloft Seoul Myeongdong
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had my first ever stay in a Aloft hotel – Aloft Myeongdong – just one night where I had a pleasant taste of a “next generation of hotel, using technology and design to enhance experiences”.Hotel location: I like the fact that this hotel is just next to the famous Myeongdong shopping district. It is also about 10 minutes’ walk to the Myeongdong subway/metro station (which I walked one morning to Exit 2 where the Funtastic Korea buses depart). There are a few ways to reach the hotel from Seoul Incheon Airport.
