She also accompanied us to see the doctor there when we were unwell so that she could translate for us. Emily was also very prompt in attending to my requests e.g. baby bath tub before we arrived. Housekeeping lady was very kind and friendly too. I wish I knew all the names of the staff who helped and attended to us along the way. It had been very pleasant. Will definitely consider staying there again.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2nd time stay @ the deluxe queen room except that this room was with a different setting. With metal bed frame, more mirrors around and no bath tub (more space) compared to the last stay. Good enough to have two huge luggage open and space to walk too.The house keeping ahjumma was really nice and did a good job with the cleaning! Basis breakfast with a good mix of Korean food and the bread/cereal was sufficient to start your day. :-) Book directly with the hotel to enjoy the complimentary breakfast. We did an extension of late check-out by topping up abit.Location (Euljiro-1-ga station + nearby airport bus drop off point) and price was the main factor to come back again!Walking distance of 10 mins to Myeongdong station which makes it convenient to go for day tour meet up point.Spoilt for choices for food where there is just a stretch of fried chicken restaurant around the area.PS: There is only one washer machine and dryer @ level 7 which operates between 8am to 10.30pm. Needs a bit of luck to get washing done in the early morning or late night. Will be great if there was 2 washer/dryer.Don't mind to be back again!
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Metro Hotel for 9 nights in April. We booked a Comfort Twin directly with the hotel and requested a bed rail as we were traveling with our two year old and wanted the option for him to be in a bed. We also brought a travel crib with us and there was plenty of space for that in the room.The daily breakfast was appreciated and variety was sufficient. The dining room has highchairs, kid dishes and cutlery, and most days staff kindly brought us a pack of wipes to use (we didn’t ask and had our own).We made use of the laundry facilities. The dryer worked well but we had a lot of clothes the needed to hang dry and those dried well in the bathroom with the fan on (we bring a travel laundry line with us).Surprisingly, we didn’t use the play space - just a matter of timing of our days and travel plans. We did make use of the second floor lounge a few days when our toddler was fussy - we grabbed food for lunch and ate in the lounge avoiding pre-nap restaurant meltdowns.The staff were friendly and management seemed sincerely interested in how guests were enjoying their stay.The tax refund documentation (provided as we booked directly) was great to get and it was easy to process the refund at the airport.I would be happy to return to Metro Hotel (with or without kids).
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a family room located on the 2nd floor, which has 2 double bed. Room was clean and spacious enough for our luggages and pram, The air humidifier doesnt work. Checkin was pretty smooth, complimentary breakfast is more than adequate. The laundry facility is great because we have a todder. Id rate this place higher, but during Our 3 nights stay, we normally will be out of the room around 9-930am, and i hit the clean our room button, however the cleaners always come around 4, which is my youngest sons nap time. So during the entire stay we never had the room properly clean.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 7 nights in a deluxe room. Room is comfortable. House keeping is neat and clean. Front desk service staff are helpful and courteous. You can top up the T-money card at the front desk. 7 eleven and Starbucks are located right next to the hotel. Only about 3 to 5 minutes walk to Myeongdong shopping street. You can take Airport bus 6015 at the bus stop right in front of ibis hotel (which is about 5 mins walk from Metro Hotel) to the airport.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Japan and then Seoul, South Korea last year in May. The hotel was in the center of many restaurants and shopping malls.The staff were super nice and the Korean style room I had was super cute and huge.If I ever go back to Seoul, South Korea I will come back here.Check my pictures
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love Metro Hotel! Stayed in this hotel twice. On my first trip and my fourth with my family:) The rooms are clean and comfortable. I have no issue with the space. I stayed 4 nights and 6 nights respectively for both trips. The staffs are polite, quick in email Enquiries and morning breakfast never fails! Try that mochi like buns! There is also a phone with local data and travel tips for you to bring around outside. Can’t rave enough.Highly recommended!
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed your stay at this hotel. The service was good and the room as good as well! The location was close to the city, and many restaurant around the hotel. I would recommend anyone who is going to Korea to stay her!
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family stayed 6 nights with Metro. I didn’t book direct, although if you do you get a few extra perks - like breakfast and you can reclaim the taxes. We arrived 45 mins before allowed check-in (3pm) but wasn’t an issue.Our room was delightful - clean, roomy, temp was to our liking, bedding and beds were comfortable. I’ve never really enjoyed instant coffee but I didn’t mind the brand they provided as well as complimentary bottle water daily (based on room headcount). We didn’t utilize any of the additional facilities in the hotel such as the gym, laundry room, etc. but it was nice to have them available. The entire hotel staff, during our stay, was exceptional. They were courteous, polite, helpful and spoke English (speak slower at times). They helped with questions around the subway/metro system, purchasing of t-cards (highly recommend) and arranging transportation to the airport. The only reason I’m not giving them a 5 star was due to the fact that our room was on next to the utility closet and wow was it loud and at breaking dawn. There was also a constant, faint smell of smoke. Perhaps it was due to us being on the third floor and the smoking lounge was on the second. We also had a very obnoxious family above us that obviously refused to tame their toddler from using the floor as a trampoline. Apparently they’ve never heard of “inside voices”. But that is to no fault of the hotel and I didn’t bother calling the front desk to report. It was our last few nights so we dealt with it. Let’s end on a positive - LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!! Everything within walking distance - shops, food, subway/transportation- I mean it was ideal. It wasn’t ever really loud outside from the traffic or crowds. This was the perfect spot and will more than likely be returning due to the pleasant experience.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time that we have stayed in this hotel and I must say it was even better than the last time. Back in 2017, we truly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and coming back, we have enjoyed it even more. Customer service is flawless as everyone is very accommodating from the guards, to the receptionists, staff at the breakfast area and those cleaning the rooms. They treat their customers nicely and are very pleasant when you inquire for something. I love the rooms as well as the relax package that we availed. Too bad though that they no longer have the free mobile phone service but I know it is not their fault. Breakfast was adequate but the quality is good. I truly miss staying here and would love to go back again here in case I visit Korea again. To add, there is a mini pantry at the second floor where you can use microwave, drink water or just hang around. Best thing also is that it is located at Myeongdong and a few steps from Euljiro Il ga metro station. Bus 6015 to the airport is also just a few steps away. What more can you ask for? See you again Metro Hotel! Can'y wait to go back. :)
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel located in Myeongdong area; you can take airport shuttle bus number 6015 from Incheon airport and get off at ibis ambassador hotel stop, then just a 3 mins walk to arrive Metro Hotel. Very convenient!I love the security guards at entrance, they are very warm welcoming & polite; also make you feel very safe when you stay in this hotel. Staffs are friendly and helpful as well. Give clear explanations on how to use remote control to operate TV, lights and air-con in-room.I booked a deluxe double room, it’s spacious, clean and bed is very comfortable. Feel like you are home. Provides electric kettle for making coffee, tea for your stay, have fridge; great shower & clean bathroom with amenities you needed.Just one minor thing, my room located at 3rd floor that sometimes street noise could be a bit disturbing; if you are a light sleeper, try getting a room at higher floor.Perfect location, it’s just 3 mins walk to nearest Station “Euljiro 1-ga” where you can take the line 2 to most of the Seoul attractions; few mins walk to Myeong-dong shopping streets; lots of restaurants & shops nearby. Cross the main road, you will reach the Lotte Department Store & Lotte Duty Free Shop.I’ll definitely come back to Metro Hotel when visiting Seoul next time.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay 5 nights at Metro Hotel. The best location in Myeongdong, only 2min walking distance to Subway Line 2 Euljiro 1 Exit 5 or 6; near Myeongdong Cathedral, Daiso, Ettude House, Natural Republic, Innisfree, Faceshop, etc. A lot of restaurants and streetfoods near the hotel. The Comfort Twin Room has 2 double beds. The room is very clean. The breakfast is simple but delicious. We can choose several kinds of coffee from the coffee machine ( capucino, americano or expresso ). It is very recommended hotel. I will stay at Metro Hotel again for the next trip. Thank you Metro Hotel. All of your staff are very kind especially Ms. Senny Lee and Ms. Emily.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1) Location of the hotel is good, as it is near Euljiro 1(il)ga Subway Station. There is a lift that you can use if you have baby stroller or have elderlies. You can also walk from the hotel to Myeongdong Station that takes about 10 minutes.2) There is Starbucks, 7-11, famous BBQ Pig restaurant (Hanam Pig House) and Two Two fried chicken restaurant right in/beside the hotel. Just walking distance you can also find many other restaurants (Innisfree Green Cafe, Osulloc Tea House, BHC Fried Chicken, Noo Na Hol Dak Fried Chicken) and Myeongdong Street Food where you can try some street food.3) Staff at the reception counter were polite and can speak English and so there is no communication problem. You can also ask the staff to help you top up your T-Money card (save your time to do it at the vending machine in the Subway Station).4) The Security Guards were all helpful and courteous. They will greet you, whether or not if you entering or exiting the hotel. They even help you with taking your luggages.5) The House Keeping staff at level 7 were also friendly and courteous, always greeting you with a smile.6) We (3 adults) stayed in a Comfort Twin Room. All amenities in the room were sufficient (such as pillows, hangers etc.). Everything was comfortable.7) We have also breakfast in the hotel at Level 9. However, the area for us to dine in is quite small and throughout my 5 days there for breakfast, it was always packed with people and so sometimes you may not be able to sit with your family members or you may have to wait for other guests to finish their breakfast. For me, I think that small area for breakfast does not seem large enough to accommodate to the large number of guests (especially at the peak period for breakfast). Also, the dishes there seem repetitive and the choices are limited (always the same food). Nonetheless, it is still enough for you to start your day. The mochi bread (made by the hotel) are really nice, so do try this when you are staying there. The staff at the breakfast counter are polite and helpful.8) Overall, the stay at Metro Hotel was pleasant and I would come back to this hotel again. I do hope to see improvement in the breakfast choices and to consider expanding the breakfast area.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 7 nights at the hotel and the rooms were all clean and tidy. Rooms are considered spacious and has all the necessities and basic toiletries. The famous shopping street Myeongdong is just steps away and you are surrounded by restaurants and street food.Just need to bring your bags and shopping list.The staff at the hotel we met were fluent in English in general so there is no issue of communication.Since we have many clothes due to the winter weather, the housekeeper was so nice to give us additional hangers without we asking.Will stay here again!
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would absolutely stay at this hotel again if I get the chance. A very clean and stylish hotel that made our stay very comfortable. Not to mention the rooms were very functionally designed. We really loved the bench/sitting area and mesh drawers to hold our belongings.The hotel staff (reception and security) are so helpful and polite, and have great English language proficiency. I had my bookings done via email as the room rates weren't available that early in time. Once the online pricing was out and was cheaper than my bookings, the hotel honoured the lower rate and sent me a revised confirmation. Breakfast was ok, not too much variety, but can't complain as it's free (if book directly with hotel) and there's tons of options around the hotel. 7-Eleven and Starbuck are attached to the hotel so it provided great convenience. The hotel also held our luggage when we arrived earlier, had an overnight trip elsewhere, and on the day of check-out (since we had a later flight). It's in a prime location that's close to public transportation, restaurants, and shops in Myeongdong. The airport bus #6015 stops just about a block away and Euljiro1-ga Station (exit 5 & 6) are also a few minutes walk away. Although on the edge of the shopping district, this was actually our preference as it was less noisy and crowded.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s located very close to the main shopping area but in the peaceful part. It’s very convenient here! The room was on the small side but the design was done well that it didn’t feel cramped. It was super clean and everything looked new. The staff were also very courteous. I would definitely stay here again for my next Seoul visit.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We first visited Metro Hotel when the hotel has its old design. Just this year, we went back to the hotel and was glad that they have now renovated the hotel in a more stylish design. The location is great because it is near the bus station, taxi stand, airport bus. Plus you won't get hungry because the outside has lots of great food like BHC. Definitely recommending this hotel. We are actually going back next year to Seoul and we have decided to stay again at Metro Hotel.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent 2 weeks at the Metro. There were 5 of us and we had 4 standard rooms. The rooms are small without much closet or dresser space. However other wise the Metro is perfect. The rooms are well decorated and quiet, the beds comfortable. The location is great, close to everything. We booked directly through the hotel by e-mail. The rate was inexpensive and included a very nice breakfast. There is a balcony on the second floor for evening get togethers.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed for two nights in the metro hotel. Room was clean and large (we were upgraded to a family room) - modern conveniences including a remote that controlled pretty much everything in the room. There is also a “handy” phone in the room which means you can use ‘data’ out and about if you haven’t got a SIM card. The hotel is quite a way from the main airport, but is VERY continently located to close proximity of all the beauty shops in Myeongdong - you can see Innisfree from the hotel lobby window! This also makes it handy for the Myeongdong night market which happens in the same area...there is a 7/11 and Starbucks on site which make it convenient to grab quick snacks or drinks if needed. Hotel staff speak great English, so we didn’t have to worry about translation issues and also were super helpful with offering advice and booking taxis for us.I’ve included some images below.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location (near the bus station, a short walk to Myeongdong), simple but tasty breakfast, nice and clean room! There are also a lot of restaurants nearby, plus a 7-11 on the ground floor, so never worry about getting hungry! :)
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mid-range hotel, right in Mydeongdong. Fantastic location, with lots to do, eat and shop right smack at Myeongdong and near to 2 subways (Myeongdong and Euljiro)and close to many tourist attractions. Lots of street food to try out, too. At the edge of the busy shopping district, thus not noisy at all. Rooms are comfortable and service standards are good. Complimentary breakfast if you book direct. Free wifi and free handy phone with complimentary local and overseas calls.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The price for this hotel is cheap but what you will get is more than what you pay for. They rooms are not that big but very comfortable. The aircon and heater are both functioning very well. The bed was so soft as well as the pillows. My mom and I loved sleeping in it. I wish there were more cable channels though. The breakfast items were delicious although the same every two days. We love the sausage and chocolate croissant. Oh, and the coffee too! The location of this hotel is the best part. It is just two a minute away from Euljiro-il ga station and less than minutes away from Myeongdong station. This part of Myeongdong is quiet but in just a few steps, you’ll get to be in the noisy and lively part of Myeongdong. Lotte Young is also very near. The bus stops are also near. If you want to take a taxi, the guard at the lobby will definitely help to get one. Note that it is kinda hard to get a normal taxi in Seoul as some taxi drivers are not fluent in English.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in their Shopper's Choice room for 7 nights in September.Location was superb with airport limousine bus stop within 5mins walk to hotel. Hotel is also very near subway and right smack in Myeongdong.Room is spacious and chambermaid does an excellent job in keeping the room clean everyday. Just a side note, would have been even more ideal if they can vacuum the room more frequently since ours is a week's long stay.Breakfast is also provided daily. Simple fare so nothing to rave about but kitchen staff is always around to ensure food is replenished.Staff are mostly friendly and helpful and most can speak good English. Highly recommend this hotel to everyone even families as they have family suite on level 2.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Strategic location at myeongdong with a Starbucks and 7eleven downstairs. Super convenient with 2 mins walk to famous myeongdong foodstreet. Hotel staff are super friendly and helpful. They speak English and Chinese. No language barrier. Special thanks to David who help us in the wheelchair and room reservation. Hotel has a wheelchair which we could bring it out during the trip for foc. Hotel is newly renovated, everything is so new and cozy. Breakfast provided foc if booked directly with hotel. Comes with local delight and western. Room booking with hotel comes with tax refund as well! Facilities are new and equipped.kids friendly hotel with play room and baby chair. We opt for the family twin room with both bathtub and shower booth.the room has 2 queen bed with luggage rack. Security guards are super friendly and helpful as well. Hotel has two lift, one accessible to the check in counter and the other one to the guess room and restaurant. Check in at level 9 with a restaurant for daily breakfast and guess room from level 2 onwards. Overall the family are happy and will definitely book again with this hotel when we visit Seoul again! Thanks Metro hotel for the wonderful experience during our stay in your hotel.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Metro hotel is in a great part of Myeongdong and was perfect for us. Sky Song was so helpful and accommodating with our last minute change in plans. The rooms are well decorated and plenty of room for us. I liked the decorative pillows so much, I tried to buy some of them. Wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Myeongdong!!
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel close to shopping, restaurants in the neighborhood. Clean and nice hotel in a good area of Seoul. Breakfast area at the top floor. And there is a Starbuck next door on street level. Walking distance to City Hall and the Royal Palace Garden. Can definitely imagine staying here next time visiting Seoul
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our 2nd time in Metro Hotel. We chose this hotel again 5 years after our 1st visit to Seoul because of it's great location, near bus stops and subways, and it's cleanliness. There have been major renovation done since we last stayed. The hotel has improved a lot since. Reception is on the 9th floor along with the breakfast area. This time, we stayed at the family twin room. The rooms are big. Bathroom is big too with a separate shower and bath tub. Location is excellent. Near the Myeongdong shopping area. This hotel is very near the restaurants that sells fried chicken! :) This is not a cheap hotel but I guess it's fairly priced. Staffs are friendly as well especially the security guards manning the front door. There is a 7-11 and starbucks within the building as well. The bbq meat restaurant beside the hotel serves superb korean bbq! :) And I'm going back to Seoul again next year, and because of our experience, we will be staying at the Metro Hotel again. See you next year, Metro Hotel!
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I picked the Metro Hotel in Myeongdong for its location and because it was a sensible price. I wasn't expecting too much as the photos on booking.com don't do it justice but I was pleasantly surprised.I got there very late as my flight from Shanghai was delayed by quite a few hours and the door/concierge had my key card for me and was very helpful and all of them friendly.The room was very clean, comfortable and efficient. They have a mobile phone called a "handy" that is fully charged to use for your entire stay. You can make local and some international calls on it and the Google maps is a godsend.The breakfast was simple but delicious, fresh baked bread and other continental bits.The subway is very nearby so it's an ideal position to get around Seoul.I really enjoyed staying there and plan to return in Oct when I am back (price dependent).I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed here for a number of years now. This year, I have particularly impressed by a few thoughtful services- Icy cold water after a day out, luggage service beyond the duration of my stay, and tax refund information. Staff are always very friendly and helpful. If I may point out one thing to improve, it is the room cleaning time. They came in to clean at around 6 pm when I came back from outing.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was overwhelmed with perfectness..It is in the of myeongdong shopping area. Lots of great food just outside the hotel. Near to train station. They have a connecting door to an emart that has an atm machine so it is easier to draw some cash. The staffs was so kind and helpful. Check in was fast. The room was clean tidy warm and quite spacious. Love love love this hotel ❤️❤️❤️❤️Definitely would be back again
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located next to Metro Station and close to the Shopping area. There is a Starbucks and 7eleven right Outside the Hotel which is very convenient. Hotel Staff is very friendly and helpful. Complimentary water bottle everyday and Shampoo,showergel
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Metro Hotel in June for a week and it was a pleasant experience. The room itself wasn't as big as what we are used to but we knew that prior to going that a lot of the hotel rooms can be smaller than average. Despite the size, the room was clean, fresh and catered to our needs. The rooms had complimentary water, tea and coffee, and also a fridge which was really handy. The best part was the complimentary smart phone provided in each room to make local calls and take out when exploring. It was great to book tickets for excursions on too! Breakfast was lovely. Simple but had everything what you could want in the morning. Toast, cereal with nuts and dried fruit, pastries, egg, tea/coffee, juice and they also had some of the Korean breakfast items which was good to try such as porridge, dumplings and soup.Free massage chair to use in the main lobby which was nice after a tiring day sightseeing.Fantastic location - we didn't need a taxi once and everyone was in walking distance. From supermarkets, shops, places to eat and drink and to the main metro/bus stations.On our last day, we missed breakfast due to our airport transfer so the hotel gave us a little bag with pastries and juice - lovely touch!Highly recommend!
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel at the heart of Myeongdong. Book with them directly will provide free simple breakfast. Walking to Eulji-Ro 1 Station in 5 minutes. So many traditional restaurants in Myeongdong. Good for family travelers.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Metro Hotel is a great choice for individuals or families: super clean and well organized rooms and common areas; friendly and helpful staff; delicious breakfast; and centrally located to shopping, sites and public transportation. Being a couple blocks off the main streets provides a very welcomed quiet ambiance too. Would definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was extraordinary! The staff were so helpful to us and guided us and all of our needs during our visit. The rooms were well designed with a great aesthetic and made us feel comfortable after a long day in the city. It’s central location made it easy for us to get to all of the sites and is in the heart of Seoul. We will definitely stay here when we come back again with the family. Thank you for making our trip memorable and making us feel at home.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in down town Seoul, walking distance to popular shopping areas and easy access to subway and other public transportation. Staff are very friendly and want to assist you in anyway possible. Rooms are modern, but still feel like home, are a good size and clean.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in meungdong. It’s so comfortable to go shopping or eating and it’s near by railway station you can go to travel in other tourist attraction. In bedroom is pretty large and cute decoration. Very nice receptionist.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here last April 2018 with my mom and sister. Clean, comfy family friendly hotel with very nice staff (always smiling and ready to give assistance...also a big shout-out to their friendly hotel security officers). Location is excellent, 5 minute walk to Eujiro 1ga sta. line #2, 2 blocks away from 6015 airport shuttle bus stop (infront of Ibis hotel), inside the building is 7-11 and Starbucks. Located near the center of Myeongdong shopping area and 5 minute walk to tourist information center.They have a hearty breakfast and a free handy data based smart phone that you can use for your entire stay. The room is big enough to accommodate the 3 of us. The toilet is clean with smart heated toilet seat. Would definitely stay again and recommend this hotel!Tip: if you book your room through their official website you get a complimentary breakfast and a tax refund. Going to Seoul South Korea? 1. Book your room direct to the official website of hotels that offer tax refund. 2. Stay in Myeongdong area3. Check if airport shuttle bus or airport limousine (KAL bus) bus stop is near your hotel of choice or if your hotel is included in the airport shuttle bus route. This is the most convenient way to travel to and from the airport if you have a lot of luggage.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall a good hotel at a reasonable price. Excellent location, tasty breakfast, comfortable bed and powerful shower. However, there is some noise (we was on the 3rd floor) from people smoking outside the restaurants opposite the hotel and as previously stated some of the rooms are very small. Other issues we had was noisy neighbours heard through extremely thin walls. I suppose what I was disappointed about is on our first morning, we told the duty manager that our fridge door was literally falling off, she was extremely apologetic (not that she needed to be) and assured us it would be fixed (A small job, tightening of a screw), yet this did not get fixed for the duration of our stay. Small things matter, do what you say you are going to do.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: Located very close to Euljiro 1(il)-ga metro station on metro line 2 (Blue line). The nearest exit is Exit 5, which also lift discreetly located at the basement level. The hotel is located at thje intersection of Myeongdong 9ga-gil and Myeongdong 3ga-gil (see photo). The closest access to walking from Euljiro 1(il)-ga metro station is via Myeongdong 3ga-gil which is between Hyundai Motors building and Starbucks on either side of the road, leading from exit 5 of the station. Although it is difficult to navigate with luggage, the fastest and the cheapest access from either Gimpo or the other airport is by Arex express train with one interchange (to Line 2) at Hongik University Station. The hotel is also located within walking distance to major Department Stores such as Lotte and others. The hotel is also located near many underground shopping areas associated with three metro stations scattered around the area. There are also many quality restaurants , eateries and street food vendors within walking distance from the hotel. Amenities: There is a small Gym with a treadmill, weight machine and a Cross Trainer with two televisions. The Room had a small fridge and coffee making facilities. It had a security deposit box, and a hair dryer. There is also a laundry and dryer facilities (with self cash payment, detergent dispensers) and free ironing facilities in the 7th floor. Wi-Fi system worked very well. The Television had Korean, BBC and CNN services.Reception/Service: The hotel reception is located at the highest level and can be accessed via an lift directly running only to two other floors. The guest rooms can only be accessed via a second lift with security sensor card. Practically all the staff we came across and Sarah Do in particular spoke good english, very polite and helpful. Sarah went all out to solve a problem we had with our pre-paid Sim mobile service. Cleanliness: Extremely good. Breakfast/Restaurant: The breakfast was included in our package and we also received a VAT Refund Invoice from the hotel. Breakfast had both western and eastern variety and had a very good balance.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a Family Twin room from 25 - 29 May as my friends strongly recommended this hotel due to the convenient location, cleanliness and friendly service. My daughters like this hotel and we all felt very comfortable staying here. The room is equipped with an air humidifer (it's very helpful to prevent dryness in the room) and an air cooler. However there is room for improvement for air conditioning as sometimes we felt warm even though it was set at 18 degrees as the aircon vent cannot be adjusted. The hotel provides only shampoo, shower gel, toothbrush and toothpaste. It will be great if they provide body lotion too. The coin washer and dryer on 7th floor are easy to use, but there is only one each. Cost KRW3,000 for washing, KRW3,000 for drying, KRW500 for detergent and fabric softener sheet. Breakfast was simple but sufficient. Taxi fare from hotel to Incheon airport cost KRW65,000, hassle free as security was helpful to load all baggages in. Need to inform front desk one day in advance to book a taxi. It's worth if you have 3 or more travellers as the airport limousine bus ticket fare is KRW14,000 each. Overall very satisfied with this hotel.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great. 5 mins walk from the airport bus stop and 3 mins way from Euljiro 1-ga Subway Station. Good food at Myeongdong is not far away and there is 7-11 and starbucks at the same hotel building. Breakfast spread is simple but every dish taste great. Front desk staff and security guards were friendly. Stayed in the comfort twin room and it was very spacious. We could open our 3 large luggage easily. Would certainly come back again.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the comfort twin room for 7 nights with breakfast. Bedroom was very spacious for 2 pax and the bathroom was good. Our beds were on tatami platform. There were a few nights whereby my neighbours upstairs created lots of noise on the tatami platform. Do note this if you're a light sleeper. Only issue with the room was there were not enough power plugs for me to charge my stuff. There were western/korean options for breakfast. Choices were not alot, but the food was delicious. There's a massage chair at the lobby as well. You can also bring your food and eat at the pantry at level 2. Hotel is located at a slightly quieter area in Myeongdong, and less than 5 mins walk from Euljiro 1 ga metro station. You can reach the hotel by taking airport bus 6015 and alight at Ibis Ambassador hotel.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The reviews for this hotel did not disappoint. My family and I stayed first week of April this year. Our flight was delayed so we arrived past midnight at the airport. Fortunately, we were able to catch the last limousine bus to get to the city (Stop at the Ibis Hotel drop, turn left at the corner, then left again). We had had no issues with check-in even though we had previously informed the hotel that we would arrive around 10:30pm. The security at the 1st floor warmly greeted us and oriented my family of the room amenities (Family Suite Room at the 2nd floor) while I was filling out the forms. The room was very clean and spacious for 4 persons. Plus, it had cellphone which we could take out and use for international calls and the internet. Breakfast was also excellent. We loved that they changed the menu everyday but retained the staples (rice, bread, meat, eggs, fruits, juice, coffee!). The location of the hotel was likewise great. Walking distance to almost all the sites including the Myeongdong Cathedral and subway. The staff (especially the online booking and security at the 1st floor) were very helpful and hands-on with everything from directions, transport options, and in getting our refund for our T-money cards. We weren't able to get their names but kudos to them! Our family is already looking forward to staying at this hotel again.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A small friendly hotel. All clean neat and tidy. The inclusive breakfast was really good and filled us up with a range of choices, Korean and Western. Senny at the front desk is super informative and helpful.Location was perfect for my meetings and shopping and getting around the on the Metro. Highly recommended. We paid for the larger room at the corner. I enjoyed looking out from the 2nd floor lounge area.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in myeongdong, and near to train station. However, not many taxi drivers know about this hotel and i would advise that you keep a printed copy/hotel card (in Korean) and show it to the drivers. The room is of average size, but i am impressed that it has a water bidet. They also provided an ikea drawer to put your stuff in (most probably to compensate for the small wardrobe). The air conditioner is right smack on top of the bed, and they also provide black circular stickers if the lights coming from the aircond unit annoys you while you sleep. The tv channels aren't much to enjoy since the only English programme is BBC and some other documentary. Bed is super comfortable, and has power sockets on each side.Plus points is that they also provide a laundry room with a coin operated washer and dryer. They also have steam iron and ironing board in the room.One thing i found weird is that upon arriving to my floor, the door to the room is already wide open. This is somehow a little bit disturbing, since it involves safety and security.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is right smack in the middle of the action. So convenient to watch the Nanta show, shop and eat as much and as late as you want, minutes away from train station and airport bus stop. We had the family room which was huge but only had a tiny window with a nice view of a wall. Nevertheless, it was very clean and modern and so were the bathrooms. Beds were comfortable and relaxing that, coupled with the lack of daylight, we overslept more than usual. Breakfast came with the room and was yummy. I especially liked their sweet rosemary toast and the nice sun-filled breakfast room. It’s true, we tend to be more grateful for the things we lack. Staff were efficient and cheerful, laundry room was super useful. The lounge room, and playroom could definitely use a few hours of cleaning but we never saw anyone use it except us. Not even the staff. All in all, it’s good value for money and would highly recommend to others.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the location is super good.TheSubway is 2 mins awaya and within walking distance one can walk to cityhall station.one can just walk and turn to myengdong night market .i am so impressed by the travel buddy handphone provided for us free..just bring it out to call internatinally or google maps..the room although small but good enough for 2 ppl.i should have ordered breakfast together as i heard the breakfast is quite good.the tv programmes are majority in korean.news from BBC CNN no other movie channels for chinese who do not understand english or korean.In Jeju 3 star hotel i am so happy they have so many selections of programmes including chinese english.I will highly recommend this hotel to those who are on a budget.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location, right in the heart of the shopping and dining district. We discovered a street food festival only a couple of blocks away that starts around 5 pm every day. The food there was fantastic, and it was fun being part of the crowd wandering through looking at the offerings. While it is located in a thriving pedestrian area, it wasn't a noisy location. Our room was comfortable, the staff were friendly and helpful, and it was a good deal. Overall I'm satisfied with our choice to stay here and would definitely do so again.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 8 nights in a Deluxe Queen room and the experience is awesome!Overall rating for the hotel is perfect:1. location wise, there is 2 train stations within walking distance (Myeongdong station and Euljiro 1-ga station). There is also a few mart nearby and a 7-11 downstairs for purchasing groceries. Aside Starbucks located on GF, there is also a Coffee join located just right opposite hotel. 2. Breakfast wise - Simple but yet amazing, the croissants and OJ are good! They have alternate menus - if one day its Asian style guests can enjoy congee and japchae (korean stir fry noodle) or rice balls, on the next day bacons might be served. Standard breakfast options (cereal, toast, croissant plus a plate of toufu?) are available all time. 3. Service wise 1- Laundry service located on 7F is open between 8am and 1030pm. Both washing machine and dryer each cost 3000 won. 1 pack (laundry powder plus 1 linen softener for dryer) cost 500 won. You can either use 500 won coins or 1000 won notes only for both machines. There is a notes to coins converting machine in the room which is very handy. The entire cycle from washing to drying takes about an hour plus - about 45 for washing and 30 for dryer. 4. Service wise 2 - Printing facilities available also on lobby 9F. From memory it cost 300 won per A4 page.5. Service wise 3 - The lovely girls at lobby 9F helped us booked a cab to Incheon since we've got an early morning flight - it costed 65,000 won and credit cards accepted. The girls have also helped us booked the Hancook restaurant at N Seoul tower. Hotel lobby on 9F also has T-money available for sale and they also offer top ups (cash only). If you prefer more fancy / cuter T-money card try the 7-11 downstairs ( we got the cute Brown and Cony T- money card there).6. Service wise 4 - Terrace Lounge on 2F. There is microwave available - we've used them a couple of times making cup noodles and it feels good having hot food in winter and this wont stink our room!Ps:1. if could, book directly with the hotel as the rates offered for early birds could beat other third-person websites. As others mentioned, book directly with hotel as they offer complimentary breakfast. We booked our room in late November knowing our travel period might be peak due to the Winter Olympics.2. Ask for a local map during check in. Although the handy phone in the room comes in handy, it is also good to have a hard copy on hand (: 3. There is a foldable luggage rack underneath the bed. We noticed it only on the second day of our stay lol.
hotelName:
28    Metro Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's easy to reach from the train station. the hotel looks new, modern, the rooms are big and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The price is good. For the breakfast there is a starbucks in front of the hotel. The hotel's restaurant is always full and at the end they don't have a lot of thing.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is easily reached on foot from the Seoul Station. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Brewpub and pizza place on the first floor is a bonus, and both were good. The price we paid was unbelievably affordable.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean room, hotel location and a very good reception service he restaurant on the lower floor gave her a low grade in terms of service and food. As I mentioned the hotel is in a central and comfortable place recommended.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is not really good value for the money. It's located near Seoul station but I had a hard time to find the hotel and took my big luggage to the steps. The room was big enough and the beds are comfy but the room condition is little old. I would stay other hotel with the money.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, so easy to get to areas like Namdaemun market and Myeongdong! Super cool bar and restaurant downstairs and staff are alright. Air con is noisy though! And there is construction around the area which isn’t that bad.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its good and I will recommend my friends.But be careful with the choice of your room, because rooms on the north side are very noisy. There is a construction site behind the hotel. So you have to choose the rooms on the Seoul Ro side.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Modern hotel with large rooms with good storage, big bathroom with strong water pressure in shower. Food on lower floors. Really nice bar. Friendly staff and room cleaned and replenished each day. Quiet. Basically located on the Skywalk. Minutes from Seoul Station via the Skywalk. Super easy. Out exit 2 (metro station side), down the stairs, turn left. Walk past DMZ museum to either circular stairway or elevator. Up to Skywalk and left. Enjoy the scenery as you head to the hotel.This has become my go to hotel for the above reasons as well as the proximity to both Seoul and Hoehyeon stations and Namdaemun Market.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is near Metro station and easy to find. You can walk to Myeongdong only 15 minutes. You can find restaurant near the hotel. Staff is friendly but the hotel's decoration is old and the wardrobe is obsolete. Overall , the price is acceptable.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location and connected to Seoul Station via Seoullo 7017. Amenities in room are sufficient, clean rooms and good wifi. Check in and check out process was simple and very fast. They even give coupons for guest to use at the outlets below. Room are even equipped with referigerator and the TV even have English programs.As there are construction nearby, they even provide earplugs for guest who needs it. But i did not even hear the construction probably due to my room location facing the another side which I appreciated very much (+ amazing view of Seoullo 7017)
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent, comfortable stay at affordable price. Room is well kept and clean, location well connected to Seoul station, lots of shopping around the hotel and eating place. Overall a good experience with this hotel
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient location, we took the airport express to Seoul station. 15 minutes walk on the 7017 footbridge to hotel. 15 minutes walk from hotel to Myeongdong. 5 minutes walk from hotel to Hoehyeon metro station. Staffs are helpful, speak very good English! Although the hotel is close to the busy roads, we had good rest on every night. Sound-proofing is great in the room. We stayed in a triple bedroom, spacious for three people with large luggages. The rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable. Toiletries are well provided, apart from toothpaste and toothbrush! Free beverages (water & teabags) are generously refilled. They also have a restaurant on -1/F level that serves fried chicken and hand-crafted beers which is quite popular during the lunchtime. Overall, we had a pleasant stay at the hotel and would definitely recommend to others!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are comfortable and quite clean. The staffs are very friendly, helpful and informative. The location is very strategic, very near from Seoul station, so make it easy for travelers to enjoy their vacation.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel location is near to Seoul train station and also to the open market. It is only a walking distance. A lot of souvenirs and foods you can get from the market. Overall the hotel room is clean and tidy. I really enjoyed the automatic toilets..thumps up!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place and easy to access to everywhere such as Seoul stn , Myeongdong, Ikseondong , hongik area.If want to travel outside of seoul, this hotel is closely with Seoul stn and just walk 5-10 mins from hotel.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel located a walk distance to Seoul station which one of the main stop for almost all the subway/bullet train. The new pedestrian overhead bridge that linked to hotel level 2 make convenience access to hotel guest
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In a good location near Seoul station for travel both within and outside of Seoul. Room is a good size and is easy to manage two large suitcases with it. Slept really well each night. I would definitely consider staying in this hotel again next time I visit!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Within walking distance to most of the tourist spots. Good facilities and friendly staff. Stayed in triple room with amazing view of Seoullo 7017 and Seoul Station. About 7 minutes walk from exit 1 or 2 of Seoul Station, cross the road and take the escalator to Seoullo 7017 which is connected directly to the hotel.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's connected to Seoullo 7017. Lobby is on the 2nd floor. It's a healthy walk away (about a kilometer or so) from the Seoul Station, Lotte Outlets, Namdaemun Market, convenience stores, a station away from Myeongdong. The hotel reception staff are helpful. Secured elevator access via room key. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Discount coupons were offered for establishments within the Hotel building and those nearby Seoullo 7017. Wish breakfast was also included.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel, right next to the Seoul Station. Clean, easy to locate and friendly staff. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who is having a quick stay in Seoul and needs to get back to Incheon Airport quickly. Rooms are very clean and it's only a 5-7 minute walk from Seoul Train Station via the elevated walk way/bridge. One thing I do have to note a hopefully the hotel staff can look into it, is that the guestroom toilet (well at least ours) made noise even when you are not using them. Even with the bathroom door closed you can still hear it. It's not a major discomfort but if you are a light sleeper it might just do the trick. Overall, I would recommend this place.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel. The reception is small but sufficient. The staffs are helpful and friendly. The room is a standard size room with good bed and decent size bathroom. There is enough room to move around as well as space for luggages. The elevated walkway is so convenient. If you stay in this hotel, you can take the lift up to the elevated walkway at Seoul station. It is a short walk to the hotel entrance. The lift is located ust before exit 6 or 7. We stayed in this hotel as we want to be close to the station. The market is also a short walk away and there are so many restaurants around the area. We did see some development at the back but we had a room away from it so it was not noisy. This a good hotel to stay.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean, bright and decent, we had a pleasant stay. Hotel is very near to subway station which we can get to anywhere conveniently. Check in and out process was very fast and simple. It was a safe neighborhood around the hotel.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very helpful, especially Cathy Yu was extraordinarily wonderful and whatever question we had from where to eat to what was the best way to get to Seoul Tower, she would find the answer!We had a problem with the WiFi, and when we called the front desk in five minutes the technicians were at our room and fixed it right away.There is a direct entrance from the Seoullo 7017 elevated walkway which starts at the Seoul Station Plaza (look for the entrance to the Hotel labelled "Seoulista" on the elevated walkway). When you leave Seoul instead of rolling you bags across the elevated walkway and then across Seoul Plaza to the main entrance to Seoul Station and then up the escalator to the entrance (or alternatively if the escalator which seems to be turned off if it rains) up many many stairs, just get a taxi to the back side of Seoul Station across from Sowha Children's Hospital, where you can get an elevator directly down to Level B2 where you can get the Airex train back to Incheon Airport AND if you are flying on Asiana or Korean Airlines you can check in for your flight, check your bags and clear immigration before boarding the Airex Train.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There’s a bridge connecting the hotel to Seoul station which is very convenient. Room is comfortable but not very spacious - comfortable walking space if 2 medium luggages are opened up. Would definitely be back!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was small, but clean. Housekeeping was done every morning during our stay. Got some discount coupon for Soeulista from the reception. Hotel is close to Namdamun Market, metro stations, train station and many other attractions and places. From check-in to check-out, everything was smooth. We will stay at Hotel Manu again when we visit Seoul.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From Incheon Airport, we took the late midnight bus and reached Seoul Station at 3AM. We got off at Platform 3 right in front of Lotte Outlet. We just crossed the street, walked towards the left in the Yonsei University Severance area, walked towards Hotel Manu, right beside a gasoline station. It was a 10 to 15 minute walk for an osteoarthritic person like me. The check- in was fast and easy. We were given a room on the 10th floor facing a construction site. We requested a room facing the street or Seoullo 7017, the request was immediately granted. It felt so good to see a very clean room, toilet & linens after a tiring and sleepless flight.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bed is a little too hard and pillows are too soft. Hotel Manu will be close to perfect if you can fix these. Close to all transport options including Airport Bus and Seoul Station. Close to huge market and street shopping area. Don’t have to go far for shopping experience!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel. Comfy bed and good room size, very clean. Awesome location with easy access by walkway to Seoul station. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. The restaurant was fabulous. Highly recommend this hotel. A+
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was on a business trip and had the opportunity to visit Seoul for a day. Manu Hotel Seoul was a good option, because it is based just outside Seoul Station (Walking distance), near a busy asian market and on the edge of Seouls historic center.The hotel offers small but comfortable rooms. The rooms have a minibar with only water in it. You can have a drink, breakfast or small meals in the pub under the hotel 'Seoulista'. Breakfast for 9,000 won. WIFI functions well and the beds are comfortable. Everything is very clean. People are friendly and English spoken.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time to stay at Manu hotel. I also visit Seoulistar pub in the first floor many times even I don’t stay at Manu, because Seoulista is the best pub in korea. The Best beers, food and the crews are waiting for you all!! Enjoy staying in Manu Korea!!!!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location location very nice hotel quiet close to seoul station clean rooms nice staff great value nice area close to lots of restaurants and main landmarks 45 min train ride from the airport very safe area.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Within walking distance of Seoul Station and direction connection to the Seoul Skygarden. Decent food options and staff was excellent. The hotel and room was very clean and modern however the mattress was a bit too hard for my taste. But overall very good.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, love how it is so near Seoul Station. And the night view of Seoullo 7017 is so beautiful. The cleanliness of the room is up to standard, staffs are very polite & friendly. Definitely tourist-friendly because they can speak (good) English!! The only downside is that the rooms are a little small, but it's fine!!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my 3rd time staying in this hotel. It has a complete makeover on the lobby area and the reception. Even though no breakfast is provided like before I still enjoyed the great atmospheres. It is a lovely walk at the walkway in the evenings to Lotte mart. Great choice to stay
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here during my recent vacation in Seoul. Hotel is very near to Seoul Station and you can use both the underground and elevated walkway (Seoullo) to reach the hotel. Take the AREX from Incheon and at upon reaching Seoul Station follow signs to the Subway. From the subway station you can just exit 7 or 8 - 7 is at the side of the hotel. There are restaurants on the GF and you’ll be given discount coupons upon checkin. The hotel is relatively new so there are decent facilities. Hotel amenities are standard. TV has cable with English channels. Few dining options nearby, with a Starbucks and GS25 convenience store across the road. There’s also a 7-11 store about 5 minutes away. Myeong-dong is about 10-15 away, but can be easily reached by bus. Highly recommended hotel, will definitely stay here again when I’m in town
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Accessible to Seoul Station and connected to the Seoullo 7017. Shopping centers are also nearby. Room and toilet are designed well. Compact and comfortable rooms. Bay windows with seating are nice, my grandchild enjoyed this space will definitely go back.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the best stay in the hotel, and I would love to go back there again. The hotel room had its own high speed wifi, I was happy about it. The hotel staff were nice and friendly. They served excellent breakfast!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got home back to my country this morning and realise I had left a pouch in the opened safe within my hotel room. The pouch contained my house keys, credit cards, cash, watch etc.I emailed Hotel Manu about this and they responded within minutes - which is great, but this also made me think that my pouch may have just been sitting there and no one bothered to contact me. I checked out in the morning but I picked up my luggage from there in the evening (8pm flight) and no one bothered to informed me even though I was back at reception. In the email response, Hotel Manu simply noted that they have found my pouch (contents TBC） and they can’t send it so I’ll need to organise a Fedex myself even though I offered to paid for them to organise it for me. I’m still trying to get specific answers so I can organise the Fedex courier e.g. whether the Fedex courier should come to reception to pick up my items at a specific time. All I got, was that Fedex is an international service(duh!) and I can go online to org one.As you can see in the screen shots of the email comms, they aren’t really helpful or seem to care at all so if you’re looking for a place that will go the extra mile for you when things go wrong, Hotel Manu is not the place to go to. This has still not yet been resolved and I’ll update my post when I hear from the hotel.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love the location. Very near LOTTE for last minute souvenir shopping. Also very near myeongdong and namdaemun. The connecting skybridge is really cool and the view of it at night is very nice. Room was clean and spacious.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week and everything was great! The hotel is well located (5 minutes from Seoul Station) and very clean. You can find a bar and a restaurant at the ground floor which is very convenient. Also there is a Starbucks and a small near the hotel. We recommend Manu Hotel if you visit Seoul!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stay here for 10 nights. it close to seoul station which is the center to everywhere. take another exit , the one that not to the underground but make a turn to avoid the homeless people. I can't bear the smell. they only come to sleep around 7pm - 5AM.you can walk to namdaemun market ,hyoyeon station, seoul station and bus station to everywhere. despite the perfect location, the hotel itself has a comfortable room, some cafe or restaurant downstairs. the staff is friendly to greet good morning, afternoon every time we walk past. I have recommend my sister and other friends and will definitely return to hotel manu if i visit seoul.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found this hotel closely matched to my needs and desires. Very good location, near the main railroad station, nice room, and good service suited me nicely. I would happily return for another stay. PO.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked this hotel as the rooms were very clean and provided us with everything we needed. The staff was friendly. There were a couple restaurants downstairs which was very convenient. The Location of this Hotel was very good as well, it is located next to Seoullo, not far from Seoul Station as well as Hoehyeon Subway.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very convenient walking to shopping centre and traffic terminal such as Seoul terminal. Several view point like Seoul Tower is very near. However, some room is noise with the air-condition system inside.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got a vey vey special offer for this hotel and reserved it without hesitation. The room was clean, new and comfortable. Location is perfect, close to the market and station but not noisy. Good stay.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose the hotel primarily for the location and the good value and was not disappointed. Stayed in a twin room as a solo traveller and was very pleased with everything. The room was large enough for two and very comfortable. The people on reception were very helpful and provided me with maps, directions or any other help that I needed.The location is about 10 mins walking from Seoul station, 5 mins walk along the same road to Namdaemun Market and a further 10 mins along the road to Myeongdong shopping district. It is also less than 10 mins walk around the corner to the Seoul City Wall Sungnyemun (Namdeamun) Gate.I would recommend.There are two ways to get to the hotel from the station. The easiest if it is not raining is as follows.Come out of the AREX and go up the escalators to the main station where the KTX is, turn right and walk to Exit Gate 1.You will see a big red building across the road and to the left an overhead walkway over the road.Come out of the exit, go down the escalator to street level and walk across all the zebra crossings towards the red building.When you have no more zebras in front of you (you will be across the road from the red building) turn left, walk towards the overhead bridge and you will come to a zebra at the corner of the red building, and if you look across to the overhead walkway you will see a glass enclosed escalator.Cross the roads, go up the escalator onto the walkway, turn right and walk along about 75 yards and on the left you will see a small bridge from the walkway over the road which leads to the entrance to the hotel reception.If it is raining and you want to use the underpass take Exit Gate 2 and walk about 50 yards following the signs for subway lines 1 and 4.Go down the escalators until you reach the ticket machines and gates and turn left, you need exit 7.Keep walking until you reach a smaller number of ticket machines on your left and just past that there is a tunnel on the right signposted exit 7. Go down there and when you reach a fork go left.When you reach the stairs take the right hand one up to street level.Keep walking straight until you see the overhead bridge leading from the overhead walkway to the hotel and either take the lift up or walk up he stairs.I went back to the station at 5.30am and all the homeless had been moved on, there was none there.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is approx. 15-20 mins walk from Seoul Station. The room is small; the bay windows are not designed for maximum space efficiency. The shower pressure is fantastic. The air con unit had a humming noise and, at higher fan, the noise was louder, which disturbed our sleep a bit.We like the adapter-like sockets in the room but at least 1 more socket is better.Reception staff is efficient, friendly and kind. They guided us on our daily travel plans.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Manu is right by the station and in a great location. Rooms are pretty spacious, I stayed in a standard double room and it was bigger than the hotel I stayed at in myeongdong. They have a gym, a massage center, a bar and food downstairs. Convience store was right across the hotel in another building. Just ask front desk and they will provide you more info. Also service was very impeccable! Front desk is very English friendly and housekeepers do a great job cleaning and even go out of their way to accommodate you and greet you. Compared to other hotels we stayed at they also had the most TV channels and guides. Very pleased with our hotel and will highly recommended!!!!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is excellent for travellers who wheel their own luggage. Innovative design and all you want and nothing you don't want. Escalators and lift to elevated walkway access to hotel is visible from Seoul Station.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and modern hotel with comfortable beds. Very close to the train station and walking distance to all attractions. Would stay here again. First floor has a couple different restaurants/cafes and the hotel provides you with some coupons. The breakfast at the cafe was quite good! Try the grapefruit tea!
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean and great the space was good considering the other 3 star hotels in seoulThe location is amazing everything is near myong-dong, dong-daemun, insadong and other location like namsan tower and soPrice was very affordable for 6 days trip
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a room on the 4th floor, facing Seullo Terrace. The location was optimal, right down the road from Seoul station with connections to anywhere you would like to go. My room was very comfortable, and I could not hear visitors in the other rooms, so it was quiet too! The staff were wonderful, always so friendly and willing to help me. The hotel is right down the road from Namdaemun Market, which was one of my favourite places to wander around. It was very easy to find the hotel again after wandering through the streets, since it is such a central location.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel EXCEPT there is only one electrical outlet in the room far away from the bed. Closest exit at Seoul station is #7 where a lot of homeless sleep later in the night. Construction happening next door as of May 2018 but that didn’t bother us. Bar/Resto on the first floor was happening if you want to fly to Korea to eat pizza. Service was very good. Wine opener at the front desk. Found a nice bottle of cab at the convenience store close by for $13. Starbucks across the street. There is an old overpass that has been turned into a pedestrian walkway to Seoul station with some cool artwork and no homeless. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're looking for great location, this one is highly recommended. Just don't expect too much for the hotel itself base on the price, because it is just ordinary, interior room are just simple, and the lobby is small.
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Manu Seoul located at the excellent spot. Highly recommend. Only disadvantage is a construction site nearby the hotel. Even on Sunday morning, construction work happened a bit noise. Hotel provide ear plug for guests which is very nice
hotelName:
29    Hotel Manu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
